campaign_city: San Juan, Puerto Rico, United States Minor Outlying Islands

story:
"Today, I will build a game." That is what I told myself one day. And so I did.

That was 15 months ago. Today, our team (of which half are volunteers), comprises of passionate people who have been hard at work creating a strategy war game which we would like to play. Just on art alone, we have more than 20 contributors who have seen the value of our work and have chipped in. Today, we have completed the prototype, and we want to share the fruit of our labor with the gaming community. 

We present to you... Dragonlord Supremacy, our humble PC Strategy War Game!

But let’s turn back the clock and I will tell you the origins of this project.  Some years back, I met Lady Antiva.  I was trying to put together an Arthurian universe.  We chatted, and continue to chat some more.  Then the unexpected happened!  She took the plunge and went ahead to create an entire series built upon the death of King Arthur in chapter 1, and spun off a whole new world. 

Enviously for me, but happy for her, Lady Antiva's ebooks are now on Amazon.com.  She was kind enough to help me write the script for ‘Episode 1: Blue Bastion’, and to release a brand new eNovel in conjunction with my game!  How cool is that?  Long live Lady Antiva!

On to the game design, and where all the hard work began...

  • We had very earlier on decided that the story-driven, quest-driven strategy must offer a different experience from all the games out there.  For the first 6 months, we scoured the world for folks to help us in art, design and consulted widely.  A local school NYP pitched in, and their interns helped us with the coding using their ‘Supremacy’ game engine
  • Over the next 9 months, we clunked together a playable demo with the help of the Games Solution Centre and Camelot Hobbies, and we have since submitted the game demo to IGF under the ‘Indie Category’, and judging is now underway.  Super-cool if we get picked to be a finalist, and blistering stupendous if we win an award!


  • We have put in place all that is needed to create this game, and we now seek the community to help us take the game to launch.  The first few quests have been completed and included as part of the demo.  The founders are committed to complete the 1st Episode 'Blue Bastion' and seek your help to get the word out and to complete and release this episode by November 2014.
  • With your contribution, we will be able to achieve the following: (a) release episode 1 to you,  (b) work on episode 2 'Green Gridlock',  (c) release the game on iPads and Android tablets,  (d) work on more episodes as a stretch target.

This is our life-quest, and we need your support to make our dream a reality!  What’s more, when you ‘share’ this campaign on your Facebook, you will get early access to the Game Demo.

Read on to find out about our ‘Share-it, Test-it, Change-it’ outreach.

Dragonlord Supremacy Overview

Dragonlord Supremacy is a turn-based strategy game of medieval conquest set in King Arthur’s era. You are a Dragonlord of Queen Morgana who is tasked to take the lands using whatever means necessary. Besides attempting quests to advance the storyline, the gameplay’s unique border management allows players to strategize campaigns that will ultimately affect their progress. Game AI will fill the hex map with constant challenges that make the protection your avatar and units a never-ending dare, as you build, deploy, attack and bribe your way to victory!

Unlike many strategy war games that require players to spend an inordinate amount of time on resource gathering, in order to build and buy - this game allows you to employ strategies around border enlargement and connection!  Extend your allied settlements by building bastions to stretch the perimeters of your territory, and strike fear in your opponents!

The game is turn-based with 2 phases per turn for the player, namely Orders Phase and Reinforcement Phase.  In Orders Phase, players can Move Units, Build Bastion (using Guardians), Pack Settlement (using Cavaliers), Hire a Hero, Attack enemy/settlement or Seek Diplomacy from Settlement.  In Reinforcement Phase, players use gold to obtain new combat or diplomatic units.

Move Units: Players can move both combat and diplomatic/hero units subject to their movement points.  Up to 3 combat units can be stacked on a single hex. 

Build Bastion: Players can use a Guardian unit to build a bastion to expand is territory on a hex to connect his borders.  Bastions can be upgraded for units to be deployed there directly during the reinforcement phase.

Pack Settlement: Players can move an entirely settlement by 1 hex per turn using a Cavalier unit.

Hire Heroes: Players may hire heroes to aid combat, but mostly heroes carry special quests that must be performed in order for the player to advance the storyline towards completing the game.

Combat: Different units can be used to attack enemy and NPC units, and also settlements.  The attack and defence stats are compared after determining if a hit is successful, and damage is dealt accordingly.  A dice roll aids to add some randomness to the ‘hit’ ability.  This game has an 'old school' pen-n-paper, or board game feel to it, something not common these days.

Diplomacy:  Gold is used in seeking alliance with settlements by a Diplomatic Unit and dice rolls are used as a chance factor, alongside hostility rating of the settlement.


What we need & What you get

Here's how your contribution will be utilized for the Break project in more detail:

  • The first $5,000 will go towards completing Episode 1: Blue Bastion. As you can see from the video of the actual gameplay, the Demo is already done! 
  • The next $10,000 will go towards building Episode 2: Green Gridlock.  We have created the necessary engine codes, modules, art etc so that the process of developing episode 2 will go on without any hiccups!
  • At the same time, we know there are gamers out there who would like to play this game on their iPads and Android tablets.  Because we have coded the game in Cocos2D-x, we are confident that the port to these platforms will work just fine.  We need an additional $12,000 to achieve this.
  • Finally, every $10,000 hereafter will go towards the creation of 2 more episodes, in cooperation with backers. The team believes in sharing the fruit of our work with you, the superfans!

We have a range of unique perks just for you, our ardent supporters!  Please have a look :)

    Because of our commitment to this life-quest, even if we do not reach our targets, we will continue to work on this game, though this means we can only work on it after office-hours and weekends.  But we will not rest till it is done!  Lady Antiva took a 2 year hiatus from work, scrimping and saving to release 'The Camelot Prophecies' ebook series, and the founders must emulate her generosity and determination!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Check out our perks and be as generous a backer as you can – stand up and be counted! 

    Fly on the wings of a dragon and help us get the word out through our outreach: ‘Share-it, Test-it, Change-it’ 



    • Share It: ‘LIKE’ our facebook page & SHARE’ this campaign link! We will post the dropbox link for the Blue Bastion Demo after the campaign ends!
    • https://www.facebook.com/pages/Supremacy/248789225247973

    • Test It: Post a selfie with you completing the demo at the end-game ‘Thank You’ page and join our Facebook Group as a Game Tester at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/299585423560122/  We will credit you on our Credit Roll as ‘QA Tester’!

    • Change It:  Give us comments how to make the game better, and if your comment is implemented, we will add your name on our Credit Roll as ‘Game Curator’!

    Help us make some noise about our campaign and get us in the news!


    Release Green Gridlock upon reaching $15,000 mark

    Once we have completed and shipped 'Blue Bastion' to all backers in Nov 2014, the team will proceed to code Episode 2: Green Gridlock.  We hope to achieve backing of $15,000 so that the funding received can go towards the realizing of perks for naming rights and art rights of 'Green Gridlock'.  In case this target is not met, we will still commit to release a 'special edition' that will be shipped to backers at Benefactor tier and higher.

    Release Android and iOS version upon reaching the $21,000 (iPad) and $27,000 (Android Tablet) mark respectively

    Dragonlord Supremacy is designed with multi-platform in mind from the onset.  The current build is for the PC platform.  The user interface has been optimized for use on Apple iPads and tablets that run on the Android operating system.  The team estimated that it will cost $6,000 for Development and QA each per platform.

    Release 2 more episodes of Dragonlord Supremacy upon reaching the $37,000 and $47,000 mark respectively

    Dragonlord Supremacy is designed as an episodic game based on the story grid which Lady Antiva has drafted.  The storyline comprise both linear and concurrent events, allowing for the narrative to flow smoothly, diverge where necessary and then merge back for episodic transition. To be prudent, the team has budgeted $10,000 per episode to be developed.


    Risks & Challenges

    We are game developers, script writers, artists but NOT marketers.  We have very limited networks and can only enlist help through platforms like Indiegogo to reach out.  But when we start something, we will complete it!  The Demo proves that we have both the expertise and the will-power to complete this project.  We believe there is little risk for our supporters as far as Blue Bastion is concerned.

    • We have already written the draft script for 'Green Gridlock' and accumulated a large portion of the required artwork.  The funds raised will be used mainly for level-design and incorporating the new quests for campaigns in the new 'Green Gridlock' map
    • We have recruited a committed pool of freelancers who have helped us put together Blue Bastion.  We value their partnership to continue working with us for Green Gridlock.  The project will not be at risk due to resignations or overheads (rentals, asset purchases etc) as ALL the monies received will go directly into the project.

allied settlements by building bastions to stretch the perimeters of your
territory, and strike fear in your opponents!

The game
is turn-based with 2 phases per turn for the player, namely Orders Phase and
Reinforcement Phase.  In Orders Phase, players can Move Units, Build
Bastion (using Guardians), Pack Settlement (using Cavaliers), Hire a Hero, Attack
enemy/settlement or Seek Diplomacy from Settlement.  In Reinforcement
Phase, players use gold to obtain new combat or diplomatic units.

Move
Units: Players can move both combat and diplomatic/hero units subject to their
movement points.  Up to 3 combat units can be stacked on a single
hex.  
Build
Bastion: Players can use a Guardian unit to build a bastion to expand is
territory on a hex to connect his borders.  Bastions can be upgraded for
units to be deployed there directly during the reinforcement phase.
Pack
Settlement: Players can move an entirely settlement by 1 hex per turn using a
Cavalier unit.
Hire
Heroes: Players may hire heroes to aid combat, but mostly heroes carry special
quests that must be performed in order for the player to advance the storyline
towards completing the game.
Combat:
Different units can be used to attack enemy and NPC units, and also settlements. 
The attack and defence stats are compared after determining if a hit is
successful, and damage is dealt accordingly.  A dice roll aids to add some
randomness to the ‘hit’ ability.  This game has an 'old school'
pen-n-paper, or board game feel to it, something not common these days.
Diplomacy: 
Gold is used in seeking alliance with settlements by a Diplomatic Unit and dice
rolls are used as a chance factor, alongside hostility rating of the
settlement.
What we need & What you get
Here's
how your contribution will be utilized for the Break project in more detail:

The first $5,000 will go
     towards completing Episode 1: Blue Bastion. As you can see from the video
     of the actual gameplay, the Demo is already done! 
The next $10,000 will go
     towards building Episode 2: Green Gridlock.  We have created the
     necessary engine codes, modules, art etc so that the process of developing
     episode 2 will go on without any hiccups!
At the same time, we know
     there are gamers out there who would like to play this game on their iPads
     and Android tablets.  Because we have coded the game in Cocos2D-x, we
     are confident that the port to these platforms will work just fine.  We need an additional $12,000 to achieve this. 

Finally, every $10,000 hereafter
     will go towards the creation of 2 more episodes, in cooperation with backers. The team
     believes in sharing the fruit of our work with you, the superfans!

We have a range of unique
     perks just for you, our ardent supporters!  Please have a look :)Because of our commitment to this life-quest, even
if we do not reach our targets, we will continue to work on this game, though this
means we can only work on it after office-hours and weekends.  But we will
not rest till it is done!  Lady Antiva took a 2 year hiatus from work,
scrimping and saving to release 'The Camelot Prophecies' ebook series, and the founders
must emulate her generosity and determination!
Other Ways You Can Help
Check out
our perks and be as generous a backer as you can – stand up and be
counted!  
Fly on the wings of a dragon and help us
get the word out through our outreach: ‘Share-it, Test-it, Change-it’  


Share It: ‘LIKE’ our facebook page & SHARE’ this
     campaign link! We will post the dropbox link for the Blue Bastion Demo after the campaign ends! 
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Supremacy/248789225247973

Test It: Post a
     selfie with you completing the demo at the end-game ‘Thank You’ page and join
     our Facebook Group as a Game Tester at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/299585423560122/  We will credit you on our Credit Roll as
     ‘QA Tester’! 


Change It:  Give
     us comments how to make the game better, and if your comment is implemented,
     we will add your name on our Credit Roll as ‘Game Curator’!

Help us
make some noise about our campaign and get us in the news!Release
Green Gridlock upon reaching $15,000 mark
Once we
have completed and shipped 'Blue Bastion' to all backers in Nov 2014, the team
will proceed to code Episode 2: Green Gridlock.  We hope to achieve
backing of $15,000 so that the funding received can go towards the realizing of
perks for naming rights and art rights of 'Green Gridlock'.  In case this
target is not met, we will still commit to release a 'special edition' that
will be shipped to backers at Benefactor tier and higher.
Release
Android and iOS version upon reaching the $21,000 (iPad) and $27,000 (Android Tablet) mark respectively
Dragonlord
Supremacy is designed with multi-platform in mind from the onset.  The
current build is for the PC platform.  The user interface has been
optimized for use on Apple iPads and tablets that run on the Android
operating system.  The team estimated that it will cost $6,000 for
Development and QA each per platform.
Release 2
more episodes of Dragonlord Supremacy upon reaching the $37,000 and $47,000
mark respectively
Dragonlord
Supremacy is designed as an episodic game based on the story grid which Lady
Antiva has drafted.  The storyline comprise both linear and concurrent
events, allowing for the narrative to flow smoothly, diverge where necessary
and then merge back for episodic transition. To be prudent, the team has
budgeted $10,000 per episode to be developed.
Risks & Challenges
We are
game developers, script writers, artists but NOT marketers.  We have very
limited networks and can only enlist help through platforms like Indiegogo to
reach out.  But when we start something, we will complete it!  The
Demo proves that we have both the expertise and the will-power to complete this
project.  We believe there is little risk for our supporters as far as Blue
Bastion is concerned.

We have already written the
draft script for 'Green Gridlock' and accumulated a large portion of the
     required artwork.  The funds raised will be used mainly for
     level-design and incorporating the new quests for campaigns in the new
     'Green Gridlock' map 
We have recruited a
     committed pool of freelancers who have helped us put together Blue
     Bastion.  We value their partnership to continue working with us for
     Green Gridlock.  The project will not be at risk due to resignations
     or overheads (rentals, asset purchases etc) as ALL the monies received
     will go directly into the project.

story:
Hello, my name is Timothy, I am a single father of four children, and I have always enjoyed working with people.  I enjoy getting to know them and the things they enjoy in life.  I have worked security for most of my life plus helping build two separate bar businesses as well as helping a late friend build a business that his wife still operates.  With this investment in me I am positive I can build a strong business for my family and close friends.  My goal is to expand my business into a building as a main hub for several trailers and several types of simulation rooms for the public to rent for parties, events or simply enjoy for a night out.
            My campaign is to help fund the means I will need to start, Creative Awaken Entertainment LLC DBA Tiny’s Racing Simulators, a business I have a great passion for.  The campaign will hopefully show the public my business of simulation racing. Eventually expanding to other virtual experiences.  Sharing my passion of racing with the public and hearing the excitement after they experience a track within 5mm of true dimensions, makes me happy to know I can share that moment with so many people.
            With the help of contributors I will be able to get my business up and running so I can expand as quickly as possible to share more of an experience with the public faster and expand to accommodate more simulations and virtual worlds as well.
            As a contributor you will help me reach my goal of $100,000, contributions will help pay for all the equipment and other means to get Creative Awaken Entertainment LLC up and running. A quick breakdown of what is need is as follows: $7000 for AsSetto Corsa (2 lifetime commercial licensing for the simulators); $20,000 for custom trailer (heaters, air conditioner for climate control, and generator); $20,000 for truck to pull trailer; $16,000 two simulators; $9,000 for four 60 inch televisions (one for each racer in the trailer and two for outside the trailer for patrons to watch as they wait); and $9,000 for insurance.  Some will also be used towards working capital and for more advertising and hand outs or prizes. 
            The perks of your contribution, besides allowing me to bring this experience to the public are as follows:
A donation of $25 and up you will receive two tokens (each good for one race) a forty dollar value.
A donation of $50 and up you will receive four tokens (each good for one race) a eighty dollar value.
A donation of $100 and up you will receive eight tokens (each good for one race) a $160 dollar value.
A donation of $250 and up you will receive one 2 hour party or rental plus two tokens (each good for one race) a $340 dollar value.
A donation of $500 and up you will receive two 2 hour party or rentals plus four tokens (each good for one race) a $680 value.
A donation of $1,000 and you will receive three 4 hour party or rentals plus six tokens (each good for one race) a $1,320 value.
A donation of $5,000 and you will receive a lifetime card good for two races a day or simulation room when available and one 4 hour party per calendar year up to five parties.  Party value alone is equivalent to $2,000.

There is a disclaimer for the parties; a contributor can only book a party once a month.
            I feel that every contributor that helps me get my business started is not only helping me, but also providing the opportunity to the rest of the public to enjoy the thrill and excitement Creative Awaken Entertainment LLC DBA Tiny’s Racing Simulators has to offer.  I am confident that after my past experience of building two bars and only spending two years each to almost double their patron and profit margins, and also helping my late friend build his business which took a good year to build, and his widow still operates to this day, that I can absolutely make my business lucrative.
            As with starting any business I realize there are many risks and challenges in becoming successful in the growing business world.  Some of the challenges I am facing in starting this business are first acquiring the equipment for the first trailer plus the truck and insurance before I can fully advertise and book fairs, venues or other events.  Once having this entire plan in place, then getting the word out, working long hours to get as many events booked will make this business grow faster.  Besides having contributors I am saving towards buying as much equipment as I can.
            Being a single father of four I understand life’s challenges and the obstacles’ that are in all our lives.  So I understand fully that not everyone can always afford to contribute money, but they can share with their friends and family using the Indiegogo link, and other social media, and just with people they have conversations with.  The more the word gets out the better advertisement Creative Awaken Entertainment LLC will receive.
            If I do not reach my goal of this campaign I will still use the money towards getting my business off the ground.  This is my dream and I am determined to get to where I know I can take this business.

story:
Last Coin Games

We have been developing games since 2009. We worked on several both released and unreleased titles some of which were released on app store like Galaxy Battle and Submarine War. We want to continue making games and Agent Rick is our next title.

This campaign aims to gather funds for the Agent Rick project. We are in need of special effects, user interface design, sound effects and some minor features that will add depth and quality to the project. We aim to finish the game before the end of this year with the aid of this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

We start this campaign to gather 10.000 dollars. This money will not be sufficient to setup a game studio, in fact we do not need to setup a studio to finish this game. We will use the money to hire specialists to make the necessary assets for us.

We will list all the contributors names in the credits of the game. We also have several gifts for our supporters. You can see the details in the Perks section.

We will use $2.000 to hire an artist to model our enemy characters. $3.000 will be spent on special effects and $2.000 will be spent on sound effects. We reserved $1.000 for the user interface design and we will spent $2.000 for the motion capture animations. Currently we are using mixamo animations.

Agent Rick

Agent Rick is a 3D stealth action game played with 3rd person camera, similar to Metal Gear Solid and Splinter Cell... The purpose of the game is to reach out completing tasks given to you by hiding or disabling them from the enemies.

It is necessary to make correct and logical decisions in order to have a fast playing and to complete the tasks.
You can lower your enemies in multiple ways and complete quests. This game is far from monotony.

Wine house in mansion.

Features:

  • The game consists of 5 episodes in total. The mansion, the ruins, the headquarters, the oil refinery, the port.
  • Use of drone or remote control tool, bomb trap (with motion sensor or time adjustment), security camera control, trench system etc... 
  • There are 3 different usable weapon, Xray camera, grenade and more.
  • Not just protection; cameras, helicopters and lasers are among the enemies

  • The game to be played using the UE will be adorned with unique visuals and effects

CHARACTERS:

  • Rick: He has been in jail for a long time, the cold war is a secret agent spying for his country during the last years of his life. Adam is a boss of a mafia leader with fovernment contacts, and he has a proposal fro Rick. He will work for him release.
  • Adam: If the initial intention is to make a mutual agreement with Rick, he plans to kill Rick because he knows so much.

Risks & Challenges

If we can gather $10.000 or more there will be no obstacles left for us to complete the game. Currently we have accomplished most of our technical goals but we are in short of assets. With the help of you we believe we can make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support by following us on social media.

Offical Web Page: http://www.lastcoingames.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/lastcoingames

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/lastcoingames

Twitter: https://twitter.com/lastcoingames

e-Mail: info@lastcoingames.com

story:
Ludopolis is a roguelike dungeon crawler with board games influence, in which you have the ability to control level generation. Ludopolis is a remake of Undervault, which features updated graphics, reworked mechanics, and the story.

To celebrate crowdfunding launch we are making Undervault completely free on itch.io! Follow the link below to get it on PC / Mac / Linux, or play in your browser.


(link to the store)

The game

In Ludopolis, you move through rooms of a procedurally generated dungeon. To survive you need to gather various loot and use it wisely. When you encounter a monster, you'll have a choice to fight in turn-based battles (with buffs, debuffs, and consumables), or try to avoid them using rogue skills.

What makes Ludopolis unique is the ability to transform unknown rooms into your desired room type. For example, you could place a chapel which kills enemies in nearby rooms, or a bedroom to have a place for your character to recover. But in most cases you have to make a hard choice, and just pick the lesser evil. So you would have to choose between a "treasury with a lot of loot and monsters", or "a dull hallway which is safe, but has no loot." From time to time you may find room cards which transform the room into specified room type. So if you found a Shop card, you could use it on unknown room and reveal a guaranteed room with a merchant.

In Ludopolis you will also have to deal with hunger, fatigue, and diseases. To overcome it you can grow plants, use hospital equipment, or trade with a merchant for missing items.  As your character develops, you can unlock new skills from different categories including, combat, stealth, and room transforming. As you go deeper and deeper you will gradually unlock new elements of the story to solve the mystery of the dungeon, and find the way home!

Other game features:

  • Creating new connections between rooms using a pickaxe or ladders
  • Owning a pet companion that travels with you through the dungeon.
  • A daily challenge system that lets you compete with other players for the best score.
  • Lots of items that would help you on your journey. The map reveals some part of the level, torches that light the room, remove the 'bad vision' debuff, and let you grow plants, and finally booze that will make your character blackout and later wake up in a completely different place!

Add to Wishlist on Steam

If it sounds interesting to you - please add Ludopolis to wishlist on Steam. That would help us a lot.

New graphics and Story

A new, reworked from scratch, graphics and UI. Above is our comparison from what we had in Undervault, and what we want have now for Ludopolis.

 

A narrative with beautiful illustrations (inspired by Gravity Falls). You will discover how you got into the dungeon, follow character development, and reveal dungeon secrets (after you beat the game!). Also, expect pop culture references.

Game mechanics

We have a lot of changes planned for the game mechanics. I separated them into tiers according to our stretch goals. For a better understanding of the changes I highly suggest to play Undervault (it's free now).

  • Rework unknown room opening mechanic and UI. I want to give the player more control over it. And make it feel less random.
  • Remove backpack limitation when moving to the next level (or keep the limit only for room cards).
  • Add hospital and medicine to heal, which will replace healing in a bedroom by sleeping.
  • A reworked battle system, which will introduce range weapons and multiple creatures on the same team.
  • A pet companion!
  • A complete balance rework.

  • More graphical variety of rooms. End game levels will have snowy rooms (with freezing effect on your character).
  • Some rooms will have doors to the 2nd layer. You can use 2nd layer to avoid dangerous passages in the 1st layer (similar to how underground works in Heroes of Might and Magic).
  • Multiple game difficulties. The harder the difficulty the more options you will have in the game finale.
  • Full battle rework in order to make it more deep and interesting. Taking inspiration from Slay the Spire and Darkest Dungeon.

  • Enchantment mechanics for equipment.
  • More plants to grow and a more advanced growing system.
  • Cooking and food system. Don't let your food spoil and follow a healthy diet.
  • Advanced medicine system and diseases/mood system.

  • Consumable items crafting/alchemy.
  • Elevator room which will create additional connection between levels and will help you to establish the base on early levels.

  • Add arcade machine to play your favorite games in Ludopolis!
  • More to be determined content!

Stretch goals

Team & backstory

I've made video games since high school. I immediately felt in love with game development after I made my first change to the config file of some Counter-Strike 1.6 mod. Since then, I had experience working on game mods (Rubaka Mod), my own indie games (Undervault, Pixel Express), serious commercial games (Gloomhaven), and also made a bunch of different prototypes (The Farlanders).

Undervault was my debut project that I did completely on my own. Because of that, it has a  simple look, and has few problems in game mechanics. But even despite those flaws it still was well appreciated, mostly because of the unique mechanics. So now that I feel I have enough skills and experience, I want to rework Undervault with new graphics, story, and mechanics.

I'm collaborating with a very talented pixel artist Yes I Do to make the game look great. He is also working on a game called Bunker.

References

I enjoy playing immersive video games with high replay value and procedural generation. That's what I want to achieve in Ludopolis. More specifically, we've taken inspiration from Gravity Falls visuals to make story illustrations, from tabletop games (like Munchkin) to invent room transforming mechanics, from Pixel Dungeon (android roguelike), to make Undervault, and from Three Hundred Mechanics for a lot of great ideas.

Platforms & release date

Estimated release date is May 2020, but we may release the game earlier, or later in 2020. It all depends on the amount of funds raised and the scope of the project. We will start development in September 2019 if the campaign reaches the minimum goal.

Target platform is PC and Mac with distribution on Steam and itch.io. After that, we will make mobile versions for Android and iOS. Other platforms are also being considered.

Budget & risks

We are searching for funding to cover salaries for two of us. But if we reach more than $30,000 USD, then I'll hire additional people for SFX and music, and probably an additional programmer to speed up development.

There will always be risks, but here are few reasons why we won't fail to deliver as promised:

  • We have a base of Undervault, which is already a functioning game. So if we don't break it during development, we will still have a game
  • I made Undervault completely on my own, with almost zero budget, and with no experience as an indie developer. And now I'm not alone, much more experienced, and hopefully with a budget :)

Some game mechanics might shift from what we have planned, because they may simply not work or be not fun. However during development we will still be brainstorming ideas and find one we can't resist.

Perks

All perks are purely digital (we can't take the risk of producing and shipping physical goods). Estimated delivery date is set for May 2020, but we will fulfill individual items as soon as possible.

Our favorite items (because they are expensive :O)

  • Message in the game. While exploring the dungeon in Ludopolis you may find notes left by previous adventurers. This is your chance to leave a mark in the game lore. Imprint some common knowledge ("Earth is flat"), or write some nonsense like a savage ("2+2=4")
  • Design documents will give you the opportunity to get an early look at development (Autumn 2019) and to learn more details about Ludopolis. Also you will have an original Undervault prototype together with the design document. Should be interesting if you are in game industry, or if you just want to have an inside look.
  • Personal skype talk with developer. Ask anything you want, give us your suggestions for the game, or just watch how socially awkward I am ;)

Other ways to help

If you are still reading this then I'm not that bad at writing (woohoo!). We would really appreciate if you spread the word about the campaign on social media, or just send the link to your friend. And wishlist Ludopolis on Steam! That would really help, thank you!

Other game features:

Creating new connections between rooms using a pickaxe or ladders
Owning a pet companion that travels with you through the dungeon.
A daily challenge system that lets you compete with other players for the best score.
Lots of items that would help you on your journey. The map reveals some part of the level, torches that light the room, remove the 'bad vision' debuff, and let you grow plants, and finally booze that will make your character blackout and later wake up in a completely different place!

Add to Wishlist on Steam
If it sounds interesting to you - please add Ludopolis to wishlist on Steam. That would help us a lot.

New graphics and Story

A new, reworked from scratch, graphics and UI. Above is our comparison from what we had in Undervault, and what we want have now for Ludopolis.
 

A narrative with beautiful illustrations (inspired by Gravity Falls). You will discover how you got into the dungeon, follow character development, and reveal dungeon secrets (after you beat the game!). Also, expect pop culture references.
Game mechanics

We have a lot of changes planned for the game mechanics. I separated them into tiers according to our stretch goals. For a better understanding of the changes I highly suggest to play Undervault (it's free now).


Rework unknown room opening mechanic and UI. I want to give the player more control over it. And make it feel less random.
Remove backpack limitation when moving to the next level (or keep the limit only for room cards).
Add hospital and medicine to heal, which will replace healing in a bedroom by sleeping.
A reworked battle system, which will introduce range weapons and multiple creatures on the same team.
A pet companion!
A complete balance rework.



More graphical variety of rooms. End game levels will have snowy rooms (with freezing effect on your character).
Some rooms will have doors to the 2nd layer. You can use 2nd layer to avoid dangerous passages in the 1st layer (similar to how underground works in Heroes of Might and Magic).
Multiple game difficulties. The harder the difficulty the more options you will have in the game finale.
Full battle rework in order to make it more deep and interesting. Taking inspiration from Slay the Spire and Darkest Dungeon.



Enchantment mechanics for equipment.
More plants to grow and a more advanced growing system.
Cooking and food system. Don't let your food spoil and follow a healthy diet.
Advanced medicine system and diseases/mood system.



Consumable items crafting/alchemy.
Elevator room which will create additional connection between levels and will help you to establish the base on early levels.



Add arcade machine to play your favorite games in Ludopolis!
More to be determined content!

Stretch goals

Team & backstory
I've made video games since high school. I immediately felt in love with game development after I made my first change to the config file of some Counter-Strike 1.6 mod. Since then, I had experience working on game mods (Rubaka Mod), my own indie games (Undervault, Pixel Express), serious commercial games (Gloomhaven), and also made a bunch of different prototypes (The Farlanders).

Undervault was my debut project that I did completely on my own. Because of that, it has a  simple look, and has few problems in game mechanics. But even despite those flaws it still was well appreciated, mostly because of the unique mechanics. So now that I feel I have enough skills and experience, I want to rework Undervault with new graphics, story, and mechanics.

I'm collaborating with a very talented pixel artist Yes I Do to make the game look great. He is also working on a game called Bunker.
References
I enjoy playing immersive video games with high replay value and procedural generation. That's what I want to achieve in Ludopolis. More specifically, we've taken inspiration from Gravity Falls visuals to make story illustrations, from tabletop games (like Munchkin) to invent room transforming mechanics, from Pixel Dungeon (android roguelike), to make Undervault, and from Three Hundred Mechanics for a lot of great ideas.

Platforms & release date
Estimated release date is May 2020, but we may release the game earlier, or later in 2020. It all depends on the amount of funds raised and the scope of the project. We will start development in September 2019 if the campaign reaches the minimum goal.
Target platform is PC and Mac with distribution on Steam and itch.io. After that, we will make mobile versions for Android and iOS. Other platforms are also being considered.
Budget & risks
We are searching for funding to cover salaries for two of us. But if we reach more than $30,000 USD, then I'll hire additional people for SFX and music, and probably an additional programmer to speed up development.

There will always be risks, but here are few reasons why we won't fail to deliver as promised:

We have a base of Undervault, which is already a functioning game. So if we don't break it during development, we will still have a game
I made Undervault completely on my own, with almost zero budget, and with no experience as an indie developer. And now I'm not alone, much more experienced, and hopefully with a budget :)

Some game mechanics might shift from what we have planned, because they may simply not work or be not fun. However during development we will still be brainstorming ideas and find one we can't resist.
Perks
All perks are purely digital (we can't take the risk of producing and shipping physical goods). Estimated delivery date is set for May 2020, but we will fulfill individual items as soon as possible.

Our favorite items (because they are expensive :O)

Message in the game. While exploring the dungeon in Ludopolis you may find notes left by previous adventurers. This is your chance to leave a mark in the game lore. Imprint some common knowledge ("Earth is flat"), or write some nonsense like a savage ("2+2=4")
Design documents will give you the opportunity to get an early look at development (Autumn 2019) and to learn more details about Ludopolis. Also you will have an original Undervault prototype together with the design document. Should be interesting if you are in game industry, or if you just want to have an inside look.
Personal skype talk with developer. Ask anything you want, give us your suggestions for the game, or just watch how socially awkward I am ;)

Other ways to help
If you are still reading this then I'm not that bad at writing (woohoo!). We would really appreciate if you spread the word about the campaign on social media, or just send the link to your friend. And wishlist Ludopolis on Steam! That would really help, thank you!

story:
HoQ is an upcoming Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) title. Action packed tactical spaceship battle. Wage a war by yourself or with your friends against the enemies. Earn resources, upgrade your ship and FIGHT against the other team! Epic pseudo-3d game with max 3 players on each team, both single and multiplayer, for mobile and tablet devices. 


We love games like Warcraft, Starcraft, Dota and HoN. And we also love space!!! That’s why we have decided to combine all these great things and create an amazing looking game! Firstly, we want it for mobile and tablet devices (iOS, android), as there are not that many games like this for those platforms. Secondly move to PC, MAC, & Linux. If you share our enthusiasm about sci-fi keep reading to find out more about our project! 

Two teams, 3 players max on each team, will fight for a win. The victory can be achieved by killing the enemy heroes or by destroying their mothership. 

Players have 2 lives, which means they can re-spawn once after being killed. After that it is a permanent death!

Each player picks one ship at the start of a game next to the mothership. The mothership is defended by 3 towers and it automatically provides repairs to nearby ships and sells upgrades for your ship. Upgrades consists of basic upgradable stats like life, shield, armor, speed, short range and long range weapons and then special features. Each hero has his own special set of weapons and shields available for purchase. Upgrades are only applied to their own ship.


Players have to earn resources by killing the enemy drones and heroes. Also when one team controls most of the map, that means everyone from that team is behind the middle line at the enemy territory, it gains bonus of 10% to the gained resources. Drones are deployed from mothership in waves.


The games should last about 15 minutes.

Singleplayer: Game mode for offline play. A player can practice and have fun against bots.

Multiplayer: Connect via bluetooth/wifi or internet to play. When connected locally (bluetooth/wifi) players will be able to create or join games with their friends. With internet you can join online games. Win games to earn points and coins! 

Points will determine your skill and when looking for a game you will fight against more equal enemies. 

Coins can be spent on different new avatars or brand new heroes. 

*skin- means the look (graphic presentation) of your ship in game

1. Stage - singleplayer for mobile and tablet devices (graphics, sounds, AI-bots coding, testing and bugs fixing) - beta testing for Indiegogo supporters!

2. Stage - multiplayer for mobile and tablet devices (wifi or bluetooth connection, internet servers for online-games, some more tests and bugs correction) 

3. Stage – lastly we want to develop this game also for PC, MAC, & Linux. 

- then create more levels for singleplayer, different modes for multiplayer, many more new heroes and bad-ass skins for ships! 


Well everything in life today is really expensive. It's almost impossible to get funding through traditional methods for a game like this. The best thing about Indiegogo is that we can go directly to the people who love these types of games as much as we do. People who support us know what they will be getting. YOU can even help us create and improve the game! We make the development decisions, we market the game, and we don't have to answer to anyone but you – our fans. 


We aim to create the best and only the best so we will need help. There comes the outsourcing, creation of AI, cool graphics, connection both wifi/bluetooth and internet, stable game and so much more! Also there are some more fees like company registration, trademarks, licenses for some programs that we will need and a lot more... It is more than we can afford on our own. So if you like the idea of spaceships war game, THIS is the game for you. Help us bring this game to life! Spare few bucks to make this game happen! There are rewards waiting for you of course!


We need to raise a minimum of 10 000 € to fund this project. We know we are asking for a lot of money but that's because we are creating something new! Something that has not been done this way for mobile or tablet devices before. That means a new MOBA system that will work smoothly, have beautiful graphics, animation and so much more.

We have set this project for fixed budget, so either we make it to the target goal and we create this game or we will die trying :) (sell our kidneys)

If we raise more money, we have additional stretch goals we would like to implement to this game. New spaceships, abilities, skins, maps, different levels, modes (death-match, defense,...) and many other features.


Tell about us to your family, friends, or basically anyone you know. 

Like us, Follow us, Subscribe and get all new information before everyone else!

Twitter       Facebook       Website

We are currently working on different designs. Hope you guys like

story:
My name is G.P. Francis, author of science fiction novel Primed and founder of registered Canadian publishing company Dissident Press.

Dissident Press has planned and designed a video game called EPOCH, set in the same universe described in my novel. Here are some highlights:

cross-platform shared, persistent environment representing the first game ever to enable Playstation, XBox, PC and mobile device users to interact within a single game environment

total freedom to explore any planet, building, space station or ship; interact with other players and resident characters in dynamic environments. Find missions, resources and hidden surprises across thousands of star systems and unique destinations

non-stop action in a sci-fi, frontier setting, with a seamless blend of First Person Shooter, Space Combat Simulation and Real Time Strategy game elements. With residual player avatars and game characters, the action carries on even after you quit the game session. Drop in and out of the action at any time

carve out your reputation with realistic social and skill development systems where your every action shapes your character and how others respond to them

develop your own faction from humble beginnings to inter-stellar empire, with the ability to hire game characters and other players, to help you run it. Switch from your avatar to any game character in your faction to make use of their unique skills or equipment, and control the action directly

issue orders to your avatar and faction members and have them carried out in real time even when you’re not playing – access the game from your mobile device to check notifications and progress on assigned tasks, or give new instructions

voice commands and body/controller movements immerse you in the action, and keep you on top of the game. Talk directly to other players, and eavesdrop on local chatter. Edit and share game play footage, or monitor live action from other players

make your mark on the galaxy with the ability to shape the game universe; set up or acquire flag points to exploit resources and generate income; customise, design and manufacture weapons, equipment, vehicles and clothing and sell your products to other players in the open market

defend or conquer flag points, but be prepared to answer for any crimes in an innovative law enforcement system with forensic evidence and investigation

take on any role: assassin, bodyguard, bouncer, bounty hunter, businessperson, cargo hauler, cop, cosmetic surgeon, courier, detective, doctor, drug dealer, entertainer, farmer, federal agent, forger, gangster, genetic engineer, gun runner, hacker, hunter, inventor, journalist, landlord, mechanic, medic, mercenary, merchant, miner, nano-technician, pilot, pirate, politician, private investigator, salvage operator, security guard, share holder, smuggler, software programmer, soldier, spy, star ship designer, thief, tourist, waste carrier... the list goes on. And on.

EPOCH is a complete MMORPG (Massively Multi-player Online Role Playing Game) system, by which I mean players are immersed in a realistic, populated environment and allowed unprecedented freedom of action. EPOCH includes First Person Shooter, Space Combat Simulation and Real Time Strategy elements, which in terms of actual game play means your character can explore a city, planet, moon or space station, interact with the inhabitants, find work, make purchases and sales, order lunch, get a haircut, hire a crew, walk through your spaceship, grab the controls and fly off to any other location amongst thousands of star systems spanning the Orion Arm of the Milky Way Galaxy.

EPOCH aims to capture the freedom of action represented by the old book-based role playing game systems. So far, no video games have yet managed to provide players with such a wide range of choices, being limited to only space combat simulation, or only first person exploration. Where you can do both, one or the other aspect is often underdeveloped, not a complete game within a game as you will see in EPOCH.

Imagine your cargo ship is attacked by a fleet of pirates in a remote star system, and during the battle they start to board your ship to steal your cargo. In EPOCH, you can jump out of your pilot’s seat, order another character to fly, and run through your ship to the cargo bay to join your squad of marine’s as they take cover amongst the cargo containers and prepare to repel borders. During the battle, your ship’s systems are damaged and the cargo bay loses its artificial gravity. You have to contend with floating containers shifting dangerously and air-borne opponents. When you do drive the pirates back, they disengage from your ship but leave the docking ring damaged – and open! Air from your ship rushes out in to space, blowing drums and debris from the fight out through the hole as your surviving marines hold on for their lives and try to avoid getting crushed by the larger cargo containers. Fortunately, you’ve practiced mechanical repair tasks enough times to have a good chance of fixing the problem: bracing yourself beside the docking ring, you use tools from your equipment to dislodge a piece of shrapnel jamming the door mechanism, the docking ring seals shut and the danger is over. For now. You make your way back to the bridge, ordering your ship’s engineer to start repairs on the artificial gravity system, and use your telecom system to check in with the assigned pilot. Looking through his eyes, you see the pirates’ flag ship is limping away, and all their fighters are disabled or destroyed. Your own ship has suffered minor damage, but is still fully armed. Do you want your pilot to resume your journey, or chase them down and finish them off? There might be a reward – you’d better check the local Law Enforcement Organisation’s wanted list....

With the arrival of the eighth generation of gaming consoles, the technology is finally in place to support a community of gamers in such an immersive setting. Player voice commands and body/controller movements combine with conventional controls, and players are able to communicate directly with other players, share and monitor live game play footage. Using mobile devices, you can receive game notifications, check in on the action and issue new orders from wherever you are, at any time.

As a contributor, you would be helping to create a ground-breaking game on a scale that has never before been accomplished, and bring about a revolution in connectivity between video gamers across the widest range of platforms ever conceived.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise at least $9,186 just to get the ball rolling, to maintain the static IP needed for major console developers and obtain commercial software licenses for the proprietary game engine and 3D animation software needed to develop this game from concept to product. But we'll need roughly fifteen times that amount - about $140,000 - to complete the game to deadline and conceived specifications. We’ve already applied for console development licensing.
  • As a contributor, you can claim a range of perks from access to the beta testing stage, a free copy of the finished game, or in-game advantages such as military achievements, skill bonuses, social status, pre-ownership of valuable property, resources and other faction benefits, or claim titles to take control of an entire settlement, corporation, criminal organisation - even an entire star system! The perks have been designed so you can make a series of contributions and apply multiple bonuses - none of them cancel each other out.
  • If we don’t raise the minimum amount needed for software licensing, then EPOCH will never happen, and any contributions made will be refunded by Indiegogo. If we don’t raise the full amount needed for development, any funds raised beyond licensing costs will be used to take the development of a demo' version as far as possible, in order to show investors the potential of the finished game. That may mean we can't complete the game to deadline, but EPOCH is a labour of love - we'll get there in the end! And we'll keep all contributors updated on our progress with the EPOCH Development Newsletter.
  • We can always use more money! Every dollar contributed will go towards further development costs, of which there is no shortage: software plug-ins for procedural content generators, outsourcing for additional program scripting needs and supporting app development for mobile devices, professional 3D artists and animators to enhance the visual effects for the finished product. In short, any extra funds received will be channelled into improving the game in terms of scale, scope, functionality and content, bringing a better game to you, the contributors and future players.

The Impact

Create your in-game avatar; stroll through crowded city streets and chat to residents and visitors, or track across a deserted alien world; access an interstellar communications system; board a ship and explore the galaxy; fight off pirates or become a pirate; buy and sell cargo or carry passengers; hunt bounties or infiltrate corporations to steal trade secrets; pay for your crimes via an innovative system of punishment that quickly returns you to game play; get away with murder, or slip up and fall foul of a ground-breaking forensic policing system (do they always get their man? There’s only one way to found out, and you’ve got to ask yourself: do you feel lucky? Well, do you...?); blast your enemies to oblivion, or take them alive with a detailed but simple-to-use combat system; salvage wrecks or construct mining facilities; buy or rent a home or business premises; campaign for political office; donate to in-game political parties to play subscription-free; hire employees and build your own faction, or join a faction to earn a wage; become a crime lord or the law enforcement officer that brings them down; design and sell new weapons, spaceships, software, nano-technology, bio-technology, robots, equipment; participate in a simulated economy; hone your avatar’s skills, or have them take a back seat and switch player control to any of your NPC faction members to make direct use of their professional skill set; choose an heir to receive your fortune and continue in your stead, in case your avatar is killed; issue instructions to your employees and your own avatar, and have them carried out in the persistent game environment even after you quit the game session! Monitor assigned task progress and issue new instructions to your faction members at any time using your mobile device; defend what’s yours, or take what you can from those unable to prevent you.

In EPOCH, the stars are the only limit to what you can do.

  • EPOCH will connect video game players, and players to their video game, in a way never before accomplished – imagine interacting with players on PC, Xbox, PlayStation and mobile devices, no matter which platform you’re playing on. This is a first in the video game industry and gaming community, and represents a genuine breakthrough in interconnectivity. You can be part of making that happen, and the world will never be quite the same again. In fact, it’ll be more like the world of EPOCH!
  • Dissident Press has already brought an e-book and paperback novel to publication, and we’re now poised to crack the video game industry with an established network of software programmers, 3D artists and animators along with in-house literary and graphic design talent to develop and publish a game of outstanding visual quality and playability.
  • Make it real – EPOCH is waiting to happen. Everything is in place, from the technology and software capability to the completed Game Design Document.

Other Ways You Can Help

So, you’ve read through the campaign details (thank you), already made a contribution (a BIG thank you!) or perhaps you can’t offer financial support. Hopefully, you're getting as excited as we are about this project, and can't wait to play the game! You can still help us in other ways:

  • Tell EVERYONE YOU KNOW about EPOCH and this campaign: get the word out and make some noise!
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks for all your help.

(Header image design: Victor Habbick)

As a contributor, you can     claim a range of perks from access to the beta testing stage, a free copy     of the finished game, or in-game advantages such as military achievements,      skill bonuses, social status, pre-ownership of valuable property,     resources and other faction benefits, or claim titles to take control of     an entire settlement, corporation, criminal organisation - even an entire     star system! The perks have been designed so you can make a series of     contributions and apply multiple bonuses - none of them cancel each other     out.
If we don’t raise the minimum     amount needed for software licensing, then EPOCH will never happen,     and any contributions made will be refunded by Indiegogo. If we don’t     raise the full amount needed for development, any funds raised beyond     licensing costs will be used to take the development of a demo' version as     far as possible, in order to show investors the potential of the     finished game. That may mean we can't complete the game to deadline, but EPOCH     is a labour of love - we'll get there in the end! And we'll keep all     contributors updated on our progress with the EPOCH Development     Newsletter.
We can always use more     money! Every dollar contributed will go towards further development costs,     of which there is no shortage: software plug-ins for procedural content     generators, outsourcing for additional program scripting needs and     supporting app development for mobile devices, professional 3D artists and     animators to enhance the visual effects for the finished product. In     short, any extra funds received will be channelled into improving the game     in terms of scale, scope, functionality and content, bringing a better     game to you, the contributors and future players.
The ImpactCreate your in-game avatar; stroll through crowded city streets and chat to residents and visitors, or track across a deserted alien world; access an interstellar communications system; board a ship and explore the galaxy; fight off pirates or become a pirate; buy and sell cargo or carry passengers; hunt bounties or infiltrate corporations to steal trade secrets; pay for your crimes via an innovative system of punishment that quickly returns you to game play; get away with murder, or slip up and fall foul of a ground-breaking forensic policing system (do they always get their man? There’s only one way to found out, and you’ve got to ask yourself: do you feel lucky? Well, do you...?); blast your enemies to oblivion, or take them alive with a detailed but simple-to-use combat system; salvage wrecks or construct mining facilities; buy or rent a home or business premises; campaign for political office; donate to in-game political parties to play subscription-free; hire employees and build your own faction, or join a faction to earn a wage; become a crime lord or the law enforcement officer that brings them down; design and sell new weapons, spaceships, software, nano-technology, bio-technology, robots, equipment; participate in a simulated economy; hone your avatar’s skills, or have them take a back seat and switch player control to any of your NPC faction members to make direct use of their professional skill set; choose an heir to receive your fortune and continue in your stead, in case your avatar is killed; issue instructions to your employees and your own avatar, and have them carried out in the persistent game environment even after you quit the game session! Monitor assigned task progress and issue new instructions to your faction members at any time using your mobile device; defend what’s yours, or take what you can from those unable to prevent you.In EPOCH, the stars are the only limit to what you can do.

EPOCH will connect video game     players, and players to their video game, in a way never before accomplished      – imagine interacting with players on PC, Xbox, PlayStation and mobile     devices, no matter which platform you’re playing on. This is a first in     the video game industry and gaming community, and represents a genuine     breakthrough in interconnectivity. You can be part of making that happen,     and the world will never be quite the same again. In fact, it’ll be more     like the world of EPOCH!

Dissident Press has already     brought an e-book and paperback novel to publication, and we’re now poised     to crack the video game industry with an established network of software     programmers, 3D artists and animators along with in-house literary and     graphic design talent to develop and publish a game of outstanding visual     quality and playability.
Make it real – EPOCH is     waiting to happen. Everything is in place, from the technology and     software capability to the completed Game Design Document.
Other Ways You Can HelpSo, you’ve read through the campaign details (thank you), already made a contribution (a BIG thank you!) or perhaps you can’t offer financial support. Hopefully, you're getting as excited as we are about this project, and can't wait to play the game! You can still help us in other ways:
Tell EVERYONE YOU KNOW about      EPOCH and this campaign: get the word out and make some noise!
Don’t forget to use the     Indiegogo share tools. Thanks for all your help.
(Header image design: Victor Habbick)

story:
Intro:

Hello. My name is Francesco and I recently completed the creation of a great new boardgame called Colonies©. It is copyrighted, bilingual (English/French) and I have suppliers ready to roll. All I need is the initial financing in order to produce and distribute it.

I love board games and have been making them as a hobby for more than 16 years but I finally took the plunge and got one ready to sell. I find that sitting around a table with friends and family is a great way to re-connect while having tremendous fun...

I included some information on this product below, but I welcome you to visit my website: www.FMOGames.com for additional details.

The Product:

We are deep into the 15th century. You were given one ship and a few men to discover a new route to Asia... But weeks spent at sea delivered a surprise. Instead of reaching the East you discovered uncharted territories. You must now race other nations for supremacy in the region. Explore fast and find resources to become ruler of the New World.

Every game is different as the resources you need are hidden. Gather your fleets and armies wisely, build your Forts strategically and plan with caution to dominate and win. Play at the simple level or use a variety of advanced rules to enhance your experience. Even if you cannot find opponents you can still find excitement on your own with our engaging single-player mode

The game contains a large 6-fold map 33 cards and more than 240 units (plastic and wooden). Help bring this game out into the world and immerse yourself in this easy to learn adventure.

Goal and Reward:

The cost of printing the first edition is a bit over $16,000 USD. This will allow me to launch a campaign to sell it online and to approach retailers.

Your investment will only be kept if I reach this goal and when this is done, I will start the process and keep you aware of the status, every step of the way. If you pledge $50 (or more), in addition to getting a great game published you will also receive a copy of it.

A game like this would retail at about $60...

I hope you will consider buying this game by investing in its future...

story:
A little About Wasteland Traders.

Wasteland Traders is a traditional property trading board game, based in world laid to waste. Add in a storyline, a few role playing features, game altering survival elements, chances of loot, and a fast action pace of a Post-Apocalyptic world.

+ 8mth and then some of development and play tests...

Wasteland Traders was Born

But wait... If all that wasn't enough, Wasteland Traders will bring an exciting feature with the integration of a Wasteland Traders companion Mobile App on either smart phone or tablet

This is where it gets really good.

The Companion App will add the fast paced time & survival elements of game play, Settings to adjust your experience and a place for fellow wastelander's players around the globe to submit their game stories & scores.

How the Game will Play Out?

Players: 2 - 6 (Recommended age 13+)

Playtime: 120mins (Give or take)

Game play: If the Player Survive the wasteland (most wont...), the player with the most amount of buildings & Credits wins.

What Sets Wasteland Traders Apart:  Apart from the obvious. Prior to starting the game the player chooses 1 of 6 wasteland traders as their avatar, each containing a unique perk or trait that can help or sometimes hinder them through the wasteland, forming tactics and strategies for repeat play.

Also the E.D.E.N Device (which is represented on the Mobile App) Plays a big part on how long the game is played out for, no two games will be the same.

What the Game will Consist of

1x 24" x 24" game board

6x 28mm Miniatures Player Pieces

6x Player Character Cards

18x Miniatures Buildings

18x Building Cards

16x Survival Cards

16x Loot Cards

36x Health tokens

12x E.D.E.N tokens (Oooh what's that for you say...)

Set of Dice & Play Guide / Rule Book

All this packaged inside a Metal Styled Cardboard Box to show off (when your not playing of course)

What We Need To Make Wasteland Traders Possible

As a Graphic Designer and Sign maker, most of Wasteland Trader will be manufactured in-house and most likely by me the creator and my team, the android app development handle by Mik, and a very creative artist (Harmony) will be providing the Post-Apocalyptic artistic touch to the overall look and feel of the game.

But unfortunately we can only do so much...

That's where you guys come in!

Manufacturing Materials and Production cost are by far where the funding will be needed most. I aim to have Wasteland Traders manufactured entirely in Australia!

The next biggest task, and where a significant amount of the funding will go towards, the 3D printed miniatures, you help full mass production runs of these pieces.

www.wastelandtraders.com

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!!

We at Wastelands understand not all people can pledge funds towards projects. So even posting, liking our social media pages and sharing, means a lot to us.

Got some feedback or suggestions ?, drop us a line at:

Via Email: info@wastelandtraders.com
Via Twitter: @wearewasteland
Facebook: facebook.com/wastelandtraders

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Hello, My Name Is Jason And I Am A Videogame Developer.
  • I have been building a videogame for the past year and i need money in order to continue building it.
  • Contributers will help me achieve my lifelong dream and will get a free copy of the game.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Im looking for $500 worth of funding to continue making this game.
  • If you donate then you get a free copy of my game!
  • The funds go to help pay the developers of the game and pay for the servers.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • This is valuable because everyone is currently in lockdown and this would mean alot to them.
  • We have been working on this game for 2 years and need as much support as possible

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • I am persevered by the fact that i have wanted to build a videogame since i was a kid.
  • I need money to continue funding this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
To our community,

We regret to inform you that we’ve made the difficult decision to cancel GaymerX East ‘19. Due to complications with our venue, we won't be able to hold the event on the scheduled dates nor will we be able to easily reschedule.

All contributions to our indiegogo will be refunded. If you need further assistance, please feel free to contact us at info@gaymerx.org.

Here’s what happened…

When we confirmed our event with the Microsoft Times Square Conference center, we did so following the same process we had gone through for previous years. We were given the assurance that our agreement remained the same. However, a few days ago we were informed that their procedure had changed and that they would require us to sign a new contract. Partly, it would restrict which companies were allowed to sponsor the event. Additionally, the contract wouldn’t be ready for another month.

Sponsorships pay for a big chunk of our events. Large companies --a number of whom would likely not be allowed under the new contract-- have been some of the biggest sponsors of past GaymerX conventions. We are a small, all-volunteer organization, and not in a position where we can hold a convention without significant financial support. In this case, using the free venue provided to us by Microsoft would be too expensive with the new restrictions being placed on us.

This left us in the difficult position. We either wait for the contract --which if its terms were unfavorable would leave us little to no time to renegotiate before our event-- or we cancel the event before it’s too late to refund our crowdfunding backers. We’re choosing to do what we believe is best for our community because we value your support so much.

While this is an unfortunate outcome, we want to be clear that we harbor no ill will toward the Microsoft Times Square Conference center. Their space is no longer suitable for GaymerX East ‘19 and while we wish we could push forward with the event, we just don’t see a way to do so.

There is no way around it, this sucks. We know how disappointing this must be to our community. We hope you can forgive us. If there’s anything you need from the organization, please feel free to email us: info@gaymerx.org. Our deepest apologies to all of you.

 

Katie Kaitchuck

Executive Director, GaymerX
