story:
WE'RE MOVING TO KICKSTARTER

This campaign is no longer running but Indiegogo doesn't allow to delete campaigns after they have received contributions. Read the latest update to hear why we're moving.

If you want to stay updated please like us on Facebook or visit our dev blog



CHECK OUT THIS CAMPAIGN IN YOUR LANGUAGE
   
English Italiano Español
 

GAMEPLAY VIDEO

 

Would you love a zombie survival game that makes you feels like an actual survivor? You're in the right place!

Since playing the first Resident Evil games for the Playstation 1 when I was a kid, I practically fell in love with zombie games and movies. Although there are many games I enjoyed playing I felt like none of them was actually giving me an experience somewhat near the one of a real survivor to a zombie apocalypse. If you share this feeling you're in the right place because that's exactly the kind of experience we want to give you with Pandemia!
 
Our vision is to create an augmented reality massively multiplayer online game that will let you live out a zombie apocalypse in your city (or wherever you are).

You main goal when playing Pandemia will be survival. You will have to do everything a survivor would do to stay alive, for example: look for food, weapons and other items; interact with other survivors; fight with the infected and so on...

As you walk within your city you will find several kinds of points of interest scattered on the map, marked by specific symbols. Accessing each one of them will allow you to collect resources such as food, weapons, medicinals and other items you can use to survive.

Other than point of interests nearby players will be also marked on the map, allowing you to trade items with them or just exchange information.

Besides that, you will be able to create alliances that will allow you and the other members to have a series of benefits. As a gang you will be able to take control of some points of interest: you will get exclusive access to those resources, until another gang tries to take control of them.

Moreover, actively playing with other members (for example, when they are walking with you on the street) will enhance your character's skills and you will be able to survive more easily.

 

The world of Pandemia is populated by two other kinds of entities other than players: zombies and computer characters. The AI behind them will allow you to enjoy an awesome playing experience even if there aren't a lot of players in your area.

Computer characters will have a large range of behaviours: they will sell you items, assign you quests and, sometimes, even help you with your problems!

Game Features

  • experience points system,
  • inventory and equippable items,
  • real time interaction with other players on the map,
  • real time interaction and combat with infected on the map,
  • quests and missions,
  • awesome AI for NPC,
  • currency system (P$) which you can use to buy exclusive items in the store.

 

Building a game like this requires time, money and many programming and game designing skills. We worked hard until now to build some core gameplay features (that you can see in the video on the top of the page) but we can't build the entire game on our own.

We will use the money to build a fully functional closed beta version of the game in 6 months.

Here's how the money you contribute to this campaign will be distributed:

 
 
Don't forget that by contributing to this campaign you will also get one of our awesome perks!

If you can't contribute there are plenty of ways you can still help us and in the meantime get something unique for your help!

Sharing this campaign is vital for its success so we have some cool rewards for those who can't contribute with their money but want to help us nonetheless:

  1.  Share the link to this campaign on Twitter with the hashtag #pandemia
  2.  Share the link to this campaign on Facebook with the hashtag #pandemia

Those of you who will do one of the previous things (or both) will get one (or two) unique in-game items!

 

 

Is Pandemia free?
Yes, Pandemia will be released for free.

Do I necessarily have to walk to play Pandemia?
Being that Pandemia is an augmented reality game, most of the time you will have to play when you are outside. There will be features to make the game playable at home but the real game is played on the streets.

Do I have to have my GPS turned on to play?
Yes. Pandemia needs your position in real time.

What happens if I turn off the GPS while playing?
You won't be able to play. Your player will disappear from the map and you will just reapper wherever you turn your GPS back on.

Is there PVP in Pandemia?
No, as of now we don't plan on implementing any PVP feature.

 

Ti piacerebbe un gioco di sopravvivenza zombie che ti fa sentire come un vero sopravvissuto? Sei nel posto giusto!


Da quando da bambino ho giocato ai primi Resident Evil per la Playstation 1, mi sono da subito appassionato ai giochi e ai film zombie. Nonostante ci siamo molti giochi di questo tipo che mi sono piaciuti non ce ne è mai stato uno che mi abbia dato un'esperienza vicina a quella che un sopravvissuto avrebbe
provato in un mondo post-apocalittico. Se anche tu la pensi così sei nel posto giusto perché è esattamente il tipo di esperienza che vogliamo darti con Pandemia!

La nostra visione è di creare un gioco multiplayer in realtà aumentata che ti permetterà di vivere un apocalisse zombie nella tua città (o dovunque tu ti trovi).

IL GIOCO

Il tuo scopo primario quando giochi a Pandemia sarà la sopravvivenza. Dovrai fare tutto quello che un vero superstite farebbe per rimanere in vita, per esempio: cercare
cibo, armi e altri oggetti; interagire con gli altri superstiti; combattere contro gli infetti e così via...

Camminando per la tua città troverai vari punti d'interesse sparsi sulla mappa e evidenziati da simboli specifici. Accedendo a questi punti potrai raccogliere risorse come cibo, armi, medicinali o altri oggetti che ti saranno utili per la sopravvivenza.

Oltre che i punti di interesse anche i giocatori nelle vicinanze saranno segnalati sulla mappa: ciò ti permetterà di scambiare con loro oggetti o semplicemente informazioni

Oltre a questo potrai creare alleanze che permetteranno a te e a gli altri giocatori che ne faranno parte di avere una serie di benefici. In quanto membri di una banda potrete prendere il controllo di alcuni punti di interesse: avrete accesso esclusivo a quelle risorse, almeno fino a quando qualche altra banda proverà a sottrarvele!

Infine, giocare attivamente insieme ad altri membri della tua banda (per esempio camminando insieme a loro per strada) migliorerà le skill del tuo personaggio e sarai in grado di sopravvivere più facilmente


Il mondo di Pandemia è popolato da altre due entità oltre che dai giocatori: gli zombie e gli NPC. L'intelligenza artificiale che sta dietro questi ultimi ti permetterà di avere un'esperienza di gioco magnifica anche se nella tua zona non sono presenti moltissimi giocatori reali.

Questi personaggi assumeranno un'ampia gamma di comportamenti: ti venderanno oggetti, ti assegneranno missioni da compiere e in alcuni casi ti potranno addirittura aiutare!

Caratteristiche del gioco

  • sistema a punti esperienza,
  • inventario e oggetti equipaggiabili,
  • interazione in tempo reale con gli altri giocatori sulla mappa,
  • interazione e combattimento in tempo reale con gli infetti sulla mappa,
  • missioni da svolgere,
  • NPC intelligenti,
  • moneta in gioco (P$) che ti permette di acquistare oggetti unici nello store.


PERCHÉ CI SERVE IL TUO AIUTO

Costruire un gioco come questo richiede tempo, soldi e molta esperienza di programmazione e game design. Abbiamo lavorato molto fino ad ora per costruire le parti centrali del gameplay (che puoi vedere nel video all'inizio della pagina) ma non possiamo costruire il gioco intero da soli.

I soldi verranno impiegati per arrivare entro 6 mesi di sviluppo a rilasciare la prima beta privata del gioco.

Ecco come verranno distribuiti i soldi che raccoglieremo attraverso questa campagna:
 


Non dimentdicare che contribuendo alla campagna otterrai anche uno dei nostri fantastici perks!

 

ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARCI

Se non puoi contribuire ci sono molti modi per aiutarci lo stesso e ottenere nel frattempo qualcosa di unico in cambio!

Condividere questa campagna è vitale per il suo successo così abbiamo voluto creare dei premi interessanti per le persone che vogliono aiutarci in questa maniera.

1) Condividi il link di questa campagna su Twitter e usa l'hashtag #pandemia

2) Condividi il link di questa campagna su Facebook e usa l'hashtag #pandemia

Quelli di voi che faranno una (o entrambe) le cose otterrano uno (o due) oggetti unici in-game nel momento del lancio!

FAQ

Pandemia è gratis?
Sì, Pandemia sarà rilasciato gratuitamente.

Devo necessariamente uscire per giocare a Pandemia?

Essendo un gioco in realtà aumentata la maggior parte delle volte dovrai trovarti all'esterno per poter giocare. Ci saranno alcune cose che potrai fare anche a casa ma il gioco vero e proprio si gioca per strada.

Devo avere il GPS acceso per giocare?

Sì, Pandemia richiede l'accesso alla tua posizione in tempo reale per poter giocare.

Che succede se spengo il GPS?
Non potrai giocare. Il tuo giocatore sparirà dalla mappa e poi riapparirà nel punto in cui riattiverai il GPS.GPS back on.

C'è il PVP in Pandemia?
No, per ora non prevediamo di inserire il PVP nel gioco.

 

Te gustaría un juego de supervivencia zombie que te hace sentir como un superviviente verdadero? Eres en el lugar exacto!

Desde cuando de niño he jugado a los primeros Resident Evil por la Playstation 1, me han encantado las películas y los juegos de zombie.
Aunque hay muchos juegos de este tipo que me han gustado, nunca he jugado a uno que me haya dado un experiencia similar a la que un sobrevivido
habría tenido en un mundo post apocalíptico. Si tu también la piensas así eres en el lugar exacto porque esta es exactamente la experiencia
que nosotros queremos darte con Pandemia.

Nuestra visión es de realizar un juego multiplayer en realidad aumentada que te permitirá de vivir un apocalipsis zombie en tu ciudad (o donde quieras).


EL JUEGO

Tu primero objetivo cuando juegas a Pandemia será sobrevivir. Tendrás que hacer todo lo que un superviviente verdadero haría para quedarse vivo,
por ejemplo: buscar comida, armas y otros cosas; relacionarte con otros supervivientes; luchar contra los infectados, etc...

Caminando por tu ciudad encontrarás algunos lugares de interés sobre el mapa y marcados da símbolos específicos. Accediendo a estos lugares puedes tomar cosas como comida, armas, medicinas o otros objetos que va a ser útil para tu sobrevivencia.

Mas que los lugares de interés también los jugadores cerca de ti van a ser marcados sobre el mapa: esto te permitirá de intercambiar con ellos
objetos o simplemente informaciones.

Mas que esto podrás crear alianzas que permitirán a ti y a los otros jugadores que también estarán en estas de tener muchos beneficios.
Como miembros de una banda podréis tener el control de algunos lugares de interés: tendréis acceso exclusivo a estas riscosas por lo meno
hasta cuando una otra banda entintará a quitarvelos.

Por fin jugar activamente junto a otros miembros de tu banda (por ejemplo caminando con ellos por la calle) hará mejor les skill de tu personaje
y serás mas fácil sobrevivir.


El mundo de Pandemia está poblado da dos otras entidades mas que de jugadores: los zombies y los NPC. L'intelligenzia artificial que está detrás
de estos te permite de tener una experiencia de juego increíble aunque en tu sitio no hay muchos jugadores verdaderos.

Estos personajes tendrán varios tipos de comportamientos: te van a vender objetos, te van a dar misiones da conseguir y, en algunos casos,
también te podrán ayudar.

Características del juego

- sistema a puntos experiencia
- inventario y objetos equipables
- interacciones en tiempo real con otros jugadores en el mapa
- interacciones y lucha en tiempo real con los infectados en el mapa
- misiones de hacer
- NPC inteligentes
- moneda en juego (P$) para comprar objetos únicos en el store


PORQUE NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA

Para construir un juego como esto necesita mucho tiempo, dinero y mucha experiencia de programación y game design. Hemos trabajado mucho hasta ahora
para construir las partes central del gameplay (que puedes veer en el video en cima a la pagina) pero no podemos construir el juego entero
solos.

El dinero será utilizado para llegar entro de seis meses de desarrollo a acabar la primera beta privada del juego.

Esto es como será repartido el dinero que recogeremos con esta campana:



No te olvides que contribuyendo a esta campana tendrás también uno de nuestros increíbles premios.

 

OTROS MODOS PARA AYUDARNOS

Si no puedes contribuir hay muchos otros modos para ayudarnos igualmente y obtener también algunos premios.

Postar esta campaña es muy importante por su éxito así que hemos querido crear premios interesantes para las personas que quieren ayudarnos de esta manera.


1) Postar el link de esta campaña en Twitter y utilizar el hashtag #pandemia
2) Postar el link de esta campaña en Facebook y utilizar el hashtag #pandemia

Los que harán una (o las dos) de estas cosas tendrán una o dos objetos únicos en el juego cuando haremos la beta privada.


FAQ

Pandemia es gratis?
Si.

Tengo necesariamente salir en la calle para jugar a Pandemia?
Como que es un juego de realidad aumentada la mayoría de las veces tendrás que salir a la calle para poder jugar. Hay algunas cosas que puedes hacer
también desde tu casa, pero el juego verdadero se juega por la calle.

Tengo que tener el GPS encendido par jugar?
Si.

Que pasa si apago el GPS?
No puedes jugar. Tu jugador va a desaparecer desde el mapa y luego va a aparecer en el lugar donde te encuentras cuando enciendes el GPS.


Hay PVP en Pandemia?
No.
story_txt:
WE'RE MOVING TO KICKSTARTER
This campaign is no longer running but Indiegogo doesn't allow to delete campaigns after they have received contributions. Read the latest update to hear why we're moving.

If you want to stay updated please like us on Facebook or visit our dev blog



CHECK OUT THIS CAMPAIGN IN YOUR LANGUAGE




 
 




English
Italiano
Español




 
GAMEPLAY VIDEO

 


Would you love a zombie survival game that makes you feels like an actual survivor? You're in the right place!
Since playing the first Resident Evil games for the Playstation 1 when I was a kid, I practically fell in love with zombie games and movies. Although there are many games I enjoyed playing I felt like none of them was actually giving me an experience somewhat near the one of a real survivor to a zombie apocalypse. If you share this feeling you're in the right place because that's exactly the kind of experience we want to give you with Pandemia!
 
Our vision is to create an augmented reality massively multiplayer online game that will let you live out a zombie apocalypse in your city (or wherever you are).



You main goal when playing Pandemia will be survival. You will have to do everything a survivor would do to stay alive, for example: look for food, weapons and other items; interact with other survivors; fight with the infected and so on...
As you walk within your city you will find several kinds of points of interest scattered on the map, marked by specific symbols. Accessing each one of them will allow you to collect resources such as food, weapons, medicinals and other items you can use to survive.
Other than point of interests nearby players will be also marked on the map, allowing you to trade items with them or just exchange information.
Besides that, you will be able to create alliances that will allow you and the other members to have a series of benefits. As a gang you will be able to take control of some points of interest: you will get exclusive access to those resources, until another gang tries to take control of them.
Moreover, actively playing with other members (for example, when they are walking with you on the street) will enhance your character's skills and you will be able to survive more easily.

 
The world of Pandemia is populated by two other kinds of entities other than players: zombies and computer characters. The AI behind them will allow you to enjoy an awesome playing experience even if there aren't a lot of players in your area.
Computer characters will have a large range of behaviours: they will sell you items, assign you quests and, sometimes, even help you with your problems!
Game Features

experience points system,
inventory and equippable items,
real time interaction with other players on the map,
real time interaction and combat with infected on the map,
quests and missions,
awesome AI for NPC,
currency system (P$) which you can use to buy exclusive items in the store.

 



Building a game like this requires time, money and many programming and game designing skills. We worked hard until now to build some core gameplay features (that you can see in the video on the top of the page) but we can't build the entire game on our own.
We will use the money to build a fully functional closed beta version of the game in 6 months.
Here's how the money you contribute to this campaign will be distributed:


 
 
Don't forget that by contributing to this campaign you will also get one of our awesome perks!

If you can't contribute there are plenty of ways you can still help us and in the meantime get something unique for your help!
Sharing this campaign is vital for its success so we have some cool rewards for those who can't contribute with their money but want to help us nonetheless:

 Share the link to this campaign on Twitter with the hashtag #pandemia
 Share the link to this campaign on Facebook with the hashtag #pandemia
Those of you who will do one of the previous things (or both) will get one (or two) unique in-game items!
 
 

Is Pandemia free?Yes, Pandemia will be released for free.
Do I necessarily have to walk to play Pandemia?Being that Pandemia is an augmented reality game, most of the time you will have to play when you are outside. There will be features to make the game playable at home but the real game is played on the streets.
Do I have to have my GPS turned on to play?Yes. Pandemia needs your position in real time.
What happens if I turn off the GPS while playing?You won't be able to play. Your player will disappear from the map and you will just reapper wherever you turn your GPS back on.
Is there PVP in Pandemia?No, as of now we don't plan on implementing any PVP feature.
 

Ti piacerebbe un gioco di sopravvivenza zombie che ti fa sentire come un vero sopravvissuto? Sei nel posto giusto!
Da quando da bambino ho giocato ai primi Resident Evil per la Playstation 1, mi sono da subito appassionato ai giochi e ai film zombie. Nonostante ci siamo molti giochi di questo tipo che mi sono piaciuti non ce ne è mai stato uno che mi abbia dato un'esperienza vicina a quella che un sopravvissuto avrebbeprovato in un mondo post-apocalittico. Se anche tu la pensi così sei nel posto giusto perché è esattamente il tipo di esperienza che vogliamo darti con Pandemia!La nostra visione è di creare un gioco multiplayer in realtà aumentata che ti permetterà di vivere un apocalisse zombie nella tua città (o dovunque tu ti trovi).
IL GIOCO
Il tuo scopo primario quando giochi a Pandemia sarà la sopravvivenza. Dovrai fare tutto quello che un vero superstite farebbe per rimanere in vita, per esempio: cercarecibo, armi e altri oggetti; interagire con gli altri superstiti; combattere contro gli infetti e così via...Camminando per la tua città troverai vari punti d'interesse sparsi sulla mappa e evidenziati da simboli specifici. Accedendo a questi punti potrai raccogliere risorse come cibo, armi, medicinali o altri oggetti che ti saranno utili per la sopravvivenza.Oltre che i punti di interesse anche i giocatori nelle vicinanze saranno segnalati sulla mappa: ciò ti permetterà di scambiare con loro oggetti o semplicemente informazioniOltre a questo potrai creare alleanze che permetteranno a te e a gli altri giocatori che ne faranno parte di avere una serie di benefici. In quanto membri di una banda potrete prendere il controllo di alcuni punti di interesse: avrete accesso esclusivo a quelle risorse, almeno fino a quando qualche altra banda proverà a sottrarvele!Infine, giocare attivamente insieme ad altri membri della tua banda (per esempio camminando insieme a loro per strada) migliorerà le skill del tuo personaggio e sarai in grado di sopravvivere più facilmente

Il mondo di Pandemia è popolato da altre due entità oltre che dai giocatori: gli zombie e gli NPC. L'intelligenza artificiale che sta dietro questi ultimi ti permetterà di avere un'esperienza di gioco magnifica anche se nella tua zona non sono presenti moltissimi giocatori reali.Questi personaggi assumeranno un'ampia gamma di comportamenti: ti venderanno oggetti, ti assegneranno missioni da compiere e in alcuni casi ti potranno addirittura aiutare!
Caratteristiche del gioco

sistema a punti esperienza,
inventario e oggetti equipaggiabili,
interazione in tempo reale con gli altri giocatori sulla mappa,
interazione e combattimento in tempo reale con gli infetti sulla mappa,
missioni da svolgere,
NPC intelligenti,
moneta in gioco (P$) che ti permette di acquistare oggetti unici nello store.

PERCHÉ CI SERVE IL TUO AIUTO
Costruire un gioco come questo richiede tempo, soldi e molta esperienza di programmazione e game design. Abbiamo lavorato molto fino ad ora per costruire le parti centrali del gameplay (che puoi vedere nel video all'inizio della pagina) ma non possiamo costruire il gioco intero da soli.
I soldi verranno impiegati per arrivare entro 6 mesi di sviluppo a rilasciare la prima beta privata del gioco.
Ecco come verranno distribuiti i soldi che raccoglieremo attraverso questa campagna: 

Non dimentdicare che contribuendo alla campagna otterrai anche uno dei nostri fantastici perks!
 
ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARCI
Se non puoi contribuire ci sono molti modi per aiutarci lo stesso e ottenere nel frattempo qualcosa di unico in cambio!Condividere questa campagna è vitale per il suo successo così abbiamo voluto creare dei premi interessanti per le persone che vogliono aiutarci in questa maniera.1) Condividi il link di questa campagna su Twitter e usa l'hashtag #pandemia2) Condividi il link di questa campagna su Facebook e usa l'hashtag #pandemia
Quelli di voi che faranno una (o entrambe) le cose otterrano uno (o due) oggetti unici in-game nel momento del lancio!

story:
What’s the deal?

We at GetTreasureHunting.com have hidden two treasures for you to find!  The first treasure is a chest of silver hidden somewhere in America.  Watch the video above to find out where!  We have also created an online treasure hunt which will contain 3 weeks of adventures and discovery.  The hunt may include puzzles, riddles, ciphers, history, cartography, and much more.  The first one to use their skills to figure out all the clues will win the prize.  That prize will be determined by the number of participants. Here is the breakdown of the major milestones:

As we reach each milestone, we will also release an additional clue for the real life treasure hunt in our video.  So, encourage your friends to sign up!


Bonus Hunt!

In addition to the online hunt, we will also be offering a bonus mini online hunt.  The bonus hunt will be just like the online hunt but with only one clue.  This will be released separately from our regular online hunt and the first person to solve the bonus hunt will receive a real piece of treasure.  We are going to keep it a secret what this treasure will be, but we assure you, you are going to want to win this one! 


How to play the online hunt:

1.  Read and decide which level of contribution you would like to select. 

2.  Once you have selected your level, you will be taken to PayPal’s site to pay.  No Paypal Account is required.

3.  Once you pay, you will receive a confirmation email welcoming you to the game.  If you do not receive this email within one week, then please send an email to gettreasurehunting@gmail.com.

4.  You will receive clues by email on the following dates (times are approximate):

     Bonus Hunt Clue  - Thursday April 3rd, 2014 at 9:00 PM EST

     1st Clue & Answer Sheet  - Friday April 4th, 2014 at 9:00 PM EST

     2nd Clue  - Friday April 11th, 2014 at 9:00 PM EST

     3rd Clue  - Friday April 18th, 2014 at 9:00 PM EST

Remember, you don’t have to be available when every clue is released; but, once the last clue is released, the race will be on. Therefore, we recommend being available then in order to have the best chance at winning.

5.  Use the clues received to solve the questions on your answer sheet.

6.  The first person with the correct answers will win the cash!


The Perks

So here’s what you get when you contribute:

Our Plan

At GetTreasureHunting.com we plan to hold regular online treasure hunts sending adventurers all around the world without even having to leave their living rooms.  We also hope to hide 8-10 real life treasures all around the country by the end of this year for those who wish to get out and enjoy a real treasure hunt.  With a bit of ingenuity and some Indiana Jones- like skill, you could be the next one to find millions in hidden treasure!  Any money raised from this campaign beyond what is used for the prizes will be put toward hiding more treasures all over the country.  We have set our goal level very low to make sure our online treasure hunt happens, but we hope to earn much more so we can hide bigger and better treasures!

Even if you are not ready to join our online hunt this time, we appreciate you sharing this campaign with your friends.  Remember, the more people that sign up for the online hunt, the more clues will be released for the real life treasure hunt.  So spread the word and good luck finding the treasure!

story: Hello
story_txt: Hello

story:
vote for us on Steam Greenlight http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=181136358



We are trying to create the ultimate mix of platforming mechanics, RPG elements, puzzles and fast-paced action games, all this combined with beautiful environments and settings. Profectus will give the player the tools to improve his character, change his weapons and skills as he progress through the many chapters of the game. One of our main goals is to create beautiful levels with exploration material that keep the player connected to the story line and feel of the game. Each level will have a back story  and a purpose in the main story line. Dark mines, ruins from ancient civilizations, enchanted forests, these are just some of the many places you will be able to explore.



You are Profectus, a fierce warrior, considered a hero by many kings and towns. You were summoned by King Maltas to find the key to an ancient weapon. This weapon is needed in order to defeat the incoming armies of orcs and goblins. The problem is that this key is composed by many pieces scattered across the known and unknown world. Your journey will take across valleys, deserts and even the underworld. Buy hurry you must, because with every passing minute the earth trembles as the vast armies of Rakos approach the human realm.

- a looting system allowing the player to change his weapons, abilities, find health and mana potions, gather money to buy all kind of items and perks.

- Fast-paced action where every second counts, deadly traps, boss fights that require fast acting and thinking.


- Attacks : the player will have 3 main attack slots, one will be the simple attack slot where the player will use his main weapon to perform damage, the second slot will be used by magi abilities and spells, and the third slot will be used by special combo melee attacks.

- Puzzles : The player will have to deal with creative puzzles in order to progress through some levels, from simple a simple maze to complex riddles.


Profectus is still in early development stages, but the game's core and direction is already defined. Now to expand the world of Profectus we need you!. A soundtrack is needed to set the mood of every level, we need more assets (enemies, objects, npcs) and to do that we will need to expand our development team. But with your help this is all possible.


Early Backer 10$ : A DRM-free digital copy of Profectus is yours to play

Adventurer 25 $ : all of the above plus, access to the beta and a PDF making of the game, with some concept art, assets and comments.

Warrior 40 $ : all of the above plus 2 more game keys (3 in total), and a special thank you email.

Hero 100 $ : all of the above plus get your name to appear in game, written in an ancient stone.

Legend 200 $ : all of the above,send us a weapon design and name it, it will appear in the game.

Inmortal 400 $ : all of the above (except weapon design) plus get to design and name one of the many in-game enemies!

vote for us on Steam Greenlight http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=181136358





We are trying to create the ultimate mix of platforming mechanics, RPG elements, puzzles and fast-paced action games, all this combined with beautiful environments and settings. Profectus will give the player the tools to improve his character, change his weapons and skills as he progress through the many chapters of the game. One of our main goals is to create beautiful levels with exploration material that keep the player connected to the story line and feel of the game. Each level will have a back story  and a purpose in the main story line. Dark mines, ruins from ancient civilizations, enchanted forests, these are just some of the many places you will be able to explore.




You are Profectus, a fierce warrior, considered a hero by many kings and towns. You were summoned by King Maltas to find the key to an ancient weapon. This weapon is needed in order to defeat the incoming armies of orcs and goblins. The problem is that this key is composed by many pieces scattered across the known and unknown world. Your journey will take across valleys, deserts and even the underworld. Buy hurry you must, because with every passing minute the earth trembles as the vast armies of Rakos approach the human realm.



- a looting system allowing the player to change his weapons, abilities, find health and mana potions, gather money to buy all kind of items and perks.


- Fast-paced action where every second counts, deadly traps, boss fights that require fast acting and thinking.




- Attacks : the player will have 3 main attack slots, one will be the simple attack slot where the player will use his main weapon to perform damage, the second slot will be used by magi abilities and spells, and the third slot will be used by special combo melee attacks.
- Puzzles : The player will have to deal with creative puzzles in order to progress through some levels, from simple a simple maze to complex riddles.


Profectus is still in early development stages, but the game's core and direction is already defined. Now to expand the world of Profectus we need you!. A soundtrack is needed to set the mood of every level, we need more assets (enemies, objects, npcs) and to do that we will need to expand our development team. But with your help this is all possible.






Early Backer 10$ : A DRM-free digital copy of Profectus is yours to play
Adventurer 25 $ : all of the above plus, access to the beta and a PDF making of the game, with some concept art, assets and comments.
Warrior 40 $ : all of the above plus 2 more game keys (3 in total), and a special thank you email.
Hero 100 $ : all of the above plus get your name to appear in game, written in an ancient stone.
Legend 200 $ : all of the above,send us a weapon design and name it, it will appear in the game.
Inmortal 400 $ : all of the above (except weapon design) plus get to design and name one of the many in-game enemies!

story:
UPDATE 20131012

We just put the project on steam! Visit our steam concept page HERE

WHAT IS PHLYNDIR?

Phlyndir is a classic fantasy role-playing game set in the breathtakingly imaginative world of Phlyndir, where players take on the role of a hero who, together with his companions, embark on an epic quest to save the world.

The game will be released on PC-windows only for now. Whether we will support other platforms still remains to be seen.

FEATURES

Universal Skill Tree. Play the way you want without having to worry about character classes, and skills. Choose the skills you want from a universal skill tree and build a character that is truly "you".

Runes. There are hundreds of runes in Phlyndir. These runes have qualities which boost your character's stats. Some runes are unique which may also grant your character special skills. Runes can be bought from merchants, found from enemies, obtained as a quest reward, or forged in a rune forge.

Weapons. While your character only uses a single type of weapon, there are different weapons of that same type. These weapons have different abilities which boost your character's power. Some weapons are unique which may also grant your character special skills. Weapons can be bought from merchants, found from enemies, or obtained as a quest reward.

Masters. Find, and Learn hundreds of skills, not in the universal skill tree, from masters scattered throughout the world. Choosing to learn from a master will affect your chances of learning from other masters of opposing schools. Masters may directly teach you skills, or give it as a quest reward.

Self Learning. Your character may learn special skills from repeatedly performing actions. These special skills often help your character become more efficient in performing the actions they stem from. Some self-learned skills are unique which may boost something else besides efficiency.

Titles. The inhabitants of Phlyndir will bestow titles on your character depending on how you have built him. Titles often come with passive bonuses to stats and power, however, titles may also grant your character special skills.

Classes. Your actions and how you fight affect the way the inhabitants of Phlyndir classify(know) your character. Classes often come with passive bonuses to stats and power, however, classes may also grant your character special skills.

Companions. Your character will receive help from different companions during his quest. The choices you make and the way you treat them determine your character's relationship with them. These companions evolve their abilities and personalities in combat based on your character's relationship with them.

STRETCH GOALS

$80,000

Female Love Interests. There will be (3) female NPCs scattered around the world that your character can marry. Courting one NPC will affect your chances of successfully courting the others. Successfully courting and marrying an NPC will give players access to special scenes.

LORE

Phlyndir is a world of floating continents separated by great mist oceans, and connected by massive sky bridges. The world is held together by a glowing blue core of immense power believed to have been created by the gods. A golden-white sun rises everyday to grace the land with light and warmth, and three moons, locked in a stationary triangular orbit with each other, make up the northern sky. Grasslands as far as the eye can see, lush meadows filled with flowers of all colors, thick forests full of vegetation, scorching desserts with endless dunes of sand, and great mountains with frozen snowy white peaks all make up the continents of Phlyndir.

STORY

Scattered across Phlyndir are great temple ruins from when the world was still whole. These ruins hold the knowledge, and secrets of a once great civilization now extinct. Expeditions by the current civilizations to uncover these temples' secrets are not uncommon, however, one fateful day an expeditionary group stumbles upon a dark secret, unleashing a threat that would ravage the land and change the world forever.

The player takes on the role of Calheit, one of the chosen few, to embark on an epic quest to stop the horrors that now plague the land, and save the world.

WHY PHLYNDIR?

Ever since I was young, I would pretend I had powers, copying the powers of superheroes in comics and on TV. I would imagine the world in hopeless situations from which I would heroically turn the tables around and save it, especially when my crush is in it. When the first role-playing games came out, I was instantly hooked. All of a sudden I was transported to a world where I have powers, and I got to save the world. I would spend days planning out every single aspect of my character to make it as powerful as I can, and months achieving it. Being able to wield powers, saving the world, and the girl always fascinated me.

Phlyndir is a world I've created through my habit of imagining these weird situations, and I would like to share this with the world (or people who are like me).

WHERE EXACTLY IS PHLYNDIR, AS A GAME, NOW?

For the past 2 years, I've put together a team to help me make Phlyndir a reality, doing odd jobs here and there just to keep both ends together (I'm a programmer). Up until recently, we've been experimenting with techniques and we've come a long way, in terms of quality, from our previous works (100% self-taught, there are no gaming companies/schools/anything where I am).

Now, I believe we are ready to take Phlyndir to the next level. I'm pretty confident in the mechanics engine of the game, and we're at the point where we just need to create assets to put into the game. Right now, almost everything are pretty much placeholder assets, except for our most recent works where we've finally figured out how to make them properly.

The money we will raise here will go to paying for the rent, electricity, water of the office/bunker/house/cave, salaries of the team., and contract works we need for the game. We are a team of 5, 1 Programmer (me), 2 for 3D assets, 2 for 2D assets. We are currently outsourcing sound and music, because we have no idea how to sound and music. Our monthly expenses amount to about $2,000. I've done some pencil pushing and we will need about $46,000 to finish the game. The $4,000 will cover the platform fees of indiegogo and the transfer/conversion fees to our local currency.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you've made a contribution, we are sincerely grateful, however, we ask that you do not stop there. Please help us reach our goal by spreading the word of our campaign. If you believe in those little daydreams of being a superhero and saving the world, please advocate for us to your families, friends, pets, strangers, politicians, police, local gangs, babies, businessman, and pretty much everyone.

I'm pretty confident in the mechanics engine of the game, and we're at the point where we just need to create assets to put into the game. Right now, almost everything are pretty much placeholder assets, except for our most recent works where we've finally figured out how to make them properly.
The money we will raise here will go to paying for the rent, electricity, water of the office/bunker/house/cave, salaries of the team., and contract works we need for the game. The $4,000 will cover the platform fees of indiegogo and the transfer/conversion fees to our local currency.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you've made a contribution, we are sincerely grateful, however, we ask that you do not stop there. Please help us reach our goal by spreading the word of our campaign. story:
The Features

  • Non-gamer friendly, as we do not require anything mechanically dependent, only critical thinking

  • Over 9 different heists for you to budget, plan, and execute

  • An adult narrative that blends Hollywood action and bitter realism

  • Get to explore more about the culture, and corruption set in this fictional Metro Manila

  • Choices matter, as picking the wrong equipment setup will lead to failure

  • Multiple endings will cover the success, and many fail states of the game, and each heist

Get in Touch

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thesunaintsettingyet/

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/SunAintSetting

The Demo

Play the demo here: http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-sun-aint-setti...

 

The Story

My name is Ming Salvador, a passionate indie developer who fell in love with video games for almost all his life. It is my dream to make a game that makes people think and enjoy themselves.

I decided to make this game out of my desire to make a heist game. I wanted to focus less on action and more into critical thinking. I also wanted to make a game that would introduce non-gamers to a more narrative and less mechanically demanding game. Eventually, I decided I wanted to make a text adventure game because it is easy to digest for most people. I also wanted to show more about the culture in the Philippines, the way people act, and the way things are done. 

What I came up with was "The Sun Ain't Setting Yet", which fulfills that unfulfilled niche in heist games. Instead of being a gunman, you play as the mastermind behind it all. Instead of handling a gun or grenades, you handle people, a budget, and the planning. No need to be able to aim fast or platform well, as most of the game requires you to plan how the heist will go. The guns you bring, the methods of breaching, civilian intimidation, and so on are completely up to you.

I want to make this dream a reality. That's why I have this Indiegogo started. I want to be able to fund my team to make this game come true. With your help, we'll be able to make this text adventure game come to life, with multiple thrilling, yet challenging heists for you to engage in. This is why on behalf on my team, I ask that you can support us so that we can work on this, because we want gaming to be recognized as having rich, smart, and fulfilling gameplay. 

The Characters

Throughout the campaign, we'll be slowly introducing each of our characters and their backgrounds. Get to know your heist crew, what they can do, and how to use them!

The Safecracker

Name: Isabel Rodriguez

Age: 24

Role: Safecracker

Specialties: Lockpicking, Architecture, Physics, Explosives

Strengths: Very intelligent. Knows how to get into a place when needed

Weaknesses: Does not like killing. Panics under pressure.

Educational Background: Degree in Architecture

Work Background: Former Architect at Valdez and Carpio Construction Firm - Terminated due to Breach of Contract for Estafa

The Enforcer

Name: Meifen (Katherine) Gan

Age: 27

Role: Enforcer

Specialties: Intimidation. Close Quarters Combat.

Strengths: Persuasive. Kills without Hesitation. Knows how to control a crowd.

Weaknesses: Very distrusting towards other people, even allies.

Educational Background: High School

Work Background: Former Triad - Moved to Philippines to watch Shabu Operations

The Stretch Goals

  • USD 10,000 – Funded 
    • This is the base amount needed to fund the game. If we reach this goal, we will be able to make the game covering the heists themselves.
  • USD 25,000 – Character Side Quests
    • We would ideally like to be able to write more about the characters themselves. If we were to reach this goal, then we could spend more time to work on character development. 
  • USD 50,000 – Character Theme Songs
    • Music makes games more interesting. If we get this amount, we'll also be able to fund our music director to come up with thematic songs for the main characters.
  • USD 100,000 – Character Trailers
    • Nothing gets people more excited than a good trailer. If we get this amount, we can help cater to that itch to know more about the game through the trailers.
  • USD 200,000 – Two Additional New Heists
    • The more the merrier. If we get this amount, that will allow us to work on even more heists.
  • USD 300,000 – Character Prologues
    • More fun when it's free. If we reach this amount, we'll be able to publish character prologues completely free for anyone to read! Learn more about the dramatic backgrounds of each main character!
  • USD 400,000 – Documentary
    • Want to know more about the story behind the story? We'll make our own documentary if we reach this.
  • USD 500,000 – A Free DLC Campaign (3 Heists)
    • Want more heists, for free? If we get this, we will make 3 free heists for anyone to play.

USD 200,000 – Two Additional New HeistsThe more the merrier. If we get this amount, that will allow us to work on even more heists.

USD 300,000 – Character ProloguesMore fun when it's free. If we reach this amount, we'll be able to publish character prologues completely free for anyone to read! Learn more about the dramatic backgrounds of each main character!

USD 400,000 – DocumentaryWant to know more about the story behind the story? We'll make our own documentary if we reach this.

story:
“Prophet!” said I, “thing of evil! — prophet still, if bird or devil! — Whether Tempter sent, or whether tempest tossed thee here ashore, Desolate, yet all undaunted, on this desert land enchanted — On this home by Horror Haunted ” ― Edgar Allan Poe, The Raven

Hi I am James the developer. Possessed is a hardcore story driven first person shooter. It features live action events, witty main characters and a strong focus on gameplay. 

― 6 powerful weapons with surrogate firing modes allow you to slice, blow holes, blow up and set your enemies on fire and more to come

― Over 20 blood-thirsty enemies to mow down as you battle your way through the asylum

― A large portion of the game is interactive. Shoot and destroy lights/glass objects, puncture pipes, blast doors off hinges. Explosive items such as fire extinguishers and barrels.

― The physics system is as real as it gets. Throw a stick of dynamite into a stack of boxes and watch them go flying. Force from bullets and explosions will knock plants off the walls and send objects hanging from chains swinging.

― Items that will aid you such as ammo, health packs, drugs and elixers.

― Intelligent mini map that will identify places of interest to guide you in the right direction. 

Check out the Greenlight page at http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

Funds are being used to create new exciting regions, increase the amount of weapons, better the graphics quality add multiplayer to the game.

story:
Click the banner to download the demo! (PC, Mac, and even Linux too!)

 

DON'T GIVE UP: A Cynical Tale in 10 Seconds:

 

 

Don’t Give Up: A Cynical Tale is the sarcastic and dark comedic RPG starring Tris, an anti-social game developer and his quest to confront his inner demons (mental illness). You'll balance the hilarious tragedy that is your social life while facing off with the phantoms of your inner conscious and a mysterious cast of characters.

 

 

The story takes place four years after the events of Tris’s mental breakdown. Now, living in a new city and feeling deflated by his progress as an indie game developer, the inner demons seek once again to consume his mind and unleash a catastrophic plague of apathy and despair upon the city.

 

 

There's two sides to DON'T GIVE UP's gameplay, a combination of narrative and open exploration, and significant instances of combat.

 

Exploration

You'll be able to explore the awesome sights of Threeson pretty freely, so familiarize yourself with the terrain in order to quickly track down quest NPCs and Items!

 

 

You'll Get into pizza scuffles- (and lots of other mischief)

 

Questionably flirt with the new girl who moved in...

 

You'll even ride through a rough patch or two. (or three)

 

Combat

The combat in DON'T GIVE UP unfolds in an original real time battle system that goes through two phases: The "Player Turn" and the "Enemy Turn"

 

ENEMY TURN 

 

The enemy gets to launch attacks while you do your best to dodge, counter, and parry! Your damage output is low, but you’ll be able to stack buffs, build special meter, and do light damage to the enemy!

 

PLAYER TURN

 

This is your time to shine! When Tris breaks the enemy’s guard his turn begins and he gets up close and personal! Tris can execute freestyle combos at will leading into  special moves that deal mass amounts of damage, buff, and hinder the enemy!

The combat continues to flow like this until the player or the enemy is defeated!

 

 

The game takes place in Threeson, a mini metropolitan city where many people move to get away from the turmoil of larger cities and mundane country life while still having access to all the major venues of entertainment. It’s got something for people of all ages, from arcades, to strip joints, to its very own mob if video games and watching people gyrate isn't your thing.

 

Just listen to this testimonial by Chloe who works at the locally owned candy shop. Chloe says and we quote, “This is definitely not the worst place I’ve ever lived.”

 

Here's a couple of more attractions you can check out during your stay:

The Snack in the Box is a great place for your general needs and to grab a refreshing Slurpy Freeze,

 

I hear the local Frat might be taking pledges soon.

 

If male curiosity and empty calories are more your speed then...

 

 

An anti-social game developer who suffers from chronic depression almost as much as he suffers from chronic sarcasm. Tris strives to find his purpose in life, and while he often hopes for success, he keeps himself grounded by ironically never expecting things to work out. He likes video games, cute girls, and… video games?  

 

Subris is an embodiment of Tris's positive energy that exists within his mind. Almost all of the positive entities were wiped out 4 years ago, but Subris managed to turn the tables and restore peace to the mind. They enjoy exploring the ever changing stimulated regions and listening to Nethertunes even though most entities have settled in the dormant areas.

 

Some other important folks:

 

 And let's not forget about Corey...

 

 

You'll meet him soon enough.

 

 

The Game!

 

Behind the Scenes Exclusive Crowdfund Promo Game!

 

Digital Visitor's Guide!

 

Become NPCs! 

 

Wow! You really made it all the way to the end!

Well, while you're here would you consider following me on Social Media?

 

Twitter

Facebook

 

Risks and challenges

This is my first commercial game, however I've been in the indie scene for over 5 years and have a lot of support. Jarnik has also been releasing games for over 6 years now. I've been working on DON'T GIVE UP for over 2 1/2 years and it's become a priority in my life. I'm very familiar with the art style, the writing, and design so I'm extremely confident about the scope and committed to staying on track. I'm ready to work around the clock to finish the game in early 2019-nothing short of a natural disaster or an untimely death will keep me from finishing this game on schedule ;)
story_txt: Click the banner to download the demo! (PC, Mac, and even Linux too!) DON'T GIVE UP: A Cynical Tale in 10 Seconds:  Don’t Give Up: A Cynical Tale is the sarcastic and dark comedic RPG starring Tris, an anti-social game developer and his quest to confront his inner demons (mental illness). You'll balance the hilarious tragedy that is your social life while facing off with the phantoms of your inner conscious and a mysterious cast of characters.  The story takes place four years after the events of Tris’s mental breakdown. Now, living in a new city and feeling deflated by his progress as an indie game developer, the inner demons seek once again to consume his mind and unleash a catastrophic plague of apathy and despair upon the city.  There's two sides to DON'T GIVE UP's gameplay, a combination of narrative and open exploration, and significant instances of combat. ExplorationYou'll be able to explore the awesome sights of Threeson pretty freely, so familiarize yourself with the terrain in order to quickly track down quest NPCs and Items!  You'll Get into pizza scuffles- (and lots of other mischief) Questionably flirt with the new girl who moved in... You'll even ride through a rough patch or two. (or three) CombatThe combat in DON'T GIVE UP unfolds in an original real time battle system that goes through two phases: The "Player Turn" and the "Enemy Turn" ENEMY TURN  The enemy gets to launch attacks while you do your best to dodge, counter, and parry! Your damage output is low, but you’ll be able to stack buffs, build special meter, and do light damage to the enemy! PLAYER TURN This is your time to shine! When Tris breaks the enemy’s guard his turn begins and he gets up close and personal! Tris can execute freestyle combos at will leading into  special moves that deal mass amounts of damage, buff, and hinder the enemy!The combat continues to flow like this until the player or the enemy is defeated!  The game takes place in Threeson, a mini metropolitan city where many people move to get away from the turmoil of larger cities and mundane country life while still having access to all the major venues of entertainment. It’s got something for people of all ages, from arcades, to strip joints, to its very own mob if video games and watching people gyrate isn't your thing. Just listen to this testimonial by Chloe who works at the locally owned candy shop. Chloe says and we quote, “This is definitely not the worst place I’ve ever lived.” Here's a couple of more attractions you can check out during your stay:The Snack in the Box is a great place for your general needs and to grab a refreshing Slurpy Freeze, I hear the local Frat might be taking pledges soon. If male curiosity and empty calories are more your speed then...  An anti-social game developer who suffers from chronic depression almost as much as he suffers from chronic sarcasm. Tris strives to find his purpose in life, and while he often hopes for success, he keeps himself grounded by ironically never expecting things to work out. He likes video games, cute girls, and… video games?   Subris is an embodiment of Tris's positive energy that exists within his mind. Almost all of the positive entities were wiped out 4 years ago, but Subris managed to turn the tables and restore peace to the mind. They enjoy exploring the ever changing stimulated regions and listening to Nethertunes even though most entities have settled in the dormant areas. Some other important folks:  And let's not forget about Corey...  You'll meet him soon enough.  The Game! Behind the Scenes Exclusive Crowdfund Promo Game! Digital Visitor's Guide! Become NPCs!  Wow! You really made it all the way to the end!Well, while you're here would you consider following me on Social Media? TwitterFacebook Risks and challengesThis is my first commercial game, however I've been in the indie scene for over 5 years and have a lot of support. Jarnik has also been releasing games for over 6 years now. I've been working on DON'T GIVE UP for over 2 1/2 years and it's become a priority in my life. I'm very familiar with the art style, the writing, and design so I'm extremely confident about the scope and committed to staying on track. I'm ready to work around the clock to finish the game in early 2019-nothing short of a natural disaster or an untimely death will keep me from finishing this game on schedule ;)

story:
Do you have a billion dollars to buy a sports team?  Neither do I.  So let's do the next best thing, and buy a sports team together. 

The Atlanta Hawks are for sale, and they're doing pretty darn well these days.  As a non-Arthur Blank Atlantan, I love the city and its sports teams, regardless of how well (Hawks) or not-so-well (Falcons, Braves) they do, but do not have the money to purchase one.  I have always wanted to be able to run a professional sports team, but barring winning the lottery (which I don't play), it's not going to happen.  So why not own PART of a team?

That's my idea.  It will take 6.5 million people, but every single person who throws in $100 will get a vote (online) on how to run the team.  Should we get a new coach?  Do we need to shake up the roster?  Should we go for that big-named free agent?  Every major decision will be voted upon by the 6.5 million "owners."  No politics, no favors-for-friends, no bs.  This is not limited to Atlantans, but everyone who has ever wanted to own part of, and have a say in, a sports team and how its run.

story:
We recommend watching the video in HD -- it's difficult to see  the game's shader effects & particle subtleties in SD.

 

Meta-nact?

Folders as portals, enemies representing real files, a convoluted story, collectible loot, unlocking of directories, scoring & customizable ships: Metanact aims to be a fun way of taking stress out on your files. Tedious english assignment? Blow it to smithereens. Enact on the Meta.

 

Why Crowdfund?

In it's current state; Metanact is (mostly) functionally complete: the problem is content. For the game to be proper fun, it needs more enemies, weapons, ships, voices, music tracks, loot & cinematics -- stuff which takes time to do (& money to contract out if need be!). Something we're not really prepared to do if people aren't actually interested in the game!
 
For us, $5k represents a solid 2-3 months of full time effort on the game, as well as possibly paying some professionals (Definitely open to doing a graphical overhaul or overwriting the soundtrack I wrote with someone else's if people wish, as much as it'd sadden me, heh)
 
We'll use a subset of the money for web-hosting -- a proper site, forum etc.
 
 

Technical stuff

Metanact was written completely from scratch in C++; using only a couple of libraries: namely SFML for graphics & audio, Boost.C++ for filesystem traversal; and JSONcpp for some parsing.

Metanact is currently Windows-only, because of the inherently big difference in filesystems across OSs, HOWEVER: If you're familiar with the technologies I've used; you'll realize they're all cross-platform. I hereby guarantee a Linux port if this gets funded. You can quote me on that.

 

About Seb

Programming since I was 8; & burning myself with a soldering iron since I was 9. Been developing games in C++ for the last 4 years or so; although it's by no means my specialty!

Formally, I'm a student, undergoing some exams over the next few months; after which (beginning november) I'll have so much free time I won't know what to do with it. This is when I'll be able to work on the game properly, and full-time.

I enjoy all things VR; playing the piano; and have recently broken into the CNC game with a ShapeOko open-HW CNC..

 

Other team members

I'm also enlisting the help of a good friend of mine - Josh Willsher, who's ideas and scriptwriting prowess have been paramount during the game's development. In addition: Win Holzapfel, my very capable brother, webmaster and filmographer (not for the current video, annoyingly; that was I) will take care of problems in those areas. They'll be submitting their own updates & text over the next week or so.

 

Some Extra Thanks

This thing wouldn't have gotten to where it is today without the inspirational ideas & motivation from such people as Dr. David W, Alex. S, Brendan. R, Bootsie. V, Mariam. G; Josh. R.

 

Thanks for your support!

 

Want to know more? Chuck us a post via Facebook, Twitter; this site or on the Crowd Funding Forums thread and we'll get back to you as quick as we can.

 

* Some well-informed folks over on reddit (I'm Schnommus) have informed me that an idea similar to this has actually been implemented before- 'Operation: Inner Space', a 1994 title. Still, I'd say the shaders, nicer graphics, smoother mechanics & cross-platform-ness should be enough to spark some interest in Metanact.

story:
Puedes ver la versión en español de este proyecto en mi web Modular Terrain.

 

ABOUT ME

Hello, my name is Luis. I've always loved board games, they are an easy way to have fun. Some friends, a board, some tokens a dice and, let's start playing! but even funiest games can become a little monotonous.

Asking myself what could be done to give them a new life I thought that fun could start at the time you throw the dice, so I redesigned dice towers a little.

 

THE DICE TOWERS

For those who don't know them, you should know they are many centuries old, and they were used even by Romans. Romans where smart, but they trusted no one and with dice towers they tried to make it difficult to players who were cheating with dice.

Nowadays they have other uses, for example, avoiding dices encounter with game figures and move or even break them. They can also avoid dices to end up under the couch or become your dog's meal.

 

MY DICE TOWERS

I thought a new utility so they have more influence in the game, giving it a new life and increasing the fun. To do this I have created towers with multiple exits, so it won't depend only on the dice number, but the exit door through it comes out that can modify the value of it.

You can use the tower exits to add new rules to the games.
According to the exit door through they come you can add, subtract, divide or multiply another value.
You can assign each door to a player and make that dices that come through his door only count for that player.
Decide the characteristics of a game character or his skills before start to play.
There are many possibilities to give a new life to your games using a tower with many exits.

Practical examples with the 4 exits Olite dice tower and the Parchis game:
-Modifying the result. We give each exit its own modification factor, x0, x1, x2 and x3 (or anything else that comes to mind).
-When the player throws the dice, value applies them to modify the door the dice have left, if the dice goes out the door x0 multiply its value by 0, it becomes 0, bad luck, but if it comes from the x3 door value multiplied by three, now you can run a lot. And if you play with your kids, math practice having fun.
-Chosing who plays. We assign each exit to a player and throw the dice for all players at once, each player moves his pawns using the values of all dice that have come through its door.
As usual, the player who moves first changes each turn, if dices come through your door, of course.

 

WHY INDIEGOGO

I could put my towers on my website and wait for people slowly knew them, or put them on Indiegogo and people start to have fun with them already. I opted for the second option.
I have more ideas for other dice towers, this campaign will serve me to check if people are interested in using dice towers in their games, and to know if it is worth spending more time designing new models.

 

MY PROJECT

 

PLEDGE LEVELS

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

ABOUT SHIPPING

The shipping costs depend on the total weight, I think its the fairest way to calculate the cost of each shipment.

Look at every product that interests you its weight, add them together, find your country in the list and see the shipping costs for that weight (up to 9kg).

Translated with Google Translation.
