story:
You can access the PayPal option through our website: www.KharonsCrypt.com

Kharon's Crypt is an eerie non-linear dungeon crawler game full of puzzles, riddles and deadly challenges, and graphics designed to follow the aesthetics of the beloved Game Boy Color. In Kharon's Crypt, you'll be playing as Kharon (a being thought to be death itself) in his mission to escape from the crypt where he had been sealed by a deranged king that wanted to elude death.

As Kharon, your abilities are flying, going through physical objects, and making your enemies feel dizzy. To defeat your opponents and escape from the crypt, you'll need to steal the bodies of your enemies by possessing them. You'll be able to fly in a bat's body, fight from inside a skeleton, or even use a mime's abilities to help yourself hide.

Do you have what it takes to escape from the crypt and compel the Deranged King to meet his fate?

We love retro games and want to do justice to the great old classics. All the funds will be fully invested in the development of the game.

The more we raise, the more epic the final result will be!

Here are our stretch goals to make the game a thousand times better!:

[Stretch goal are open until December 31st]

 

Possession

Due to being a spirit, Kharon can't inflict damage on his enemies or interact with physical objects. In order to face the crypt's many threats, you'll need to steal the bodies of Kharon's enemies by possessing them.

 

Ethereal Form

You can also turn yourself ethereal to pass through objects, which can be useful if you need to run away. Moreover, the ethereal state turns you invulnerable for a few seconds.

 

Enemies

The crypt is infested with dozens of different kinds of enemies. Each enemy has characteristics and abilities specific and exclusive to their body that you can take advantage of by possessing them. For example:

If you steal a winged being's body, like that of a bat, a Shan or a Byakhee, you'll be able to fly over the abyss of the crypt.

A Mime's body can help you remain undetected by other fearsome, powerful creatures.

But the most important and useful bodies for you will be the bodies that have hands. Since Kharon can't interact with physical objects as a spirit–and therefore can't open doors or chests, activate mechanisms, or use weapons–, stealing a body with hands will allow you to do so very easily.

 

Weapons

You will find dozens of different weapons in the crypt that you will be able to use as long as you possess a body with hands. Most of these weapons are too heavy to carry as a spirit, and they will drop to the ground when the possession is over. You can pick them up again by stealing a new body.

Main weapons such as swords, spears and axes have two types of offensive moves: a regular one and a special charge move unique to that weapon. Choosing the right weapon according to the situation will be the key to survive the many threats of the crypt.

Aside from the main weapons, you will also find throwing weapons, like Chakrams. Due to their light weight, they're easy to carry with you even when in your spirit form. However, you will still need to steal a body with hands in order to use them.

 

Cursed Objects

Cursed Objects are the rarest and most powerful weapons in Kharon's Crypt. They remain hidden in the depths of the crypt and they will come to great use when solving the puzzles and riddles that you will find in the crypt. These objects can be carried even in spirit form.

Haunted Urns

Like Kharon, other spirits were imprisoned in urns and sealed in the crypt. These urns hold within them the ire of hundreds of years of imprisonment, which will be unleashed once you break them.

You can break the urns either by throwing them or by striking them with a throwing weapon, like a Chakram.

 

Mirror of Nitocris

The Mirror of Nitocris can be used to deflect harmful flashes and lights to protect yourself.

The Mirror can also show the deepest fears and nightmares of anyone who looks in it.

The Haunted Urns and the Mirror of Nitocris are only two of the ten Cursed Objects that you will find in the crypt. Other Cursed Objects you will find are the Seeds from Lemb, the Járngreipr gauntlets, or the Iron Maiden.

 

Echoes of the Crypt

As you already know, the crypt is not only inhabited by terrifying creatures. There are also plenty of imprisoned spirits just like you.

The Echoes are the lost, undead souls of guardians that watch over the crypt.
They will offer you sound advice and useful clues, as well as sell you
maps of the different levels of the crypt. They will also be more than
willing to give you some of their prized items... for a reasonable price, of course.

 

Puzzles and Riddles

The crypt is filled with hundreds of puzzles and riddles designed to prevent Kharon from escaping that will put your quick-wit and reflexes to the test.

 

Bosses and Mini Bosses

Demons risen from the depths of hell watch over the thresholds of the crypt. If you want to get away from them alive, you will have no choice but to muster your courage and face these powerful beasts.

But brute force won't be enough to defeat Bosses in Kharon's Crypt.
You will need a combination of brains and brawn, and good strategies.
Some of the most fearsome ones will be completely invulnerable and our
mission will be to figure out how to harm them while trying to survive their brutal attacks.

Choose your weapons wisely before facing these demons, and remember–there's nothing stronger than the fear of death, and you are Death.

 

There was a King so deranged that he wished to defy his inevitable fate...Death.

When Kharon, the one who carries dead souls to their final rest, came to his castle, the Deranged King imprisoned Kharon in a cursed urn using black magic, thus preventing him from claiming the soul he had come to take.

However, the King knew that Kharon would not stay contained inside the urn forever, so he ordered to find the best and more experienced sorcerers and architects... To dig under his castle and build the most abyssal crypt ever built.

And, with the help of dark pacts and blood magic, he sealed Kharon's urn in it.

And the urn was left to rest in the depths of that eerie place.

And there it lay, still and intact, waiting in the dark. Until today...

Kharon is the main character. He is not Death, but if
someone were to describe Death, they'd be describing Kharon. "That is
not dead which can eternal lie," and tonight is the night Kharon finally
breaks free from the urn that had been containing him for hundreds of
years. Tonight is the night fate will be fulfilled, and none of the
hundreds of traps and demons that inhabit the crypt will be enough to
stop the wrath of the Lord of the Dead.

The Deranged King is the main antagonist. In order to defy
death, the King imprisoned Kharon in a cursed urn, and ordered to build
the most abyssal crypt that had ever been built to seal Kharon's urn in the depths of the crypt
using dark pacts and blood magic. The Echoes of the Crypt tell stories
about the King, and in all of them he's portrayed as a wise and kind
monarch. But derangement can cloud the vision of even the purest of men
when the shadow of death draws near.

They're the souls of people who died long ago and are now stuck in the crypt, unable to go to heaven or hell.
They want to help Kharon as they know it's the only way they can break
out of the crypt. Some of them will offer you their whisperings
(advice), others will give you clues and others will sell you items in
exchange for coins to pay for their passage to the afterlife. However,
years of ethereal existence have made them very forgetful, and some of
them can't remember their names, or if they were even human in the first
place. But one thing they know for sure is that they are one with
music, as music comes from the soul. And since for them pronouncing
lines that don't combine is nothing short of a crime, they speak in
rhymes at all times.

The Horrors are Kharon's enemies, but they can also become his weapons. Most of them wander the crypt aimlessly, but the worst Horrors are the ones that seal the thresholds to prevent Kharon from reaching the surface. But those are not the only Horrors you will see in this crypt. The closer you get to the exit, the more terrifying the Horrors you will encounter–Leng Spiders, Ghouls, Ghasts, Yigs, Shans, Byakhees, Wendigos or even Hounds of Tindalos.

There are also Demons that come to the crypt from the depths of hell just to have some fun getting their revenge on Kharon, since he was the one who sent them there and they still hold their grudges against him. They enjoy torturing Kharon and love how dull and eerie the world has become since he was imprisoned.

 

Gameplay-wise, Kharon’s Crypt is inspired by all the game influences that we had during our childhood. It’s mainly inspired by The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages & Oracle of Seasons, Hebi's favorite childhood games. They mean a lot to him as they were his first Zelda games, and some of the first games to make him spend months trying to solve many of their puzzles and challenges.

However, gameplay and playability are not everything. For us, the plot is a key component of a video game. That’s why we did our research and read the greatest book by two of the best horror writers, H.P. Lovecraft and Edgar Allan Poe, to prepare before writing Kharon's Crypt's script.

But literature has not been our only influence. In order to design Kharon's Crypt's universe, we've redesigned bits and pieces of universal mythology and then combined them with the wonder that is Lovecraft's lore. Just to name an example: Kharon, our protagonist, is not just the same Kharon from Greek mythology. He is also partially Osiris from Egyptian mythology and
Yog-Sothoth from Lovecraft's lore.

By helping us you will not only make the game possible, but you will also earn amazing rewards available only for IndieGoGo backers.

 

Specter of Discord IGG - €11

The crypt awaits you! In return for your contribution, you will receive a digital copy of the game (PC, Mac or Linux). Not only that, but you will also receive an access pass to join our private Discord channel in which you will be able to see how the game is being developed and talk to the development team in real time!

We will also show you our deepest appreciation by immortalizing your name in the credits of Kharon’s Crypt!

Includes:

  • Game (PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)
  • Name in the credits
  • Access to our private Discord channel

-

Whispering Raven IGG - €15

In return for your contribution, you will receive a digital copy of the game (PC, Mac, Linux or Nintendo Switch).

Wait, so you want more than just your name in the credits? Then here’s your chance to write a message that will be included in the credits of Kharon’s Crypt! (But keep it nice, there might be ghosts reading them!)

You will also receive a digital copy of the complete OST in HD and a digital copy of the game’s Instruction booklet (manual + art book), similar to those you used to get when purchasing a game.

Includes:

  • Game (Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)
  • Name in the credits
  • Access to our private Discord channel
  • Write a message in the credits
  • Instruction booklet (manual + art book) (digital copy)
  • OST (digital copy)

-

Whispering Two Headed Raven IGG - €26

In return for your contribution, you will receive a two digital copies of the game (PC, Mac, Linux or Nintendo Switch).

Includes:

  • Game (Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)
  • Game (Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)
  • Name in the credits
  • Access to our private Discord channel
  • Write a message in the credits
  • Instruction booklet (manual + art book) (digital copy)
  • OST (digital copy)

-

Collector Old School Reaper IGG - €49 - LIMITED RUN  39 Units Left

You will receive a physical copy of the game for PC, Mac or Linux. You will also get a physical copy of the instruction booklet (manual+ art book) and the Kharon’s Crypt OST in CD format all inside the special edition retro style collector’s box!

But wait, what if you happen to be a collector who doesn't like to take items out of their packaging? No problem! You will also receive a digital copy of the game, digital OST and a digital copy of the instruction booklet alongside the physical copies!

This pack also includes a Limited Run Early Access Pass. You will be able to try Kharon’s Crypt out while the game is being developed. That means you will experience it before everyone else!

Aside from that we will immortalize your soul by adding your own Echo (Ghost) to the game! You just have to choose your appearance and a line for your Ghost to say! Kharon's Crypt's Ghosts speak in rhymes at all times, but don't worry if you can't come up with anything that rhymes, we'll lend you a hand.

Includes:

  • Game (Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)
  • Game (physical copy) (Pc, Mac or Linux)
  • Instruction booklet (manual + art book) (physical copy)
  • Original OST (CD)
  • Special Edition Retro Style Collector’s Box
  • Early Access Pass
  • Design your own Echo (ghost) for the game
  • Write a message in the credits
  • Instruction booklet (manual + art book) (digital copy)
  • OST (digital copy)
  • Name in the credits
  • Access to our private Discord channel
story_txt:
You can access the PayPal option through our website: www.KharonsCrypt.com Kharon's Crypt is an eerie non-linear dungeon crawler game full of puzzles, riddles and deadly challenges, and graphics designed to follow the aesthetics of the beloved Game Boy Color. In Kharon's Crypt, you'll be playing as Kharon (a being thought to be death itself) in his mission to escape from the crypt where he had been sealed by a deranged king that wanted to elude death.As Kharon, your abilities are flying, going through physical objects, and making your enemies feel dizzy. To defeat your opponents and escape from the crypt, you'll need to steal the bodies of your enemies by possessing them. You'll be able to fly in a bat's body, fight from inside a skeleton, or even use a mime's abilities to help yourself hide.Do you have what it takes to escape from the crypt and compel the Deranged King to meet his fate?We love retro games and want to do justice to the great old classics. All the funds will be fully invested in the development of the game.The more we raise, the more epic the final result will be!Here are our stretch goals to make the game a thousand times better!:[Stretch goal are open until December 31st] PossessionDue to being a spirit, Kharon can't inflict damage on his enemies or interact with physical objects. In order to face the crypt's many threats, you'll need to steal the bodies of Kharon's enemies by possessing them. To possess your enemies, you have to make them feel dizzy first. Once they're knocked down, you can possess their bodies.  Ethereal FormYou can also turn yourself ethereal to pass through objects, which can be useful if you need to run away. Moreover, the ethereal state turns you invulnerable for a few seconds. EnemiesThe crypt is infested with dozens of different kinds of enemies. Each enemy has characteristics and abilities specific and exclusive to their body that you can take advantage of by possessing them. For example:If you steal a winged being's body, like that of a bat, a Shan or a Byakhee, you'll be able to fly over the abyss of the crypt.   
By stealing a fluid body like that of a Slime, you'll be able to slip through surfaces. A Mime's body can help you remain undetected by other fearsome, powerful creatures. But the most important and useful bodies for you will be the bodies that have hands. Since Kharon can't interact with physical objects as a spirit–and therefore can't open doors or chests, activate mechanisms, or use weapons–, stealing a body with hands will allow you to do so very easily.  WeaponsYou will find dozens of different weapons in the crypt that you will be able to use as long as you possess a body with hands. Most of these weapons are too heavy to carry as a spirit, and they will drop to the ground when the possession is over. You can pick them up again by stealing a new body.  Main weapons such as swords, spears and axes have two types of offensive moves: a regular one and a special charge move unique to that weapon. Choosing the right weapon according to the situation will be the key to survive the many threats of the crypt. Aside from the main weapons, you will also find throwing weapons, like Chakrams. Due to their light weight, they're easy to carry with you even when in your spirit form. However, you will still need to steal a body with hands in order to use them. Cursed ObjectsCursed Objects are the rarest and most powerful weapons in Kharon's Crypt. They remain hidden in the depths of the crypt and they will come to great use when solving the puzzles and riddles that you will find in the crypt. These objects can be carried even in spirit form.Haunted Urns Like Kharon, other spirits were imprisoned in urns and sealed in the crypt. These urns hold within them the ire of hundreds of years of imprisonment, which will be unleashed once you break them.You can break the urns either by throwing them or by striking them with a throwing weapon, like a Chakram. Mirror of NitocrisThe Mirror of Nitocris can be used to deflect harmful flashes and lights to protect yourself.The Mirror can also show the deepest fears and nightmares of anyone who looks in it.The Haunted Urns and the Mirror of Nitocris are only two of the ten Cursed Objects that you will find in the crypt. Other Cursed Objects you will find are the Seeds from Lemb, the Járngreipr gauntlets, or the Iron Maiden. Echoes of the CryptAs you already know, the crypt is not only inhabited by terrifying creatures. There are also plenty of imprisoned spirits just like you.The Echoes are the lost, undead souls of guardians that watch over the crypt.They will offer you sound advice and useful clues, as well as sell youmaps of the different levels of the crypt. They will also be more thanwilling to give you some of their prized items... for a reasonable price, of course. Puzzles and RiddlesThe crypt is filled with hundreds of puzzles and riddles designed to prevent Kharon from escaping that will put your quick-wit and reflexes to the test. Bosses and Mini BossesDemons risen from the depths of hell watch over the thresholds of the crypt. If you want to get away from them alive, you will have no choice but to muster your courage and face these powerful beasts.But brute force won't be enough to defeat Bosses in Kharon's Crypt.You will need a combination of brains and brawn, and good strategies.Some of the most fearsome ones will be completely invulnerable and ourmission will be to figure out how to harm them while trying to survive their brutal attacks.Choose your weapons wisely before facing these demons, and remember–there's nothing stronger than the fear of death, and you are Death. There was a King so deranged that he wished to defy his inevitable fate...Death.When Kharon, the one who carries dead souls to their final rest, came to his castle, the Deranged King imprisoned Kharon in a cursed urn using black magic, thus preventing him from claiming the soul he had come to take.However, the King knew that Kharon would not stay contained inside the urn forever, so he ordered to find the best and more experienced sorcerers and architects... To dig under his castle and build the most abyssal crypt ever built.And, with the help of dark pacts and blood magic, he sealed Kharon's urn in it.And the urn was left to rest in the depths of that eerie place.And there it lay, still and intact, waiting in the dark. Until today...Kharon is the main character. He is not Death, but ifsomeone were to describe Death, they'd be describing Kharon. "That isnot dead which can eternal lie," and tonight is the night Kharon finallybreaks free from the urn that had been containing him for hundreds ofyears. Tonight is the night fate will be fulfilled, and none of thehundreds of traps and demons that inhabit the crypt will be enough tostop the wrath of the Lord of the Dead.The Deranged King is the main antagonist. In order to defydeath, the King imprisoned Kharon in a cursed urn, and ordered to buildthe most abyssal crypt that had ever been built to seal Kharon's urn in the depths of the cryptusing dark pacts and blood magic. The Echoes of the Crypt tell storiesabout the King, and in all of them he's portrayed as a wise and kindmonarch. But derangement can cloud the vision of even the purest of menwhen the shadow of death draws near.They're the souls of people who died long ago and are now stuck in the crypt, unable to go to heaven or hell.They want to help Kharon as they know it's the only way they can breakout of the crypt. Some of them will offer you their whisperings(advice), others will give you clues and others will sell you items inexchange for coins to pay for their passage to the afterlife. However,years of ethereal existence have made them very forgetful, and some ofthem can't remember their names, or if they were even human in the firstplace. But one thing they know for sure is that they are one withmusic, as music comes from the soul. And since for them pronouncinglines that don't combine is nothing short of a crime, they speak inrhymes at all times.The Horrors are Kharon's enemies, but they can also become his weapons. Most of them wander the crypt aimlessly, but the worst Horrors are the ones that seal the thresholds to prevent Kharon from reaching the surface. But those are not the only Horrors you will see in this crypt. The closer you get to the exit, the more terrifying the Horrors you will encounter–Leng Spiders, Ghouls, Ghasts, Yigs, Shans, Byakhees, Wendigos or even Hounds of Tindalos.There are also Demons that come to the crypt from the depths of hell just to have some fun getting their revenge on Kharon, since he was the one who sent them there and they still hold their grudges against him. They enjoy torturing Kharon and love how dull and eerie the world has become since he was imprisoned. Gameplay-wise, Kharon’s Crypt is inspired by all the game influences that we had during our childhood. It’s mainly inspired by The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages & Oracle of Seasons, Hebi's favorite childhood games. They mean a lot to him as they were his first Zelda games, and some of the first games to make him spend months trying to solve many of their puzzles and challenges.However, gameplay and playability are not everything. For us, the plot is a key component of a video game. That’s why we did our research and read the greatest book by two of the best horror writers, H.P. Lovecraft and Edgar Allan Poe, to prepare before writing Kharon's Crypt's script.[Edgar Allan Poe and Howard Phillips Lovecraft]But literature has not been our only influence. In order to design Kharon's Crypt's universe, we've redesigned bits and pieces of universal mythology and then combined them with the wonder that is Lovecraft's lore. Just to name an example: Kharon, our protagonist, is not just the same Kharon from Greek mythology. He is also partially Osiris from Egyptian mythology andYog-Sothoth from Lovecraft's lore.[Kharon by Gustave Doré, Osiris from the Book of the Dead and Yog-Sothoth by John Coulhart]
 
Like it? Hate it? We want to know your opinion! The community is a very important element for us and we want to hear you out! Leave a comment with your opinion and feedback!!
 
By helping us you will not only make the game possible, but you will also earn amazing rewards available only for IndieGoGo backers. Specter of Discord IGG - €11The crypt awaits you! In return for your contribution, you will receive a digital copy of the game (PC, Mac or Linux). Not only that, but you will also receive an access pass to join our private Discord channel in which you will be able to see how the game is being developed and talk to the development team in real time!We will also show you our deepest appreciation by immortalizing your name in the credits of Kharon’s Crypt!Includes:
Game (PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)
Name in the credits
Access to our private Discord channel
-Whispering Raven IGG - €15In return for your contribution, you will receive a digital copy of the game (PC, Mac, Linux or Nintendo Switch).Wait, so you want more than just your name in the credits? Then here’s your chance to write a message that will be included in the credits of Kharon’s Crypt! (But keep it nice, there might be ghosts reading them!)You will also receive a digital copy of the complete OST in HD and a digital copy of the game’s Instruction booklet (manual + art book), similar to those you used to get when purchasing a game.Includes:
Game (Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac or Linux) (digital copy)

story:
We're Adding A Removable Battery!
Stay Tuned For The Updated Sidepad Mod!

We were the 1st team ever to create a Gamepad Moto Mod at NYC's Mod the Future Hackathon where we placed as one of the winners!​

Creating the Gamepad was actually the easy part! Now we're working on making the Sidepad into a low-profile Mod that is comfortable to hold. Transforming your Moto Z phone into an on the go Gaming Console!  

Motorola Engineers said at the Hackathon said that we "broke new ground" and "it was judged as one of the very best projects we saw."  

This Game Controller is made by Gamers, for Gamers!


We have worked so hard to get this far, now we need your help to bring the Sidepad to market!

How is the Sidepad different from other mobile game pads?

Unfortunately, the best Bluetooth controllers are bigger than the phones! Bulky game pads aren't great for carrying around and Bluetooth connectivity isn't responsive enough for games that require high accuracy. Like when you miss a shot in a first-person shooter because the game pad isn't fast enough to register the button click! We truly hate that! So in an effort to make something that we wanted, we built a game pad that connects directly to the phone. The Sidepad game pad is both responsive and easy to hide away. The Sidepad Moto Mod is a game pad for true mobile gamers!

Our Background

We remember how exciting the prospect of mobile gaming was. We also remember how disappointed we were when the games we played on our nice smart phones couldn't compare to our console experience. So, we hacked our phones and connected our XBox controllers. Mobile gaming got a  little better, and yet, it was still disappointing. Buttons not registering, directional controls being delayed, and controllers disconnecting during game play.... all side effects of an immature gaming experience. This is why we are so passionate about bringing a game pad to market. We can finally start to have console experiences on our phones instead of buying separate mobile gaming devices!

We’re seasoned technologists who love mobile games! With your contribution, we will give you the greatest mobile game pad in the world!

We need your help!

We're seeking your help to take our prototype to production. We have built the software and the basic hardware for a controller that connects to the Moto Z as a Mod.  We've also designed the size and shape of the game pad  (Pictured Below).  We need your support to combine the models we've built with our working prototype. A successful campaign will allow us to manufacture and distribute the Sidepad Mod with the help of our partners!

 

 

What's next?

  • Our goal will allow us to build the Sidepad Mod for distribution. We have already had meetings with manufacturing partners, let's show them that this is the product that people want for true mobile gaming!

  • We want to add a camera and battery into the product. This has not been implemented, but we want to bring our supporters a complete game pad Mod

What are people saying?

People on Reddit loved the idea so much that we decided to go all the way with this project!

"As a former Xperia Play owner, and future Moto Z Play owner, you have no idea how much I want that gamepad."

 

Sidepad Mod in the Press:

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't a gamer, but want to become one, please contribute to our campaign!

    If you aren't a gamer but know someone who is, please send them a link to our campaign! 

    If you like our story, please contribute to our campaign!

    Pre-order your Sidepad Today!

story:
About campaign

Greetings, would like to tell a few words about myself. My name is Andrii, I am a professional programmer, who wants to become a professional game developer and dedicate myself to this path. I like to make and play games. Sometimes I write fantasy stories.

Now I want to introduce to you my action RPG game "Stories of Noorides". Noorides is the name of the world in this story. This game is an epic voxel story where you have to get used to the role of a magician who learns how to control his strength and emotions. The main challenge for him is to meet his fears and win over them.

For more immersion in the game you have to not just press the buttons to use magic, you must draw the runes that cast spells. You can improve spells and learn new ones.

On your road to the goal you will face a lot of enemies. In order to win, you must cleverly use your magic power to kill these enemies. Another challenge that can occur on your path is solving ancient puzzles. Puzzles will require careful study of the environment and logical thinking.

Also, you will face unique bosses who require special tactical solutions. Facing a boss helps you to understand who your mage really is.

Financial goal

The main purpose of fundraising is to get the opportunity to dedicate myself completely to the development of the game. Also, to buy music for the game. If I can get more money, additional things will be done.

  • $7000 - main goal;
  • $13 000 - added more additional content;
  • $15 000 - more sound effects;
  • $20 000 - port to Android and iOS;

The Impact

Your donation will help to dedicate myself to the game. That will make the game very exciting for you. The donation allows me to not waste time on a job and spend all time for the game.

Risks & Challenges

The main problem I may face is the long process of creating a game if the required amount is not collected.

I don't have to deal with technical issues because I'm a programmer and have 2 years of experience with Unity3D. All the basic mechanics already made for the game

Contact me

  • mail: stories.from.noorides@gmail.com
  • Discord channel: https://discord.gg/a3sxtd

story:
Campaign Goals

Hello, Supporters! My name is Michael and I'm raising money to launch a website that will host free video game assets for indie developers. The assets will be royalty-free and can be used in commercial games without the need for attribution.

If you've ever tried to make a game from scratch, you know how demotivating it can be when you realize how much time will be spent simply making assets. I've been in that very situation myself. This is exactly why I'm passionate about creating a solution to these roadblocks. With your help, we can help brilliant stories come to life when developers get the resources they need.

What are my qualifications? I'm an experienced independent web developer with several websites under my belt, as well as, numerous other programming projects. I also have two years worth of experience with creating low poly models and game development. If you want to know more about my skills, please check out my LinkedIn and GitHub profiles.

Project Details

Financial info for 2 years:

  • Domain Name (Private Domain Registration)
    • $43.96
  • Hosting Server
    • $407.76
  • SSL (Secure Sockets Layer)
    • $127.98
  • Virus/Malware Scanning Service
    • $167.76

What if the project goal isn't met? I will do whatever it takes to get the site up and running, however, I may need to introduce budget cuts with regards to server hardware and performance. Security will always be the highest priority no matter how small the budget is.

Game Developer Community Impact

My campaign aims to improve the game development community by doing the following:

  • Giving new game developers a resource to get them started quickly.
  • Provide game assets that can be easily modified to meet the needs of each indie developer.
  • Allow developers to use the assets in any game without worrying about legal issues.
  • Eventually, I would like to provide other assets such as audio clips, animations, scripts, and templates.

Challenges

Every project has its challenges and mine is not exempt from that. So here is a list of potential challenges that could arise during and after the project.

  • Project funding doesn't reach 100%
    • Impact: I may need to run the website on a lower performance server. Security (SSL & Malware Scanning) will always be the priority over performance.
  • Insufficient revenue stream from ads after website launch
    • Impact: Again, I may need to downgrade to a lower performance server.
    • Mitigation: Boost revenue via Twitch streaming events throughout the year until ad revenue becomes sustainable.

No Money? No Problem.

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some amazing things you can do:

  • Share this campaign on social media. Twitter and Facebook are excellent for sharing among friends.
  • Share this campaign in forums related to game development and 3D modeling.

story:
Our names are Dave and James and we are the co-founders of Die-Atomic Games.   We are two broke university students who have a passion for games, and would like to share this passion with the world. We enjoy all types and styles of gaming. We play miniature games, board games, card games, role-playing and anything else we can get our hands on.  Since we were so involved in gaming we always dreamed about having a place to share our ideas and knowledge with other people. We have always wanted to create a site where we could post battle reports, reviews, tutorials, tips and tricks, among other content about the games that we have grown to love. The problem is, we are students and simply don’t have the disposable income to keep up with all the games we enjoy. Additionally, we didn’t have the funding necessary to ensure that the website we created could grow and develop at the quality level we would demand.

This is where you come in! With the help from contributions made from other people who love gaming our goal is to create a community site where people can come together and share their passion for the games they enjoy. We plan on funding the site long term by creating a web-store that will support the site and supply people with the games they know and love at a reasonable price. Because we are students, and know how expensive gaming can be, we will do our very best to provide products at fair prices. We hate being gouged by big box stores because of their high overhead. We hope that with our minimal running expenses it will allow us to pass on the saving to our customers and dedicated community members. We believe that everyone should be able to afford the games they love.

Aside from the store, we plan to do great things with the site. We would like to create reviews for the latest and greatest games as well as the classics that everyone knows and loves. We also plan on posting tutorials on how to play the games we offer so that people who are new and are interested can come and learn how to play. Dave is a future educator and has taken on creating these tutorials to help relieve some of the challenges that new players can face when learning a new game. In addition we will definitely be providing battle reports and tutorials on a variety of wargames, as this is one of our favorite styles of gaming.  James is our resident artist, and he would like the opportunity to share some of his painting skills and talents with everyone through a series of instructional videos. To ensure that everyone is included in our site, we also have the Ladies of Die Atomic who plan on offering a variety of content on gaming from the female perspective. We will strive to ensure that there will be content for everyone at Die Atomic Games.

Not only do we want to create our own content, we also want the community to have a part in the content that is posted on the site.  If there is anything that you would like to see, we are open to suggestions. Also if you are someone who is interested in creating your own content, we would like to be able to allow users to submit content to us, that will be reviewed and posted to the site. We want you to be involved in our site, we want you to be a part of this larger gaming network.

Die Atomic Games is a project that has come from the passion and the drive of people who love gaming in all its forms. We want to bring the feel of a friendly neighbourhood game store directly to you. We want to create a place where anyone can gather, learn and share their experiences and ideas. This isn’t the end of our ideas…this is just the beginning. We have plans for the future and if you’re lucky we might just let you in on some of them. We thank you for your support. Die Atomic Games…more than your friendly neighbourhood gaming store.

Cost Breakdown ($11625 budget after IndieGoGo and Third Party Fees):

$6780 Qoute for website/store construction and design.

$240 For 1 year of web hosting.

$360 to Secure payment through paypal.

$525 For business licensing.

$1000 Working office budget (Office supplies, shipping materials, etc).

$1000 Perk budget. 

$1720 To cover initial orders, shipping and unforseen costs. 

We think it is important to have a site that is held to a higher standard and is easy to use, which is why we asked for multiple qoutes from professional website developers and took the best one. 

Here are some examples of the painting quality you can expect with some of our perks:

Our names are Dave and James and we are the co-founders of Die-Atomic Games.   We are two broke university students who have a passion for games, and would like to share this passion with the world. We enjoy all types and styles of gaming. We play miniature games, board games, card games, role-playing and anything else we can get our hands on.  Since we were so involved in gaming we always dreamed about having a place to share our ideas and knowledge with other people. We have always wanted to create a site where we could post battle reports, reviews, tutorials, tips and tricks, among other content about the games that we have grown to love. The problem is, we are students and simply don’t have the disposable income to keep up with all the games we enjoy. Additionally, we didn’t have the funding necessary to ensure that the website we created could grow and develop at the quality level we would demand.

story:
My Story

My name is Maria Puy Arrastia, I am an spanish engineer and I have been working for some years with people with disabilities. In one of my projects, a speech therapist told me about their difficulty to find cool modern video games that can be played with one switch. Since I have some experience developing video games, I have decided to start developing video games for people with physical disabilities. But I need some help to hire people to design the graphics and this is why I need you. 
With your help, the video game will have awesome graphics made by experts so I will have time to do what I really love, programming.

I believe that is very important for everybody to have a good quality leisure time. This is what let you face the obstacles with optimism. In America, 58% of people choose to spend part of their leisure time playing video games. It is not an option for people with some disabilities that find hard to use gamepads, computer mouses or touchscreens.

Me llamo María Puy Arrastia, soy una ingeniera española y he estado trabajando durante algunos años con personas con discapacidad. En uno de mis proyectos, una logopeda me contó lo difícil que era para ellos encontrar videojuegos modernos que pudieran ser jugados con un solo switch. Como tengo experiencia desarrollando videojuegos, he decidido empezar a desarrollarlos para personas con discapacidad física. Pero necesito ayuda para contratar a personas que trabajen en el diseño y es por eso que te necesito a ti.
Con tu ayuda, el videojuego tendrá buenos gráficos diseñados por expertos y yo tendré tiempo para dedicarme a lo que realmente me encanta, la programación.
Creo que es muy importante para las personas poder tener un tiempo de ocio de calidad. Esto es lo que nos permite enfrentarnos a los obstáculos con optimismo. En América, el 58% de las personas eligen pasar parte de su tiempo de ocio jugando a videojuegos. Esta no es una opción para algunas personas con discapacidad física que encuentran difícil usar mandos, ratones o pantallas táctiles. 


The game

For the first project, I have chosen the tower defense genre for several reasons:
  • The most important is that I think that it is very funny.
  • It can be played by people of all ages.
  • You can play it during hours or when you just have 10 minutes.
  • You don't need to read extensive instructions in order to learn how to play. You can learn while you play.
  • It can be adapted to be played with one switch and the experience is going to be pleasant.
The accessibility is going to be the most important thing in this video game. The video  game is going to be in English and Spanish but it is going to have pictograms too. You will be able to adapt the scanning speed to your needs. There is no need for external help, you will be able to play, pause, stop or choose the options using your switch. 
Para el primer proyecto, he elegido el genero de defender la torre por múltiples razones:
  • La más importante es que creo que es muy divertido.
  • Lo pueden jugar personas de todas las edades.
  • Puedes jugar durante horas o cuando solo tienes 10 minutos libres.
  • No es necesario leer grandes hojas de instrucciones para aprender a jugarlo. Se puede aprender mientras se juega.
  • Se puede adaptar para ser jugado con un switch y la experiencia va a ser agradable.
La accesibilidad va a ser lo más importante en este videojuego. El videojuego va a ser en español y en inglés pero también tendrá pictogramas explicativos. La velocidad de barrido podrá ser adaptada a las necesidades de cada persona. No será necesaria la ayuda externa de nadie, se podrá jugar, pausar, parar o elegir las opciones usando el switch.

The Goal

With this video game I pretend to increase the quantity and quality of options that people with physical disabilities have to spend their leisure time. I would like them to improve their independence which is very important to increase the self-esteem. 
If this video game is successful, I have a lot of ideas to develop more video games and, off course, I will also listen to your preferences. 
Con este videojuego pretendo aumentar la cantidad y calidad de opciones que las personas con discapacidades físicas tienen para pasar su tiempo libre. Me gustaría que con ello, pudieran aumentar  su independencia lo cual es muy importante para incrementar su autoestima.
Si este videojuego tiene éxito, tengo muchas ideas para desarrollar más videojuegos y también, por supuesto, también escucharé vuestras preferencias.

Other ways to collaborate

If you like this idea, please, you can share this campaign in your social networks. The more we are, the easiest it will become true. 
Si te gusta la idea, difúndela por favor en tus redes sociales. Cuantos más seamos, más fácil se hará realidad.

story:
Have you ever wanted to design your own CPU or have hundreds of pins available to freely choose what they’re doing? Then field programmable gate arrays, or FPGAs, are just right for you. They’re essentially the chameleons among the ICs, because they can be freely programmed on a logic level. But if FPGAs are so awesome, why are they not as commonly used as microcontrollers? Because they’re difficult to program, until now, that is. The goal of our board is: having fun while learning how to program FPGAs. Learn more about FPGAs and their application by checking out this video.

Anyway, good hardware is useless when used with bad software. Today’s development environments for FPGAs rather look like the Space Shuttle’s cockpit instead of like a lean, user-friendly IDE. Also, the most commonly used languages, VHDL and Verilog, are rather old and hard to learn. The Plain Simple Hardware Description Language (PSHDL) is designed specifically to ease the learning curve for FPGA programming. Its similarity to C makes it very readable and writeable while its tooling enables you to get things done in a minimum amount of time. While PSHDL can be used with every board from every vendor, this board is specifically designed for beginners who want to learn FPGA programming, and is designed to integrate seamlessly with the very powerful browser-based PSHDL IDE. You can even start today and get some blinking LEDs thanks to the powerful browser-based simulator in the online IDE.

To get you started even more quickly and without the frustating installation of gigabytes of vendor tools, you you can directly synthesize – that is the equivalent of “compiling” for FPGAs – from the web page. All you have to install is a small tool that is available for (Linux, Windows, and MacOS X) and that uploads the configuration onto the board. 

PCB

All pictures of the board depict the prototype, the final version will look slightly different!

Enough talking about the software, let’s take a look at the board itself. At first glance, it looks unlike any other FPGA board you may ever have seen. It’s eight-edged with four horizontal connectors and four push buttons. This is our current prototype:

Here is a picture of the updated version of the PCB which now includes the PMod connector and blue LEDs.


Why horizonal, you ask? Well, there are also RGB LED PCBs that you can attach to each connector. Each LED PCB contains four RGB LEDs that can be indiviually controlled via the FPGA.

What are those unpopulated slots doing on the LED PCB, you ask? Well, those are for having fun. When you attach four LED PCBs, you get an X. Now, what will happen if you spin that X very fast? Well, you get four LED rings in the sky. Now, with the alternate LED positions, you can increase this to 16 rings.

On the other end of the LED PCB, there is another 4 pin header which can be plugged into another FPGA Base board. So when you’re getting tired of simply blinking some LEDs with one board, you can connect multiple boards together and create a network of PSHDL boards. If you think that the RGB LED density of this network is too low, you can stack multiple PSHDL Boards at a 45° angle atop.

Facts

On the board you will find a powerful Actel A3PN250 FPGA with 250,000 system gates and 68 user I/Os. The user I/Os are connected to four “horizontal” 16 pin headers (14 I/Os each) and two vertical 4 pin headers (2 I/Os each), which also have 4 blue LEDs attached to them. To program the FPGA, an Atmel XMega32 is placed on the board. The Atmel is connected via 5 I/Os to the FPGA and also features a 12 pin PMOD compatible connector.  For programming the device, an USB interface is provided on the PCB. There are four user buttons on the board, two are connected to the FPGA, two to the Atmel. All the connectors are standard headers with 0.10” pitch, so it is very easy to build extra hardware, e.g. on a breadboard. 

Connectivity:

  • 4 Ports (16 Pin standard 100mil receptacles, 14 IO)
  • 2 Vertical ports (4 Pin standard 100mil header, 2 IO)
  • 5 IO to Atmel XMega (for example SPI, UART, Clock)
  • 4 push buttons
  • 4 blue LEDs (shared with the vertical ports)
  • 16 Pin PMOD compatible connector to Atmel XMega
  • Total of 60 user accesible IOs with 3.3v
  • Networking:
    • 4 horizontal UART via arm
    • 2 vertical UART via 45° stacking

LED Arm

  • 16 Pin standard 100mil header
    • 12 connect to 4 RGB LEDs
    • 2 connect to 4 Pin 100mil header at end

Current state and planning

Our current prototype lives completely up to our expectations. One minor mistake is an incorrect foot print for an LDO on the back of the PCB and a switched VCC/GND at the four point header of the LED PCB. These issues will be fixed in the production run, of course. We also plan on adding four additional LEDs, so you can control them without LED PCB. We manufactured 16 boards by hand and didn’t encounter any serious production problems.

For the board, we have several quotes from Germany-based assembly houses. None of the parts used in this design are single-sourced or uncommon. We only use authorized distributors for our parts.

The estimated date of delivery is about two months from now. This is with an assumed immediate availablity of all parts, which are handed over to the assembly house. Their estimations range from 15 to 30 working days, depending on the number of boards to be manufactured. The rest of the time will be used for logistics.

Risks

Depending on the number of boards we are going to sell, some increase in lead time for constrained parts like the Atmel or the FPGA need to be dealt with.


Shipping

Most perks do not include shipping, if you are buying one of these, please add the following amount to your perk:

  • Germany: 5 EUR
  • Rest of the world: 11 EUR

The expected shipping time:

  • Within Germany: 1 working day
  • Within the EU: 2-4 working days
  • Within the USA: 6-8 working days
  • Worldwide: Check DHL for time.

story:
Car Tune is a Build & Tune racing game that has been in development since 2016. The current version of Car Tune came to be after many years of experimental tempering with various game mechanics and coding vehicle physics.

Currently I'm the sole developer of Car Tune and working on it is exciting and very rewarding. However I came to a point where I can't do any substantial progress on my own. If I want to realize this project so the game is in a stable state, I'll need to recruit and hire people.
That is why I need your support!

The money I receive will go towards:

  • Hiring 3D modelers & 2D graphic designers  
  • Hiring multiplayer programmers 

 

ABOUT ME 
Hello, I'm Bartosz aka Wichur. Since forever I loved racing and the automotive tuning scene. I'd be playing only racing games since a young age and now I only wish to make my own. Before I began pursuing my dream of developing my own racing game, I've been heavy into modding. I modded various titles during my time and I co-developed a patch that allows the addition of new maps in the video game Street Legal Racing Redline. I worked as a free lancer at Red Dot Games and many others. Currently I work at Boombit games as a programmer and other works of the trade. 

 

Links:

  • Community Forum: http://vertices.pl/cartune/community/
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/projectcartune/
  • Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoEQf2raxQ7VWtUChqEzd_A​

 

This is a game by enthusiasts for the enthusiast. 
I listen to all ideas and suggestions! :) 
Share'em in the community forum. 

This game will be available on Windows, Mac & Linux.

 

 

Exclaimer |
The Volkswagen logo is property of Volkswagen Group. 
The VW Golf Mk3 was only made for testing purposes.

I worked as a free lancer at Red Dot Games and many others. Currently I work at Boombit games as a programmer and other works of the trade.  Links:

Community Forum: http://vertices.pl/cartune/community/


Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/projectcartune/


Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoEQf2raxQ7VWtUChqEzd_A​
 This is a game by enthusiasts for the enthusiast. I listen to all ideas and suggestions! :) Share'em in the community forum. This game will be available on Windows, Mac & Linux.  Exclaimer |The Volkswagen logo is property of Volkswagen Group. The VW Golf Mk3 was only made for testing purposes.

story:
Imagine...

Being there in 1935 and being part of the Monopoly launch. What could you have told your grandkids or what could your grandkids have told their friends? Well okay, you would be pretty old by now but Imagine!!!

Imagine now...

Being part of the start of a New Boardgame, COMMODITY, at it's launch to the world, that will do what Monopoly did, given the chance, and it's you that can give it that chance and it's the perks you receive that will provide the proof that you were there.

If nothing else, do it for your grandkids even if you don't have any yet! We're praying that you will, have grandkids that is, well, okay, and get yourself some perks and help start an Evolution!

Special Note: For those of you who might think that boardgames are dead, because of the advent of computers, should know that Monopoly has sold over twice as many boardgames since the advent of computers than it did prior to computers. More than 275,000,000 in total.

Don't forget to click on your favorite perk on the right.

COMMODITY isn't just a good game..., it's a Great Game!

 

What it does:

1. It helps kids with their math.

2. It teaches people business.

3. It brings camaraderie to the table.

4. It keeps all the players in the game from start to finish.

5. It brings smiles to peoples faces.

6. It helps people to make decisions.

7. It can be played to any length.

and it does it all in a fun way!

 

Back Then

Originally, when I first invented and got COMMODITY developed I was able to get 960 games produced but the manufacturer required a 10,000 game minimum order for the 2nd order and no matter how I did the math I couldn’t come up with enough funds to place that second order and back then, there was no Indiegogo.

 

My Campaign Goal is to raise enough money to:

1. Get a minimum order of 10,000 games produced of my boardgame COMMODITY™ as well as all the Perks required.

2. Deliver those games and the Perks to all the supporters.

3. and to START an evolution to people playing my boardgame, as much as or more than Monopoly. This will not happen overnight so the goal for this campaign is to just get it started with the minimum order of games produced and delivered and be able to say we did!

 

Help it Evolve.

Have you ever been annihilated out of the game of Monopoly?

What did you do? Did you stay around and watch for a little while or did you just go home?

Did you ever complete a game of Monopoly where a player actually won everything or did the players just decide to quit after about 3 or 4 hours of play?

In my game COMMODITY that won't ever happen! It is designed so all players stay in the game to the end even though they do have to keep themselves out of Receivership. It is a challenge but Commodity is no harder to play than Monopoly.

It is also designed so that players can play it to any length they so choose. Long or short, it's up to them.

And there's big money in it and it is a totally different than Monopoly. The only similarities are that it is played on a board, it has money and it has dice and that is where the similarities end.

It's time for something new.  It's time to make way for a new kid on the block with no disrespect to Monopoly.

I want people to EVOLVE from playing Monopoly, to playing my boardgame, COMMODITY, which I designed to be better than Monopoly, but you have to make your own judgement on that.

Now if you don't believe it, then there is only one thing to do, find out for yourself.

I just gaurantee that COMMODITY is a great game that EVERYONE can play, no one is left out, and for the people that want more of a challenge, well, I have advanced rules, called the High Risk Game Rules and for a real challenge, COMMODITY Gauntlet.

The truth of the matter is, there is room for both Monopoly and COMMODITY. I just want COMMODITY to have the chance for people to get to know it and know what a great game it is.

Videos of COMMODITY

I was going to hire some people to do a video evaluation of my game for all of you to see but I think as soon as I mentioned the name Monopoly, in conjunction with COMMODITY, they didn't want to do it and so they refused to do it. Why is that? I'll let you decide on that one yourselves. I just wanted to explain why you aren't seeing any videos on my game out there other than the one I did myself, which does show the excitment that COMMODITY generates.

We have a review (http://www.roachware.org/2013/05/lehrstunde-in-bwl/#more-1990) but it is in German. You can use Google Translate (http://translate.google.com/) to translate it.

Imagine This

Imagine being back there when Monopoly first came about and imagine being a person who was credited with helping get it on it's way. Today your ancestors would be able to say, "guess what my great granddaddy/mother did?" And they would tell everyone and be proud but would they be able to prove it.

So now imagine helping out this campaign and gettings Perks with the slogan "I Helped Start the COMMODITY Boardgame Evolution." and having your ancestors say ,  "guess what my great granddaddy/mother did?" and then be able to pull out one of these Perks to prove it. Yep, they'd be mighty proud.

Be Able to Say...

Be able to say that you were there at the begining, and helped out, when COMMODITY got it's start, against all odds. That you were instrumental in making it a success. We can't survive in this world without help from other people.

And we have great Perks and you can Earn Extra Perks just for telling your friends. So let everybody know.

 

To get people gathered around to play with their friends and family and to inspire their lives with action and enhance their futures with purpose.

I hope my game will inspire all who play it or even those who just watch it being played.

One of the biggest comments I get from people about my game is "Wow, this is just like real life."

Playing games with friends can inspire people.

  

The cost of Manufacturing the minimum order and the Perks $170,000 and the other costs such as  mailout and shipping costs $115,000 , duties and taxes $15,000, brokerage fees where applicable, administration fees, legal fees, insurance and temporary warehousing in Canada and the USA and the Indiegogo and Credit Card fees $20,000 all adds up to $320,000.

We need this money to get that first 10,000 games produced and delivered along with all the Perks.

The High Goal

Some people might think this is a pretty high goal. The reason is quality, the minimum order the manufacturer requires and mailout costs. I don't want to sacrifice quality. When I say quality I mean quality of play and quality of product. I could cut down on the plastic pieces, but I remember playing games that would run out of plastic pieces and it was annoying and that is the last thing I would want you to be is annoyed with me.

So that is why the higher goal than other boardgames and yes I had to go and invent a game with a lot of pieces in it but that is what brings quality of play into it. It's NOT a game where you just roll the dice, move, land on a square and do what it says and then your turn is over.  Thos type of games get boring pretty dang quick.

It's a game where you get to manage your own company, be the boss you know. It is no harder than Monopoly to learn but it is designed with more action in mind and there is also the High Risk Game Res for the more challenging oriented people.

As I originally manufactured 960 games in 1989, all my relatives and friends, already have their copies and already showed me support back then. I can't ask them again so I am counting on all of you to contribute and make this a success and did I mention, there are some great Perks and not only that but you can Earn Extra Perks for telling your friends.

I saved a lot of money by being able to redo all the graphic artwork myself, especially on the Game Board. As my original artwork cost me $12,000 back in 1989 I didn't even want to ask how much it would cost me now. That would have just upped the campaign goal.

 

Many Good Perks as well as the right to say you helped start an Evolution. On the Majority of the Perks offered there will be a slogan such as "I Helped Start the COMMODITY  Boardgame Evolution".

The Bankers Visor won't have it on due to space on the Visor and the Certificate of Merit will be a little different as well.

Earn Extra Perks:

You can also earn extra perks by telling your friends about our campaign. See below.

All Contributors above a certain level will get their name on the Tower. Space is limited as the Tower can only be so big. The Highest Contributor gets his/her name at the top and Gets to Say that they are the "King of the Tower". See King of the Tower below.

Don't forget to click on your favorite perk on the right.

 

 

The tower is a game in itself. Remember the old game we used to play as kids "King of the Hill" or "King of the Castle". This is a different version of that game. In the Perks, $120 or more will get you on the Tower. The Largest Contributor to the Campaign will get their name at the top of the Tower and be able to say that they are the "King of the Tower". See the Tower on our website at www.markallangames.com.

The Tower will be updated as the Campaign progresses with the Top Contributor shown so that all will have a chance to supersede the person at the top. Let's not get too serious about it though, let's just make it fun!

 

We have many Perks for you

Standard Slogan on the Perks will be "I Helped Start the COMMODITY Boardgame Evolution"

  1. The Songs: Right now there are nine songs available. To listen to excerpts go to our website under the Indiegogo Campaign Menu. Add one dollar for each song you want on all of the Perks up to, but not including, the Tower. For the Tower and greater Perk Levels all of the songs will be included in the Perk. They will be in MP3 format. The songs will be available once we have reached our Campaign Goal.
  2. The Certs: View the Certificates on our website under Indiegogo Campaign. There is a special cert. for each level. You will be emailed your cert. with your name on it. The Certs. will be available as soon as our Campaign goal has been reached although it may take me a while to get them all done. www.markallangames.com
  3. The Headband: Our Headband (Sweatband) will come with the Slogan "I Helped Start the COMMODITY Boardgame Evolution!"
  4. The T-Shirt: Comes in blue cotton with graphic, see our website for more details.
  5. The Tote Bag: Comes with the same Graphic as the T-Shirt and will hold your game so that you can take it with you whereever you go.
  6. The Bumper Sticker: The bumper sticker will come two ways the first being emailed as a graphic the second an actual stick on bumper sticker with the Slogan on it.
  7. The Cap: A nice Blue Cap with our Slogan on it.
  8. The Game; The Special Edition game, Slogan on the board, will come with 240 plastic pieces - 40, 20 large and 20 small, for each company on the game board, there are 6 companies, set of money $1,000 to $500,000, set of Debit Cards, Set of Commodity cards, 5 dice and six tokens, storage container, box and specially designed 3 dimensional looking game board with the Slogan printed in the bottom right corner.
  9. The Banker Visor: As seen on our website and Facebook. This doesn't have the slogan on it but you get it with the game that does have the slogan.
  10. The Original Game; This is the original production game. Pictures are available to view on our website. Only 960 were made so a limited amount is available. I will autograph these if you so desire.
  11. The Cadillac Ride: You get to come ride in the 1931 V-12 Cadillac. You have to get here but we will show you our great hospitality.
  12. The Gauntlet Kit: Gauntlet means Challenge and this is the ultimate challenge. Link five gameboards together and play as teams with up to 30 people able to play and 36 if you want one to be the manager of each team. The Kit includes 5 Games and Four Prototype Linking Boards as well as other Perks.

Delivery date of November is an estimate. We hope to deliver well before that time.

For pictures of some of the Perks see our website: www.markallangames.com

 Don't forget to click on your favorite perk on the right.

You can Earn Extra Perks by telling your friends about our campaign. If you tell a friend about our campaign and they contribute to the campaign then we will give you another Perk.

To qualify you must have:

  1. Contributed to any Perk level.
  2. A Friend who contributed to the campaign.
  3. Email us at extraperks@markallangames.com with your friends name.

On each of the Perks, Extra Perk will be indicated at the bottom.  When your friend contributes you will earn the Extra Perk as long as you have followed the above 3 rules.

Special Note:

Check out our iPad Mini Giveaway for helping the campaign on our website www.markallangames.com under the Indiegogo Campaign Menu.

 Click on your favorite perk on the right.

Ever since I was a kid and played Monopoly I had wanted to invent a boardgame as good as or better than Monopoly, and finally I did, as that is what many people, who have played my game, have told me and I challenge anyone to play my game and tell me different.

I want to make it clear that COMMODITY is a totally different game than Monopoly. It is based on building a company not investing in Real Estate. See the Gist of the Game below.

My Challenge was to invent and produce the game, your challenges are below!

The Challenges are:

1. If you don't think that COMMODITY could be as good as or better than Monopoly then I challenge you to play it and tell me different.

2. To get your name on the Top of the Tower and if you so desire, to be the "King of the Tower". See The Tower.

3. Tell all your friends and get an extra Perk. See The Perks below.

Don't forget to click on your favorite perk on the right.

 

Go Home or Not?

In Monopoly players get annihilated, then what do they do, go home?

Players don't get annihilated in COMMODITY™.They stay in to the end of the game even though they can go into receivership. You can still go on to win the game after going into receivership. Many have. There is a Bankruptcy clause but no one to date has ever gone into Bankruptcy.

Length of Play

Monopoly takes a long time to play and many games have not been finished because of this.

COMMODITY™ can be played to many different lengths. Short or long.

Equality

In Monopoly if you don't get one of the elite property sets you're pretty much hooped and you know it.

In COMMODITY™ players all start on an even playing field. The same amount of money and their companies are all the same size.

Advanced Play (For the boardgamegeek.com Guys)

There are many different versions of Monopoly but they are still the basic Monopoly game in a different guise.

In COMMODITY™ there are rules for Advanced Players who want more of a challenge in the form of the High Risk Game Rules, available when the High Risk Game Kit is produced (Exception: See the Perks below), next campaign, and there is also COMMODITY Gauntlet™ a real advanced play where you can link boards together and play with a team.

 

 

COMMODITY™ is based on the building of a company by buying and selling Raw Materials, Products and Commodities. Players start with a $200,000 loan which they have to pay off or pay interest on every time they round the board.

There are six companies on the board; Carat Diamond Company, Pick Mining Company, Eagle Aircraft Company, Gusher Oil Company, Classic Car company, Golden Grain Company. Players choose a company to be theirs during the play of the game and sit near their main office as that is where they manage their company from.

They intially purchase Raw Materials, then they place these on their outlets around the board where they become Products. Other players landing on the outlets must purchase all products on the outlets, whereby they place these products in their commodities side of the warehouse where they now become Commodities.

The game can be played to any length, which player set at the beginning of the game or during play. and players don't get annihilated out of the game even though there is a Bankruptcy Clause it has never happened in the countless games that have been played.

A Player must Declare a Win in order to try and win COMMODITY. To Declare a Win a player must be debt free and have the agreed upon amount of money decided by the players then each player has one more turn to try and defeat the declaring player and it has happened many times.

Length of Play

The Length of Play in COMMODITY™ is determined by the players who set a monetary limit to play to.  A longer game would be played to $2,000,000 a Shorter game to $500,000 and an average game to $1,000,000. A real long game could be played to $5,000,000.

Who Can Play

Anyone can play, ages 10 to adult, no one is left out. Younger children can play with supervision. They might even win.

For more information on the game go to www.markallangames.com

On the Shelf or...

Now inventing it is one thing, but it doesn’t do any good just sitting on a shelf, it needs to be played, it needs to get out into the world so that it can bring joy, excitement and challenge into peoples lives. I need you to help me do that and in exchange I give you my perks and you will be able to say you helped start an Evolution!

  

The Hundred Thousand Dollar Bill

And the car that inspired it.
