1. If you don't think that COMMODITY could be as good as or better than Monopoly then I challenge you to play it and tell me different.
2. To get your name on the Top of the Tower and if you so desire, to be the "King of the Tower". See The Tower.
3. Tell all your friends and get an extra Perk. See The Perks below.
Don't forget to click on your favorite perk on the right.
 

Go Home or Not?
In Monopoly players get annihilated, then what do they do, go home?
Players don't get annihilated in COMMODITY™.They stay in to the end of the game even though they can go into receivership. You can still go on to win the game after going into receivership. Many have. There is a Bankruptcy clause but no one to date has ever gone into Bankruptcy.
Length of Play
Monopoly takes a long time to play and many games have not been finished because of this.
COMMODITY™ can be played to many different lengths. Short or long.
Equality
In Monopoly if you don't get one of the elite property sets you're pretty much hooped and you know it.
In COMMODITY™ players all start on an even playing field. The same amount of money and their companies are all the same size.

Advanced Play (For the boardgamegeek.com Guys)
There are many different versions of Monopoly but they are still the basic Monopoly game in a different guise.
In COMMODITY™ there are rules for Advanced Players who want more of a challenge in the form of the High Risk Game Rules, available when the High Risk Game Kit is produced (Exception: See the Perks below), next campaign, and there is also COMMODITY Gauntlet™ a real advanced play where you can link boards together and play with a team.
 
 
COMMODITY™ is based on the building of a company by buying and selling Raw Materials, Products and Commodities. Players start with a $200,000 loan which they have to pay off or pay interest on every time they round the board.
There are six companies on the board; Carat Diamond Company, Pick Mining Company, Eagle Aircraft Company, Gusher Oil Company, Classic Car company, Golden Grain Company. Players choose a company to be theirs during the play of the game and sit near their main office as that is where they manage their company from.
They intially purchase Raw Materials, then they place these on their outlets around the board where they become Products. Other players landing on the outlets must purchase all products on the outlets, whereby they place these products in their commodities side of the warehouse where they now become Commodities.
The game can be played to any length, which player set at the beginning of the game or during play. and players don't get annihilated out of the game even though there is a Bankruptcy Clause it has never happened in the countless games that have been played.
A Player must Declare a Win in order to try and win COMMODITY. To Declare a Win a player must be debt free and have the agreed upon amount of money decided by the players then each player has one more turn to try and defeat the declaring player and it has happened many times.
Length of Play
The Length of Play in COMMODITY™ is determined by the players who set a monetary limit to play to.  A longer game would be played to $2,000,000 a Shorter game to $500,000 and an average game to $1,000,000. A real long game could be played to $5,000,000.
Who Can Play
Anyone can play, ages 10 to adult, no one is left out. Younger children can play with supervision. They might even win.
For more information on the game go to www.markallangames.com
On the Shelf or...
Now inventing it is one thing, but it doesn’t do any good just sitting on a shelf, it needs to be played, it needs to get out into the world so that it can bring joy, excitement and challenge into peoples lives. I need you to help me do that and in exchange I give you my perks and you will be able to say you helped start an Evolution!
  

The Hundred Thousand Dollar Bill

And the car that inspired it.

story:
(I would like to add that the game will be released as Early Access on the Steam platform in two months. You can add it to your wish list right now!)

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1292120/Hunt_Primal_Reptiles/?snr=1_7_7_230_150_1

 

 

The most realistic prehistoric hunt - survival game ever! Huge Jurassic habitat inhabited by many prehistoric carnivorous reptiles, such as Spinosaurus, T-Rex, Velociraptor, Carnotaurus, Allosaurus. You can also meet herbivorous Brachiosaurus, Diplodocus, Parasoulour, and many others! An unusual adventure in a jungle full of dangers!

The game combines elements of a classic hunting simulator and survival. You traverse a vast, open world full of life and realistic fauna. Apart from many dinosaur species, different dangers await you, such as huge mosquitoes and poisonous plants. You will meet a lot of prehistoric reptiles. From small, agile specimen to powerful giants weighing tonnes.

 

You will have a huge world (10km/2) from the Cretaceous Period at your disposal. Each traveled meter will be a test of survival! You will find a piece of a basic, random equipment. To survive, you have to conquer the world in search of a better weapon, technology, ammo or clothes.

The island, where you are located, is inhabited by 15 different dinosaur species. From blood-thirsty Tyrannosaurus to small and agile velociraptors. Choose your target carefully, find enough ammo, and stuff as much food as you can find into your backpack. Don’t forget water! In the meantime, keep building your base so that you have somewhere to hide! Ultimately, the game will offer a single-player mode. But if you like group hunting, a cooperative mode for 4 players will make you happy.

 

Main functions:

-      a huge exploration area (10 km/2),

-      15 dinosaur species of various marking, sex, and weight,

-      hunt by day, night, at dawn and during the rain,

-      hunger and thirst bars,

-      a limited amount of food and ammo!, Explore and hunt in order to survive!,

-      a huge arsenal to use — from an arch to a rocket launcher!,

-      an island full of life — poisonous plants and insects!

 

PHOTOS AND MOVIES FROM A GAME

 

 

A CAPSULE AND THE BEGINNING OF THE GAME

You begin with what you find in an escape pod. Here is what you can find:

 

-      matches — to make a fire, dry yourself, warm-up or scare off smaller reptiles,

-      walkie-talkie — to communicate with other players,

-      water — you will not survive without it, remember to refill it,

-      first aid kit — you will need it for sure,

-      torch —- makes it easier to track animals at night,

-      canned food — not very tasty but will suffice for starters.

 

Apart from that, you will also find one of 10 available guns in your capsule. You can refine the guns and add some changes, such as a better crosshair or an additional clip.

 

WEAPONS

There will be over 15 types of weapons available in the game. You can modify and refine each of them. Add a better crosshair, riflescope, and even an additional clip.

 
ISLAND

The hunting area you get is a whole 10 km/2! Each part of the island hides different dinosaur species, plants or annoying insects.

 

Exploring and survival

There are over 20 abandoned buildings on the map, i.e. observation points, abandoned labs, abandoned buildings where you can find weapons, precious ammo, tools, food, and water. All objects appear randomly so each game is a new adventure! Additionally, from time to time supplies are dropped. You can find there new clothes and ammo, as well as a few other useful objects.

 

 

WHAT HAPPENS IF A PREDATOR MEETS A PREDATOR?

You can see a fight between a Carnotaur and a huge Spinosaurus attached below. In Hunt: Primal Reptiles it is possible. If dinosaurs cross paths, a fight might ensue!

 

DINOSAURS

We currently own 15 dinosaur species. Each dinosaur has different markings. There are both male and female dinosaurs. Each specimen also differs in weight, so that every player can compare their trophies with others!

 

The cycle of night and day and the weather

We introduced a simulated daily cycle in Hunt: Primal Reptiles. It means that you can hunt at sunrise, by the starlight or at sundown. The weather also changes.

 

 

Supported Platforms

Hunt: Primal Reptiles will be available on the Steam platform. You can add it to your playlist right away and await an alpha version available soon! The game will also be available on Android and iOS mobile devices.

 

Windows (7, 8.1, and 10)

MacOS

Android

iOS

 

 Discord and Facebook

Visit our discord where you can share your ideas, help in game development. Check out my new fresh fanpge!

https://discord.gg/rUc84a

https://www.facebook.com/Hunt-Primal-Reptiles-111752380514607

 

Hunt: Primal Reptiles was designed to create a fascinating and balanced game so that everyone can find something they like. Allowing access to the game as soon as possible, enables players to influence the shape and the process of creating the final product. Each user will become a crucial part of the development process by uncovering the strengths and weaknesses of the project, helping to improve the excellence and stability of the game. All players can join the official Discord server in order to contact the creator and suggest changes!

Donation

 

 

If we manage to achieve our crowdfunding goal, all money collected will be used for further goals in the game. We will keep you updated. They will surely include: a Quad that will fit two players. In the compartment, you will find some of the things you need, i.e.an ammo or food. New dinosaur species will also appear and who knows… Maybe even a new map!

 

Planned improvements:

Adding a cooperation mode for 4 players

Adding new means of transport — a quad, a jeep

Diversity of the map when it comes to flora and weather conditions

Adding a few modes of playing

Adding new dinosaur species

Adding crafting functions

Adding new maps

Adding new weapons

Adding Multiplayer

Android + iOS

PRIZES FOR SUPPORTERS

By supporting a game early, you can gain access to exclusive prices! Your support will allow us to develop quickly and provide the game faster! Prizes for winners will be delivered during the official premiere. If you do not want to support us financially, add our game to your wishlist on Steam, like our fan page and join our discord.

story:
Books give us a window into a vast number of amazing worlds, and introduce us to some incredibly cool people. And that experience is fueled not only by the authors' imaginations, but our own. The goal of this campaign is to create events that bring that synergy of imaginations to a whole new level. The first handful of these events have been arranged, and the authors involved are excited to share their worlds with fans in this new, more interactive fashion. All that is needed are players to fill the seats at the virtual tables. 

These events take the form of tabletop role-playing games held online. Each author will act as co-game master, playing most of the canon non-player characters and adding setting details. RPGlory's founder, a game master with over three decades of experience, will arbitrate and keep the game flowing. These events will streamed live on Twitch.tv.


The world has been engulfed in the zombie plague.

And the secretive organization, Dolofónoi tou Zontanoús Nekroús is fielding a new team to protect the few remaining survivors from both the zombies, and the rising threat of the cannibalistic half-deaders.


As a new rabies-like plague infects millions, America

recalls its military forces from around the world to restore order. But for the men and women for Fourth Platoon, the mission quickly descends into a struggle for survival, as the chain of command begins to break down.

Large footprints in the woods, strange sounds, foul 

stenches, and a looming government presence become pieces of the puzzle in cases of the missing. Inspired by real events, the author of the Bohemian Grove trilogy and The Apocalypse brings forth a story that has been kept a secret for over a century -- a story that a large group of people are still trying to keep under wraps.

It's tough being dead in the slums of Ganesh City. 

Only hooch puts the kibosh on the hunger for living flesh. And with Prohibition still in full swing, the only speakeasy in town really has the bulge. But to make matters worse someone is trying to make you a patsy.

Play as a human guinea pig, able project your debilitating side effects on to others. Or play as the incarnation of a concept that has been nearly lost and forgotten. Either way, the big guy upstairs, Jerry, and a pharmaceutical corporation that considers itself much bigger than Jerry, are about to make things very difficult for you.

Role-playing games are a social experience in which a group of people get together to tell a story collectively. In these gatherings, each player describes the actions of their own character in the game. To provide structure, one person, generally referred to as the game master or GM, (In Dungeons & Dragons, the best known role-playing game, this person is referred to as the dungeon master or DM.) sets the scene, arbitrates, and portrays everyone in the world that isn't one of the players' characters (generally referred to as non-player characters or NPCs).  The other players respond to the GM by describing what their player character does and says. When describing what their player says, it is often more fun to improvise that character's actual dialogue. This isn't necessary, but is generally encouraged. 

When the outcome of an action is in question, the GM will sometimes call for a roll of the dice. For example, when a PC wants to shoot at an oncoming horde of zombies, a bit of randomness is called for to determine whether the result is clean head shots or wasted ammo. When making these rolls the abilities of individual characters are taken into consideration as well. Many role-playing games go into a lot of detail where these individual differences between characters are concerned, but really, the information above is all you need to play.

There are a couple of differences when playing online in RPGlory event, but for the most part the above holds true. In a RPGlory game the role of game master is split between a very experienced GM and the author of the setting. The GM still sets the scene, arbitrates, and plays some of the NPCs, but the author plays most of the canon characters, and has final decision on setting details. 

The other difference is that since the game is played on a virtual tabletop, there are no physical dice to roll. Instead, a button will be set up for each of the PC's abilities.

Meeting our modest goal is crucial both for the events that have already been set up and for the future of this type of event. A successful campaign, and the recordings we will make of the games will go a long way towards showing other authors that playing a game with their fans is a great way to promote their work. We are very proud of the line-up of authors for this campaign, but we need your help to begin building a selection of authors who work primarily in epic fantasy and science fiction. Just as important as your financial support is your help in getting the word out! So please tell your friends (both IRL and on social media), local game and book retailers, and your favorite authors (Most can be reached through Twitter or their website.) about us.

We will be using a streamlined version of the Fate Core system played via the Roll20 virtual tabletop. This setup is designed to ensure that first time role-players and people with no technical expertise should have few or no problems getting started. But experienced role-players will find customization options limited only by their imaginations, and for story-based scenarios, a fair amount of tactical depth. 

Headphones, a webcam with mic, and an internet connection are needed for all game events. No software installation is necessary for the virtual tabletop, just the Chrome or Firefox browser for Windows, Mac, or Linux.

After compensating the authors involved, all funds will go toward developing the RPGlory.com website. Primarily, this will take the form of customization work on auction software. Once this is achieved, we will be able to hold more gaming events, more often, because the structure of a crowd-funding campaign will no longer be necessary to ensure that authors can be paid for their appearances. However, fully funding this software development project remains a stretch goal of $5000.

story:
Landflix Odyssey is a 2D platformer that ranges from classical platform to other typical run and gun and metroidvania gameplay types, in a delightful retro style pixel art.

Set in a fictional world based on famous TV shows, you'll learn how to use 5 powers inspired by those shows plus a unique move, the burp.

Join Larry as he tries to come back home from those crazy worlds, making his way through the other side in Peculiar Stuff, an icy land in Elder Thrones, a corrupted City in Blind Evil, the fast food gang's hideout in Going Mad and the zombie world in The Standing Zombie; power-up your skills to help him fighting against bosses and mini-bosses, such as crazy scientists, an evil queen, the undead king, ninjas and narcos! 

 
Retro style gameplay, old-school pixel art stunning graphics, super exciting original soundtrack and challenging adventures are ready to amaze you! Play the Demo now!
 

Try out this PC and Mac build with 2 levels set in "Stranger Things" & "Game of Thrones" spoof-worlds. Made to let you on board, they will still challenge your skills. Are you up to it? ;)

 

 

We'd love to hear your thoughts about it! Please share them with us :)  

Please note that this is only an early stage in the development! Many other features have to come and it may undergo more changes as we progress through development!

 

 

As you binge watch your favorite TV shows as usual, like "Breaking Bad" & "Stranger Things", you unexpectedly discover the existence of a parallel fictional dimension called Landflix through the use of nuclear batteries and a normal remote controller. Landflix is a clear reference to video-on-demand platforms like Netflix and TV shows universe.

Now you are Larry, stuck in this fictional world. 

As he sets foot in Landflix’s home he meets Uncle Doc, a scientific genius who had recently disappeared. Before you can understand what’s going on, a small robot appears. It has a small screen on its body that displays an old man’s face. It’s Landflix’s evil CEO, who sent its minion after you to steal the nuclear batteries in an attempt to escape Landflix and conquer the world with its army of fictional characters. As Larry fights over possession of the remote, 5 of the 6 batteries fly out of the remote and end up in different TV shows, and the robot retreats. Finally you understands what’s happening. 

Apparently the CEO and his uncle were coworkers once, but Uncle Doc had imprisoned him in this parallel dimension, when he realized he was scheming to conquer the world. After getting stuck here, the CEO used this dimension to create Landflix, a system designed to decrease the cerebral capacity of the masses through its TV shows, and easily conquer the world. Now that Larry is stuck inside Landflix too, their only option (and the only way out) is to stop the evil CEO and get back all 6 batteries!

 

 

In Landflix’s Home menu you can scroll between TV shows and select which one you’d like to watch... ehm, play.

 

The first show you have to travel through is called Peculiar Stuff and has a horror-themed feel, as you travel through forests, schools and labs. In this stealth based world, you’ll have to use your skill to travel between parallel worlds to find your way against trained soldiers and dimensional monsters.

 

The second show is set in an icy world dominated by an evil queen and the army of the undead. The perfect fantasy setting! In this metroid-vania like world you’ll have to fight your way through an undead horde, explore castles and ride a dragon to reach and defeat the evil queen.

 

We couldn’t avoid putting a superhero based world in our line-up! So here it is: a corrupted city packed with criminals and a lot of action! You’ll have to fight both gangsters and ninjas as you use your new magnetic powers to move stuff around and grapple-hook yourself out of harm’s way.

 

You got caught in the middle of a war for control over drugs. Do everything you can to survive in this chaotic world by using your own drug as a power-up, all while you confront both the Mexican cartel and the Fast Food gang.

 

Zombie horde? Check. A weapon to fight it back? Check. Explore this ”Metal Slug” like world as you use your crossbow and its many kind of arrows to reach the CEO’s base and have your final confrontation with him!

Every TV show will feature its own familiar character, who'll be in need of your help. You'll need to fight a mad scientist, mobsters, en evil queen, the deranged fast food employees and zombie hordes to help them! In return they will teach you how to control your new powers and will guide you through your adventure.

 

 

Since the early stages of game design we had a clear idea in mind. 
We wanted to produce a platformer where the player could make use of various powers to progress through levels, and go back to previously completed ones to get to secret areas thanks to his new powers.

Each of these powers had to be upgradable to reach even more secret areas. We decided to give our main character one signature move, and a new power at the start of each TV show, based on the world’s lore itself.

This move is available to Larry every time he finds and consumes a beer. The burp will release a powerful shockwave, capable of stunning or even damaging enemies, and will be key to solving some puzzles. 

In “Peculiar Stuff” the given power is a dimensional switch. Through the use of his remote near certain antennae, Larry is capable of traveling from the normal world to a parallel version of it. Not only will the landscape change significantly, but enemies will too. But be careful when using this power! The parallel world has no oxygen in it, so you’ll need to reach a new antenna quickly!

To fight hordes of the undead in the “Elder Thrones” world, Larry obviously needs a sword. But this is not a normal sword, it has magical petrifying properties, which allow Larry to turn himself into a statue for a brief moment to both avoid taking damage and conceal himself from enemy eyes. The other sword power is called Rock Slam and it allows to destroy things.

In “Blind Evil” we wanted to give Larry a marvelous ability. The green belt is a mash up of magnetic powers and spectacular visuals. The green ray that comes out of Larry’s belt can manipulate objects within a certain range, and even work as a hook to help him reach previously unreachable areas.

In the “Going Mad” world, Larry will learn how to produce Blue Sky meth. This meth will temporarily increase Larry’s speed and reflexes, making the world around him slow down. Sadly such a strong effect can’t last more than a few seconds. 

Fighting the horde of zombies from “The Standing Zombies” requires Larry to get his hands on some kind of ranged weapon. This crossbow doesn’t only fit that role, but can also be equipped with many type of arrows, such as flaming and freezing ones. 

 

Get your hands on the official Landflix Odyssey digital artbook. Our designers will work to fill the art book with all kind of concept arts, pixel art, level design sketches, environments and more!

 

Daniele Bianchini - For over six years I’ve been dealing with videogames. I created and published a lot of mobile games, but my dream has always been to develop a videogame for consoles, like PlayStation or Xbox. I love platform games and old school pixel-art adventures. I was thirteen when "The Secret of Monkey Island" was published!

Andrea Valesini - Arts lover and couch addicted, I’m also into horror movies and a binge watcher of TV shows. Grown up beating nonstop on the keys of my loyal 286, I draw things and make people laugh.

Federico Pauzano - I grew up with videogames. It’s been a lifelong dream to publish a 2D old-school platformer. In my spare time I play around brewing my own beer, which I believe has the power to increase productivity.

Luca De Simone - Nintendo lover and game developer. I’ve been playing with videogames forever and still keep living and breathing videogames. Can't live without my amiibo collection. Tea and water Manager of the Studio.

We decided to found Fantastico Studio as soon as we started the development of Landflix Odyssey, our first videogame for PC and consoles, in September 2017. We're working to make this project a reality and our dream come true. But this will be possible only thanks to all of you!
story_txt: Landflix Odyssey is a 2D platformer that ranges from classical platform to other typical run and gun and metroidvania gameplay types, in a delightful retro style pixel art.Set in a fictional world based on famous TV shows, you'll learn how to use 5 powers inspired by those shows plus a unique move, the burp.Join Larry as he tries to come back home from those crazy worlds, making his way through the other side in Peculiar Stuff, an icy land in Elder Thrones, a corrupted City in Blind Evil, the fast food gang's hideout in Going Mad and the zombie world in The Standing Zombie; power-up your skills to help him fighting against bosses and mini-bosses, such as crazy scientists, an evil queen, the undead king, ninjas and narcos!  Retro style gameplay, old-school pixel art stunning graphics, super exciting original soundtrack and challenging adventures are ready to amaze you! Play the Demo now! Try out this PC and Mac build with 2 levels set in "Stranger Things" & "Game of Thrones" spoof-worlds. Made to let you on board, they will still challenge your skills. Are you up to it? ;)  We'd love to hear your thoughts about it! Please share them with us :)  Please note that this is only an early stage in the development! Many other features have to come and it may undergo more changes as we progress through development!  As you binge watch your favorite TV shows as usual, like "Breaking Bad" & "Stranger Things", you unexpectedly discover the existence of a parallel fictional dimension called Landflix through the use of nuclear batteries and a normal remote controller. Landflix is a clear reference to video-on-demand platforms like Netflix and TV shows universe.Now you are Larry, stuck in this fictional world. As he sets foot in Landflix’s home he meets Uncle Doc, a scientific genius who had recently disappeared. Before you can understand what’s going on, a small robot appears. It has a small screen on its body that displays an old man’s face. It’s Landflix’s evil CEO, who sent its minion after you to steal the nuclear batteries in an attempt to escape Landflix and conquer the world with its army of fictional characters. As Larry fights over possession of the remote, 5 of the 6 batteries fly out of the remote and end up in different TV shows, and the robot retreats. Finally you understands what’s happening. Apparently the CEO and his uncle were coworkers once, but Uncle Doc had imprisoned him in this parallel dimension, when he realized he was scheming to conquer the world. After getting stuck here, the CEO used this dimension to create Landflix, a system designed to decrease the cerebral capacity of the masses through its TV shows, and easily conquer the world. Now that Larry is stuck inside Landflix too, their only option (and the only way out) is to stop the evil CEO and get back all 6 batteries!  In Landflix’s Home menu you can scroll between TV shows and select which one you’d like to watch... ehm, play. The first show you have to travel through is called Peculiar Stuff and has a horror-themed feel, as you travel through forests, schools and labs. In this stealth based world, you’ll have to use your skill to travel between parallel worlds to find your way against trained soldiers and dimensional monsters. The second show is set in an icy world dominated by an evil queen and the army of the undead. The perfect fantasy setting! In this metroid-vania like world you’ll have to fight your way through an undead horde, explore castles and ride a dragon to reach and defeat the evil queen. We couldn’t avoid putting a superhero based world in our line-up! story:
In Short

Hi there.  I've been making scenery for several years, first producing card stock scenery as Arid Hills Productions (still available through RPGNow.com) and then over the last three or four years I've been making resin scenery as Arid Hills Gaming.

As a long time wargamer, one thing has become more and more obvious as time goes on - although there are some really wonderful wargaming models out there, they're often obscenely over priced.  I've decided to do something about that and intend to bring out a collection of high quality miniatures, vehicles and scenery which DOESN'T cost the earth. 

What I need to achieve this goal is your help to assist me in initially tooling up to produce these miniatures.  After much research, I have decided to go the way of three dimensional printing as this will enable me to quickly prototype and produce quality miniatures without huge start up costs.  Having said this, obtaining a high end commercial quality three dimensional printer doesn't come cheap, and that's where you can help.

With your help, I can start producing the type of miniatures we all love, without the ridiculous cost.

What We Need & What You Get

Putting it bluntly I need a printer which can produce the type of fine detail which is required for quality miniatures.  Your kind contributions will go towards the purchasing of the printer and printing materials need to start production and of course to provide you with some brand new, spectacular miniatures (all of the contributions include postage costs, so there are no hidden costs).  Below is a summary of the perks offered for supporting me (more detailed descriptions are in the perks themselves):

 

Below is the first designed squad, complete with four riflemen, four sub-machingunners, a trooper carrying a grenade launcher and a commander with pistol.

$35: 10 x 28mm miniatures.  Includes one squad leader and one special weapon trooper.

$65:  20 x 28mm miniatures.  Includes two squad leaders and two special weapons troopers.

$100: 40 x 28mm miniatures.  Includes four squad leaders and four special weapons troopers.

$135: 50 x 28mm miniatures.  Includes four squad leaders, four special weapons troopers and two five man command squads.

$155:  56 x 28mm miniatures.  Includes four squad leaders, four special weapons troopers, two five man command squads and one six man heavy weapons squad.

$170:  62 x 28mm miniatures.  Includes four squad leaders, four special weapons troopers, two five man command squads and two six man heavy weapons squads.

And if you don't really need 28mm troopers, why not try something completely different:

Some concept art of the Machai Scout Walker to get you salivating!

 

All of the perks below are scaled for use with 28mm figures.

$300:  A Machai Class walker.  Approximately 300mm tall armoured walker with two weapons systems.

$350:  A Machai Class walker.  Approximately 300mm tall armoured walker with four interchangeable weapons systems.

$450:  A Machai Class walker.  Approximately 300mm tall armoured walker with six interchangeable weapons systems and a alternate head variant.

$650:  A Machai Class walker.  Approximately 300mm tall armoured walker with six interchangeable weapons systems, an alternate head variant and a custom coat of arms/sygil worked onto the armour.

$900:  A Machai Class walker.  Approximately 300mm tall armoured walker with six interchangeable weapons systems, an alternate head variant, a custom coat of arms/sygil worked onto the armour and your likeness modelled onto a 28mm pilot model.  This is a one off opportunity to have yourself imortalised as a gaming piece - don't waste it!  You get a free standing 28mm model and one plugged into the command deck.

I've decided to to use Indiegogo's fixed funding method so that if I'm not successful in making my goal, no-one who has contributed loses out - everyone gets their money back.

The Impact

If I'm successful in raising the money I need, I will be able to to create high qualitiy miniatures for a reasonable cost.  I will be able to provide the wargaming and RPG community with a range of figures to cover their needs and interests.  I'll even be able to to create vehicles, again for a modest amount. 

Some of the projects already on the drawing board include mutants and cultists with a 'junker' feel to them. I'm also hoping to be able to provide a number of WWII tanks in 28mm size for a more 'historic' feel to armies - Imagine fielding a platoon of Tiger P tanks and looking at the expression of wonder (or possibly horror) on your opponents face.

I'll even be able to provide short custom production runs allowing people to request truly unique forces.

 

You can follow my campaign through this page but you can also follow the campaign and what I'm doing on Facebook at:  https://www.facebook.com/AridHillsGaming

You can also message me on facebook with ideas, suggestions and of course support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously the simplest way to help is to contribute money in return for your favourite perk, but I understand that sometimes money is tight (or maybe these miniatures don't fit your current theme).  That's okay.  Really, it is.  What you can do instead is share this campaign with as many people as possible.  Share it with all your friends.  Share it with people even if you don't think they'd be interested (I recently found out a work colleague wargamed and I'd would never have picked him in a million years), share it in groups, emails, tweets and anything you can think of.  That way, even if you can't support this financially, you can still help make this a successful project.

Indiegogo has a range of sharing tools which make it easy to spread the word, use them and get the word out there!

story:
Hi! We are a small group of friends that came together to make our awesome idea a reality. We present you the CONQUEST!

Our goal is to make an app where everyone can make an actual profit for free. The money that are invested into us will be given away during the game to the 1,000 or more lucky guys!

The app we're talking about is a clicking game for Android and iOS devices. You click on the screen and everybody's clicks are added together. Every million, there is a random number, and the person that clicks this number gets $1. The one that clicks the last, 1 billion click gets $500!

Small prizes - $1,000

This money will be given away during the game.

Final prize - $500

The guy that clicks 1 billion click will get the Final Prize.

Rewards, shipping - $400

This money will be used to buy the rewards for you.

Payment for work - $300

This is a salary for the development.

Misc. - $300

That will pay all the taxes and fees.

Starter - $1

  • Thank you on Facebook

Thank You video - $10

  • Personal Thank You video
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

Wristband #1 - $25

  • CONQUEST wristband
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

Wristband #2 - $35

  • 1-inch, glow in the dark, CONQUEST wristband
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

3 Stickers - $50

  • 3 CONQUEST stickers
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

5 Stickers - $75

  • 5 CONQUEST stickers
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

T-Shirt - $100

  • CONQUEST T-Shirt
  • Thank you on Facebook
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

All-In-One #1 - $250

  • 2 CONQUEST wristbands
  • 3 CONQUEST stickers
  • CONQUEST T-Shirt
  • Thank you on Facebook
  • Personal Thank You video
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

All-In-One #2 - $500

  • Three 1-inch, glow in the dark, CONQUEST wristbands
  • 7 CONQUEST stickers
  • 2 CONQUEST T-Shirts
  • Thank you on Facebook
  • Personal Thank You video
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

God - $1,000

  • Six 1-inch, glow in the dark, CONQUEST wristbands
  • 20 CONQUEST stickers
  • 4 CONQUEST T-Shirts
  • Digital book with sketches and concepts
  • Thank you on Facebook
  • Personal Thank You video
  • Your name on the Funders Wall

*Every backer also gets a pack of desktop and phone wallpapers
*EU shipping included to all perks
*Add $5 to any perk for international shipping

Everyone can make a difference. Share our project with your friends and together we'll create a really fun game.

*If you have any questions, write to contact@conquestproject.com

story:
Let's be fair, Classic WoW will be pretty new for most players. 

There will be no in-game Atlas and guides, also Vanilla is kind of game, where higher iLvL doesn't mean that item is better, so many players will face huge problems with getting the right gear. Even skilled players from pservers will face issues with BiS lists because nobody yet knows the correct formulas that will be used in 1.13 calculations.

I think that players, especially new players, should have access to tools that will help them to understand Classic mechanics and to discover good ol' Azeroth world and its treasures.

If you want to become a skilled player and make your guildmates skill raise to avoid stupid wipes and drama - support the project, since its development consumes lots of time and effort, and each massive project needs support! You decide how cool the project will be - see Stretch Goals at the bottom of Story. 

Made to make you stronger.

 

The tools in its current state(early beta) is a web app (no addOn/mobile app yet) and includes only Fury Warrior mode yet (most popular DPS class), calculations are absolutely accurate and include ALL in-game combat events :

- Combat tables

- Set bonuses

- Weapon Skill/Hit mechanics (including glancing blows)

- Crit caps

- Extra Attacks (including auto attack reset when it should)

- Procs

- Rage regeneration

- TPS

- Consumables/Talents

- Target resistances(and ofc spell hit) and armor

And much much more. Note: the only thing that is present but not implemented yet - Lifestealing/Fiery Weapon enchants proc - its available on a newer build that isn't posted yet.

 

All formulas used in the tool are "most likely to be same as in WoW Classic", surely they will be updated if they are incorrect once WoW Classic will be released and we can test formulas.

All attacks are counted as attacks from behind vs lvl63 target(bosses are lvl63, in future will be added low-level mode, so even lowbies will be able to use these tools).

The estimated release date is June-July 2019.

 

You don't need any additional apps either to download anything. The web app works via your browser, you should just open a web page in your browser to use it. 

On the left side of UI, you'll see a checkable menu for character equipment, talents, buffs, etc.

The UI is made to be as user-friendly and simple as possible.

The results (numbers) are updated immediately after changing any option in character setup.

The results are grouped on the right side of UI.

Currently app's look (direct link to demo https://classicgamecrafter.github.io/ )

 

 

My plans for future updates for the tool are pretty ambitious:

1. Run and maintain tool as a complete web portal

2. Add more classes (and modes! so there will be also tank and healer mode).

3. Add more items/buffs/ranks of spells/buffs(currently it used only max ranks and fully talented(eg. 5/5 imp. Blessing of might on BoM(rank 7))

4. Add sources of items/buffs with a mark "how hard to get this item".

5. Add "recommended" items - the option that will show you item that will buff your performance as much as possible (you'll get an item list, in "how hard to get this item" order)

6. Add talents/rotations menu, to allow users to test unusual builds (spell power rogues, etc)

7. Rework UI, regroup it to taps(eg. talents tab, rotations tab, etc)

8. Add Character import

9. Add Debuffs(currently, you can select "target armor" option).

10. Add RaidSetupCalculator - identical tool, but where you can test up to 40ppl raid group performance. 

11. Ingame AddOn with similar options

12. Android/iOS version of that tool.

 

1. 500$ Web portal launch and maintain.

2. 1000$ More DPS classes.

3. 1500$ Huge update with additional items/buffs/talents/fight duration/rotation.

4. 2000$ All classes/roles, more detailed statistics.

5. 3000$ Item/buffs sources and "how hard to get" index.

6. 4000$ RaidSetupCalculator and Character/Raid import.

7. 5000$ Ingame AddOn.

7. 10000$ Android/iOS app.
story_txt: Let's be fair, Classic WoW will be pretty new for most players. There will be no in-game Atlas and guides, also Vanilla is kind of game, where higher iLvL doesn't mean that item is better, so many players will face huge problems with getting the right gear. Even skilled players from pservers will face issues with BiS lists because nobody yet knows the correct formulas that will be used in 1.13 calculations.I think that players, especially new players, should have access to tools that will help them to understand Classic mechanics and to discover good ol' Azeroth world and its treasures.If you want to become a skilled player and make your guildmates skill raise to avoid stupid wipes and drama - support the project, since its development consumes lots of time and effort, and each massive project needs support! You decide how cool the project will be - see Stretch Goals at the bottom of Story. Made to make you stronger. The tools in its current state(early beta) is a web app (no addOn/mobile app yet) and includes only Fury Warrior mode yet (most popular DPS class), calculations are absolutely accurate and include ALL in-game combat events :- Combat tables- Set bonuses- Weapon Skill/Hit mechanics (including glancing blows)- Crit caps- Extra Attacks (including auto attack reset when it should)- Procs- Rage regeneration- TPS- Consumables/Talents- Target resistances(and ofc spell hit) and armorAnd much much more. Note: the only thing that is present but not implemented yet - Lifestealing/Fiery Weapon enchants proc - its available on a newer build that isn't posted yet. All formulas used in the tool are "most likely to be same as in WoW Classic", surely they will be updated if they are incorrect once WoW Classic will be released and we can test formulas.All attacks are counted as attacks from behind vs lvl63 target(bosses are lvl63, in future will be added low-level mode, so even lowbies will be able to use these tools).The estimated release date is June-July 2019. You don't need any additional apps either to download anything. The web app works via your browser, you should just open a web page in your browser to use it. On the left side of UI, you'll see a checkable menu for character equipment, talents, buffs, etc.The UI is made to be as user-friendly and simple as possible.The results (numbers) are updated immediately after changing any option in character setup.The results are grouped on the right side of UI.Currently app's look (direct link to demo https://classicgamecrafter.github.io/ )  My plans for future updates for the tool are pretty ambitious:1. Add more items/buffs/ranks of spells/buffs(currently it used only max ranks and fully talented(eg. 5/5 imp. Blessing of might on BoM(rank 7))4. Add sources of items/buffs with a mark "how hard to get this item".5. Add "recommended" items - the option that will show you item that will buff your performance as much as possible (you'll get an item list, in "how hard to get this item" order)6. Add talents/rotations menu, to allow users to test unusual builds (spell power rogues, etc)7. Rework UI, regroup it to taps(eg. talents tab, rotations tab, etc)8. Add Character import9. Add Debuffs(currently, you can select "target armor" option).10. Add RaidSetupCalculator - identical tool, but where you can test up to 40ppl raid group performance. 11. Ingame AddOn with similar options12. Android/iOS version of that tool. 1. 500$ Web portal launch and maintain.2. 1000$ More DPS classes.3. 1500$ Huge update with additional items/buffs/talents/fight duration/rotation.4. 2000$ All classes/roles, more detailed statistics.5. 3000$ Item/buffs sources and "how hard to get" index.6. 4000$ RaidSetupCalculator and Character/Raid import.7. 5000$ Ingame AddOn.7. 10000$ Android/iOS app.

story:
It's time to play Creights!

Thank you for taking this moment to discover the next household family game named - Creights!

We are the Gagne family - David, Isabelle, Raven, Perry and Roman - and our dog Jake. Over the Christmas holidays with our two older children home visiting we found ourselves playing some card games. It wasn't long before they were bored and wanted to do something different. That's when Isabelle found some directions for a new game and we started playing. Not understanding all the rules clearly we began to invent our own rules and soon we had invented something that the kids wanted to keep playing as it was a lot of fun and never the same - and that is how Creights started. The kids were texting their friends as we were playing “I’ve got a new game to play at our next party” Part of the fun that first night was changing the rules as we played, and so we incorporated that into the rules of our own version. Bright colored cards and variable rules make it a perfect game for the young kids through to the grandparents.

David has been a Graphic Designer for 25 years and seeing how much fun the game was decided to put his talents to good use and developed the playing cards into what they are now. With David's years of experience in the printing industry the quality of the cards you can expect are that of the same high quality cards of companies like Bicycle cards and Hasbro.

Playing the Game

Creights can be played by 2-8 players. It is suggested that you have 2 decks for 5 or more players.

Game play involves being able to change the colour (suit) to any colour to only certain colours; reversing play direction; making other players pick up cards to having players pick up multiple cards; forcing players to switch seats; and of course creating your own rules for the game such as getting to pick which player has to pick up a card, having the next player pick up 5 cards, or even making players all loose a card or having to make strange animal noises - it's endless as making up the rule of choice is up to you.

We are excited to invite you to help us print our first run!

We need funding to produce the first run of Creights and you are the first to get the opportunity to join in the fun. We are simply offering what we know to be a great entertaining game as our perks depending on how many decks you desire (and might we suggest two decks if you plan on playing with 5 or more people).

A Sampling of the Cards

Each deck comes with 52 game cards and game directions as well as a game scoring card.

 


 

Thanks in Advance!

Thank you if you became a Supporter of any value - we are grateful for your contribution. If you didn't make a contribution, thank you for taking time to review the next game to be found in every home since Uno :) If you could spread the word that would be geat and equally appreciated.

story:
It's the last years of the 19th century and London is under attack from outer space.

The population panics.

Tidings of Martian war machines and devastation spread throughout the city.

Newspaper sellers cry their headlines even as they flee the oncoming carnage.

Carriages are fought over in a bid to escape the crush of the narrow streets and as railway workers valiantly strive to convey people to safety the helpless mass of humanity turn on each other in a frantic bid to avoid destruction...

 

such is the stuff of... 

 

Tripods! is a narrative strategy game, with the overriding story pre-determined but the timing of events so flexible that no two games are ever identical.

During the game 2-4 players compete to have the most Survival points by the time the Martians are overcome. Points are gained for escaping, surviving and killing Tripods with the help of Her Majesty's Army, but as the game goes on and alien foliage spreads throughout the city external help begins to fade away, leaving players fighting each other for the last remaining spaces of refuge. Watch your friends betray and backstab each other as the Tripods gaze on!

To see how the game works, have a look at the game rules or this unboxing and play-through video. The fully-annotated play-through can be found on our facebook page.

 

In each game box you will receive:

London Game board

Rulebook

8 Headline Event cards

66 Tidings cards

20 Character cards

5 Tripod cards and card stands

5 Military Unit cards and card stands

40 Populace Counters

6 Chance Counters (4 Cylinders and 2 Carriages)

1 Train Counter

17 Discontinuance Counters

1 10-Sided Die

 

"Tripods!" began as an idea over breakfast one morning at the Asylum Steampunk Festival in Lincoln. Over a year's development and playtesting by a group of committed  Bristol board game lovers the concept has been honed into a gripping and always-different experience with stunning paintings from local artist Solly Solomon. Rather than tender the idea to a big games chain we want to keep this an independent project by games fans for games fans, with prices as low as we can make them whilst ensuring the same quality we would insist on ourselves.

Prototypes of the game have been created and sent to various groups and magazines for playing- reviews, videos and releases will be posted here as they become available. All design work has been completed and the print run is ready to start, this campaign is hoping to take enough pre-orders to fund it. Germany company Ludo Fact who printed such well-known games as Carcassonne, Settlers of Catan and Dixxit are lined up to produce the games so you can be sure the quality will be top-notch.

Sadly the manufacturers cannot guarantee delivery by Christmas, but we know many people will want to order this game as presents so we will send a special Tripods! Christmas card for every game purchased if it looks like the games themselves aren't going to be done it time.

 

If the target is met there will be some exciting new perks added, such as strictly-limited-edition metal Tripod figures and Military Unit Badges which will ONLY be available to Indiegogo campagn backers. So get spreading the word! THE INVASION HAS BEGUN!

story:
Papetura is an adventure, point&click puzzle game in the fantasy world made entirely of paper.
Once in a while, the light reaches the paper and awakens the world. Guiding Pape & Tura you will discover the paper world, with all its hidden mysteries waiting to reveal themselves, covered with paper-darkness.  During that journey, many obstacles and creatures will arise, accompanied by a considerable amount of riddles and puzzles to solve!

FOLLOW ON :    TWITTER   FACEBOOK   YOUTUBE

There’s an opportunity to encounter a tapeworm in the demo! It contains the intro and the first chamber that you can explore. This is only a small part of the game, the size of which will suffice for more than 2 - 3 hours of gameplay.

HD versions download:   [Win]   [Mac]   [Linux]

alternative download links:     [Win]       [Mac]      [Linux]

Online version:  (800 px wide):  [Newgrounds.com]  [Papetura.com]



"Papetura examines the delicate, natural state of paper" ~ Luke Siuty, IndieGameMag .com

"(..) Player sees straddling the line between reality and fiction in a way that makes the world pop out at you." ~ Andrew Moore, PixelDynamo.com  

"As Amanita Design as it gets." ~ Chris Priestman, KillScreenDaily.com

"Wow !" ~ Necem, GameSphere.fr

"Makes an oustanding impression" ~ Michał Król,  HCGamer.pl 


Throughout the whole game, you have to control a main character, Pape, and take care of his friend, Tura.
Papetura is a world where everything can be alive. There are monsters in the darkness waiting for you with different intentions. During the journey, a bird covered with flames awoken by the light will cross your path. You’ll soon find out that the purpose of your journey is not only to survive, but also to save the world from the devastating power coming from the fire of a merciless creature.

Our inspiration from the world of adventure games are great titles such as Neverhood and Machinarium, also film productions of studio Ghibli. These works have something in common and that is to create a new magical world, which is a worthy thing to follow for us!


Puzzles and obstacles encountered on the road will be primarily related to the situation. At the beginning, you have to find a way to escape from the bowel of a monster that has just swallowed you.

Apart from main puzzles, on the way we meet classic mini puzzles molded in the world, made in same techniques as the rest. This design follows such classics as Neverhood (1996), which still inspires us to create this type of adventure game.


All we have is one small room and the desk, but it doesn't stop us from work!

Paper forms the whole construction of the Papetura world, it begins on paper and ends with a paper composite. Each element of the scene is made of it, even water. After a long process of bonding, the world becomes animated by light and is transferred to the game through photography. Every detail counts and is designed to reflect the architecture style of Papetura.

The most important feature of the paper for us is that it takes the color of the light as clothes, at the same time makes it airy and gently. Therefore, the biggest challenge is to make paper model and light work as a whole. It is a time-consuming process, but worth the end result - a realistic fantasy paper-world.

The process of making concept, programming, design and coding took us four months of full time job. Most of the time we made mistakes, trying to figure out how to animate paper, how to code in Unity engine and how to get the best result from photography. After this campaign, we are ready to continue the work!



Music used in the demo and trailer is "Saturnin Fire And The Restless Ocean" and "Forget-me-not" by Floex - Tomas Dvorak. His avant-garde approach to sound perfectly reflects the delicate nature of the paper. Will Floex create the soundtrack? The project attracted his attention, but the fate of the soundtrack is not certain. Tomas is a very busy artist, so the decision will be made in mid-year.

Meanwhile check out Floex on SoundCloud !



We've got to the point where the game won't rise without you! The game has already programmed mechanics, written scenario and made monster's guts. The rest of the world is waiting for the creation!

13.000 $ - The goal for the game to become alive!

Base version of the game will be created:
- Single player, DLC-free!
- Running on Unity engine, which works without a problem even on old hardware!
- Looks pretty on most aspect ratios (5: 4 - 16: 9)!
- Platforms: Win and Mac
- Release Date: Q3 2016

25.000 $ - The goal for the iPad, Android and Linux versions to be made!



9 $ THE PAPETURA GAME

Digital download of the game for PC and Mac. (also iPad, Android and Linux if goal is reached) , and a THANK YOU email for your support!

15 $ THE ART OF PAPETURA

You will receive the digital Art-Book of concepts and unseen photos in PDF of Papetura!
+ All previous rewards

25 $ THE GUIDE OF PAPERWORLD

You will receive the digital Walkthrough and Secrets of Papetura journey!
+ All previous rewards


45 $ SOUNDS OF PAPETURA

You will get the digital Soundtrack of deep paper-world ambients.
+ All previous rewards

75 $ THE REAL BOX OF PAPER

You will receive limited BOXED edition of Papetura!
PLUS, printed Walkthrough and Secrets !
PLUS, THANK YOU postcards for your support!
(FREE SHIPPING)
+ All previous rewards


95 $ THE PAPER FASION

You will receive limited Papetura T-Shirt !
(You will choose the size you want!)
(FREE SHIPPING)
+ All previous rewards

150 $ THE REAL PAPER ART

You will receive limited Papetura Art-Book - made from high quality ECO paper!
PLUS, THANK YOU dedication inside from Papetura team!
(FREE SHIPPING)
+ All previous rewards

200 $ PAPER CONCEPTS

You will receive concept art from the game production!
PLUS, your name will be listed in game Credits with THANK YOU dedication!  
+ All previous rewards

400 $ THE CHARACTER IN REAL

You will receive limited hand-made scarf of Tura!
(FREE SHIPPING)
+ All previous rewards



All your help is appreciated. We mostly ask to spread the news about the game around the world . Our small game studio Petums doesn’t have a chance without you!

Completing the game without your financial support has no chance. This is the first major game for studio and it needs working long hours. The grants will be used primarily for software licenses, materials, rewards, hardware, and maintenance costs. Also, a possibility for Tomas Dvorak to compose the music for the game will disappear along with the failure of this campaign.


Petums is a small, independent game development studio in Poland. We have developed a few flash games since 2008 ( e.g. Mosquito & Cow ). When in 2014 Tomasz Ostafin completed his Master's project entitled "Architecture As Game", he decided to enlarge the size of the games that will be created in the studio. After a hopefully successful fundraising campaign for Papetura, the team will grow. Until then, it consists of:

Tomasz Ostafin - a dreamer, game designer. He makes animations, graphics and code for the game. Fresh graduate in Architecture, is now looking forward to create a fantasy world made entirely of paper.

Pawel Adamczyk - a forest walker, sound effects designer. He’s responsible for making all the sound effects for the game.

makes animations, graphics and code for the game. Fresh graduate in Architecture, is now looking forward to create a fantasy world made entirely of paper. Pawel Adamczyk - a forest walker, sound effects designer. He’s
responsible for making all the sound effects for the
game.

story:
DOS BOX

The easy-to-use DOS-Gaming system.

  • Plug'n'Play
  • runs games and apps made for DOS
  • not an emulator, hardware made for DOS


Specifications

  • x86 CPU @ 300Mhz
  • 128 Mb DDR3 RAM
  • internal memory 4GB, expandable 
  • VGA and HDMI
  • 3x USB 2.0
  • PS/2
  • SD-Card slot
  • 3.5mm Jack
  • internal speaker
  • Dimensions: 146mm x 140mm x 75mm




The idea 

As gamers, we also love DOS - games. But we've  spent a lot of time with emulators that take too long to get them running. The idea was to bring back DOS into your living room as an easy-to-use plug'n'play system. The diskette inspired shape of the box perfectly fits to the operating system. Because it's not just gaming - 
                                                                IT'S A FEELING!

What do we do with your money?


  • Final case design
  • Hard- and Software development
  • Website rollout
  • unlock production routes
  • first production line


Can you eat it?


Another chance to support us!

Of course we've already made the big DOS BOX cake and besides that, a few small ones. And so, this video came up... 

We thought it would be fun if you guys make your own "you can even eat it!" - videos and share it with us and your friends.

Let the games begin!

story:
Elements is a card game with mechanics similar to that of a turn based RPG and can be compared to games like Pokémon and Final Fantasy. It's made with the goal of being both easy to learn and simple to play. You can build a deck or play with all the cards. 

The game was originally planned to be a mini-game to an RPG which turned to a real board game and now an app. It's gone through many revisions and we hope soon to bring it to it's full potential.

We currently have a working prototype which you can try out for yourself. The purpose of this Indiegogo Campaign is to help fund a final version of the game which we're going to make from scratch using the prototype as a guide. It will be improved in every way and with funding we can add Multiplayer, better special effects, new modes and more.

The game takes place in a fantasy world where all living things are assigned an Element and use them to perform amazing spells and special abilities. However in the Card Game you are a blank slate and every card grants you access 3 unique abilities of that Element to use against your opponent. Using the right spells at the right time and with Elements that complement each other will put you in the upper hand. 

There are 3 main types of Elements. Elemental Elements are those that can be found in nature like Fire, Water and Earth. Magical Elements exist in nature but can only truly be interacted with and seen by those who are of that Element which include Shadow and Light. Exotic Elements are often seen as the strange and unusual type, some of which don't use mana as a resource. They range from controlling other elements and living things to greatly enhancing one's self to give super human abilities. These include Blood, Nature and Dark.

Elements plays similar in mechanics to that of an old turn based RPG and can best be compared with Pokemon. Each player takes turns casting spells and abilities to damage the opponent and leave them with status effects which can be used to enhance other spells. When a player has lost all their HP they lose. Here is a round of gameplay from the prototype to give you a better understanding on how the game is played.

Use the Card Library to look at all the cards and examine every spell and possible combination to build your deck and find your strategy. Every card has a counter and compliments another. Mixed cards are another aspect to consider when building a deck if it suits your approach to the game.
 

Elements is one of the first games we've designed over the span of about 10 years now and has gone through many revisions. The card game was originally planned to be a mini game to a turn based RPG which is the first game we designed of the same name which we also hope to one day make. It started off innocently enough as a game I played in my head while eating candy, when I ate one of a certain color I would obtain that power. Every color is assigned an Element ended up to what we have today.

Later down the line we decided to develop it into a board game which the app is now based off. The prototype uses the real cards shown above but in the final version will have new cards made specifically for the app.

The prototype of the game shown in the video is free to download and try yourself. It's only available on Android but the Final Version of the game will be on both Android and IOS. Please note that the app is a proof of concept and meant to be a prototype to show what we intend to make and does not represent what the finished product will look like.

 

The final release will feature a lot of what the prototype has but we'll be able to add more and improve the look and feel of the game.

Upcoming:

  • Smarter AI

  • Better Spell Effects

  • New Card Design

  • Updated and Reworked Spells

  • Improved Soundtrack

  • More Modes

  • More Mixed Element Cards

  • Air Element

story:
We will donate $1 to St. Jude's Children's Hospital for every set of PhatGrips sold. Not only for the life of this campaign but FOREVER. With millions of gamers out there, what better way to raise much-needed donations for St. Jude's Hospital. We believe every company should have a mission that goes beyond their products and services.
 
An Idea Is Born 

Thanks for taking a minute to check out our project! We're hoping to raise enough money to do a  first-time production run for the PlayStation 3 version of PhatGrip. We are using the PlayStation version because it's the one that we have closest to a finished design. Final texture is all that's left. If all goes well, the Xbox will follow close behind. OnLive and Ouya controllers are also on our radar. 

I came up with the idea for PhatGrip a few years ago while playing video football with a friend of mine. Our hands were getting sweaty and made the controllers real slippery. If you are a console gamer then you know what I'm talking about! Since there is such an emotional connection when playing video games it's only natural that this happens. It became my mission to find an appropriate solution. The purpose was to create something that would increase the comfort of using these controllers without changing the integrity of the controller itself - and without using adhesives or encasing the entire controller which would obstruct the buttons. I wanted to make actual GRIPS that help the user during game play, not just a protective case. 

 

Prototypes and Feedback

After several design changes, I finally got what I was looking for and put together the cash to have some prototypes made. We (my wife and I) took them to E3 in Los Angeles and allowed everyone we could to get some hands-on time. The feedback fantastic.  

From there, we sent some of the prototypes out for reviews. Once again, the response was fantastic. 

"Phatgrips passed the test with flying colors. Comfortable, and kept my hands from cramping up. One thing I like about them is you can just pull them off, no sticky residue on the controller. But they feel very solid when you play, never felt like they were going to slip off." ~ Bert Ingley, formerly of www.maddentips.com  

"... once the grips were added it made the controller much easier to hold. I already can't wait to try the 360 version!" ~ Nikole Zivalich, host of "The Game Show"  

"PhatGrips are the best accessory you can get for your gaming system hands down. Here at GAU we game for hours and hours and PhatGrips make those hours so much more enjoyable. Everyone should try a pair cause then you'll be hooked." ~ Trevor from Gamers Are Us  

Those prototypes were made of urethane. We will be using santoprene ( http://www.wisegeek.com/what-is-santoprene.htm ) for the final product. This material will allow us to create a very high grade product with plenty of durability. 

 

Where we are now  

At this point in time, we are almost ready to do a first time production run of 5,000 shelf-ready units for the PS3 version. This is the "test" sales run for that idea I had years ago. 

This is where you come in. 

With your help, we'll be able to take this project out of my garage and into a production run, get them in the hands of gamers and see if our idea/unique design will work for the millions of gamers out there. If it does well, we will be able to provide an array of colors as well as possibly some neat artsy designs on them - maybe even some of your designs!  

We plan to selling the product through a combined effort of our website and  Amazon.com's Fulfillment By Amazon program with a retail price of $14.99 per set.  

 

Where the money will go:  

Mold cost  

Mold Setup fee 

Final Prototype Run for texture/design check 

Final patent (we have filed a provisional) 

Injection/production cost for 5,000 sets 

Shelf-ready packaging 

Product Fulfillment through Amazon Fulfillment and our website 

Upgrading our website 

 

Timeframe 

Once we’re funded, the plan is to have one more run of prototypes done to finalize design, fit, texture, feel. There will be 12 sets of prototypes.  Turn around  time on the prototypes is about 2-3 weeks.  We expect to take additional 2 weeks to hand test the final texturing and integrity of the prototypes. 

After we’re confident the prototypes emulate the product, we’ll contact our manufacturer to begin production. Turn around time here is approximately 8 - 12 weeks (includes mold building time). 

When the products arrive here in Reno, we’ll take it to a local packaging plant to have the clam shells and inserts done.  Turnaround time is around 10 business days. 

Altogether, we're looking at around 17 - 20 weeks. Of course, we'll update progress on each step of the way. 

 

Rewards: 

All U.S. Rewards come with free shipping. Canada and Mexico add $4.00, all other International add $8.00. 

All rewards that involve PhatGrip product are "Before they are available to anyone else!" They will be shipped to you before they are set for retail resale.

Pre-order PhatGrips will only be available in BLACK.

$5 – A keychain light, pen and console sticker all with our awesome logo! Limit 500 

$20 – Pre-order > A set of the first production run PhatGrips plus a keychain light, pen and console sticker with our awesome logo! Limit 900

$40 – Pre-order >Two (2) sets of first production run PhatGrips plus 2 keychain lights, pens and console stickers with our awesome logo! Limit 250 

$50 – Pre-order > Three (3) sets of PhatGrips plus 3 keychain lights, pens and console stickers with our awesome logo! Limit 250 

$75 – Pre-order > Four (4) sets of  PhatGrips plus 4 keychain lights, pens and console stickers with our awesome logo! Limit 250 

$300 – Pre-order > Twenty-five (25) sets of  PhatGrips plus 25 keychain lights, pens and console stickers with our awesome logo! Limit 20

story:
official website : http://spiritusrealm.net/

Steam Greenlight : http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=205536476


              


Spiritus Realm is an open world adventure game set in a land that is not affected by time, a land ruled by energy beings in charge of keeping the balance of life and death in our mortal world. You play as king Theo-sos, who finds himself in this mysterious realm without knowing how he got there, just to realize he is now dead.


Puzzles, quests and a beautiful world full of mysteries and wonders awaits to be explored. Go through a unique experience to find out why you are there and what your ultimate purpose in the balance of the cycle of life is. 

King Theo-sos awakes in a land that looks like the product of a wonderful dream, he seems to have transformed into this energy being capable of changing his spiritual form. This land is ruled by the Spiritus Lords, energy beings in charge of keeping the balance of life and death in our mortal world, of guiding souls to the world of the dead, and taking good care of the space-time continuity in our universe. But why aren't you in the world of the dead? well you have been summoned to fulfil one last task before you can rest in peace, a task that might be the only answer to save your kingdom and life itself back in the mortal world. But first you have find out how you died, because your death is a key part of this jigsaw.

The main gameplay feature of Spiritus Realm will be the ability to change your spiritual form into 3 different animals. Each animal will help you get through different obstacles or situations the game presents, and also provide the abilities to interact with the different objects/spirits scattered across the Spiritus Realm. For example if a wooden object is blocking your way you can always transform into the bear to use your brute force and destroy that object. Every spiritual form has a unique set of abilities drastically different from the other animals.

                

You will use these different abilities to solve puzzles, complete quests and interact with the Spiritus Realm. This will create a very dynamic and enjoyable gameplay for the player.


Puzzles will be a huge part of Spiritus Realm, and they won't be isolated, but rather connected . Each puzzle will be there for a reason, and in order to solve it you will have to find the connection to previous puzzles and combine what you already know in order to solve it. The game will also feature optional puzzles that will reward collectables for a 100% game completion. 

Because of the cost of the software required in order to develop Spiritus Realm. Unity Pro alone has a price of 1500$ U.S. That is why I need your help. Depending on how much money the project manages to raise we will be able to calculate a release date. Once (and hopefully if) we reach our goal we will post some stretch goals.

Credits : Appear as an early backer in the game's credits

Game : You'll receive a DRM free, Windows, Mac or linux digital copy of the game when it is released.

Soundtrack : Get hold of the game's soundtrack.

PDF making of : The process of making Spiritus Realm carved into a digital book format known as PDF, it will include assets, some conceptual art and much more.

Name: Get your name to appear in-game in an ancient wall, plus get named in the special thanks section of the credits.

Extra key: get an extra key for a friend!.

story:
NOTE: Please place your in-game name or forum handle into the comment field(s) when choosing the Contributor Credit perk.

Short Summary

Lommy (lomshivek in PlanetSide 1) is a long-time Ghosts of the Revolution member and a former Wind Wraiths XO/DC. He's been unable to join GOTR in PlanetSide 2 because his computer is unable to run the game. (It could barely manage PlanetSide 1 last year - watch the video!)

What We Need

Outfit Liaison Officer Reignman will be putting together Lommy's PC from the following components (MMO Champion's Dolphin build, prices last checked July 16, 2013):

  • Keyboard - Cyborg V.5 - $45
  • Mouse - Razer Deathadder - $50
  • Case - NZXT Source 210 - $39
  • Power Supply - XFX Core Edition PRO 550W - $61
  • CPU - AMD FX-6300 - $119
  • Heatsink - Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO - $35
  • Motherboard - GIGABYTE GA-990FXA-UD3 AM3+ 990FX - $137
  • Memory - 8GB G.Skill DDR3 1600 - $73
  • Graphics Card - ASUS 7850 2 GB or ASUS GTX 660 2GB - $199 / $209
  • Hard Drive - Western Digital Caviar Black 1TB - $89
  • DVD - Asus 24X SATA DVD+/-RW - $22

On top of these components, there will be ~5% sales tax and ~$150 shipping and handling (to get the parts to the coordinator, then to ship the finished machine to Lommy himself.)

The Impact

Lommy will be able to rejoin GOTR in PlanetSide 2 and tell our favourite joke!

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to other Ghosts, including veterans who may not play the game anymore.

DVD - Asus 24X SATA DVD+/-RW - $22

On top of these components, there will be ~5% sales tax and ~$150 shipping and handling (to get the parts to the coordinator, then to ship the finished machine to Lommy himself.)


The Impact
Lommy will be able to rejoin GOTR in PlanetSide 2 and tell our favourite joke!

Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out to other Ghosts, including veterans who may not play the game anymore.

story:
When it comes to business, most people will tell you fail fast, and then learn. But the truth is... FAILING SUCKS.

Being entrepreneurs, we realized that no amount of reading could prepare us for disappearing partners, dealing with suppliers and D-cal's parents wondering what the hell he was doing with his life. This is why experience matters.

No existing board game for business simulates experience. That is until now...

There's a statistic stacked against every would-be entrepreneur, 9 out of 10 businesses fail in their first year. About 120,000 businesses fail every day.

This is why this matters for us. If we can interrupt that status quo, make the first steps of starting up a little bit easier and empower more people to succeed, then we've done our job.

Imagine kids learning business at an early age in a risk free and fun environment. Imagine would-be entrepreneurs, before quitting their job, playing UPSTART to gauge how prepared they are to take the leap. We want to jumpstart a worldwide entrepreneurial movement.

In summary:

D-cal, a self-proclaimed gamer and a teacher (with a little under a decade of experience), was running a business together with Ina for about 3 years. It wasn't easy...

Despite some successes, failures came more often than not. A mix of mismatched expectations, debt and doubt pushed D-cal into a depression.

D-cal locked himself up in a room for a week and used all that frustration, all of the learnings and all of the stories he's read and heard from other entrepreneurs to create Upstart Mk1.

He cut hundreds of pieces of paper himself. Looked for toys laying around the house to use as the first tokens and then called Ina and his friend, Jolo, to play the very first game.

Something clicked. We were on to something.

The next two years would be about testing. We refined and polished the game. Balanced the fun parts with the learning. We did seven major over-hauls. 

After a small print run (with a lot more learning about how manufacturing works) and over 400 test-players from around the world from different walks of life, we're now ready to print a NEW and IMPROVED version to reach international shores.

UPSTART works like a role-playing game (RPG). You start by choosing a background that gives you various advantages and disadvantages while you build your business (e.g. full-time employee has steady income but less time while full-time entrepreneur has no income until the business profits but has time). 

You then roll and navigate through the board and make choices or deal with chance. Chance is dictated by various cards like life, breakdowns and breaks (opportunities). 

You are then given the chance to put fate into your own hands by taking actions with the two currencies of the game: time and money. You will make decisions on whether to focus on revenue streams or followers or even whether to take care of yourself and raise your vitality or risk getting sick.

Here is our turn sequence guide to give you a picture of how a turn goes. Each turn is equivalent to roughly one week in the real world:

Also one of the unique gameplay aspects of UPSTART is that with enough players you can assign a "game master" (much like the dungeon master in Dungeons and Dragons). This "game master" which we call "The Invisible Hand" can re-interpret the rules, create new scenarios and challenges and even add new cards to the game. The Invisible Hand is pretty much like God in the game and also affects players by pulling out "God's Hand" or "Market Shift" cards.

"D-cal enjoying being the Invisible Hand too much"

We are raising $35,000. Based on our calculations and conversations with the multiple suppliers, this is the bare minimum needed to mass produce the game and deliver worldwide. 

Aside from providing the game as a donation on your behalf. We will be providing training to teachers to run the game effectively as a learning tool. Here below are some of our beneficiaries:
