of new technologies requires different materials. Everything can be recycled!  Dynamic and diverse minigames will allow you to enjoy a love letter to games such as Mario Party, where gameplay will always be able to surprise you, with twin-stick shooting, platforming, sidescrolling, bossfights and more. (Forest rescue adventure concept gif)(Ocean adventure bossfight concept art) Each task will become less complicated if you rely on the appropriate tools. Stella’s case is no exception.Through her adventure she’ll find obstacles out of her reach, but this won’t stop her from progressing.With the help of her skillful assistant and some materials, Stella will be able to create new technologies depending of the mission she wants to go for with her work benches, which will be located in the upgrade room.(Upgrade room concept art) The upgrade system for the tools of our vehicle Ecoveh, will be displayed in this panel, where you’ll pick based in a recipe system, what sort of objects to create from required materials, located on the right panel along with the object’s description.Inventory, where you’ll see each one of the materials at your disposal; besides that, in case of having duplicate items you want to reuse, or experiment with, you can go to the recycling system, in which you can place 3 items to create a new one with higher rarity. Discover and collect beautiful collectable objects through each one of the incredible adventures in the world, where you’ll join Stella.Usually, you’ll find them on mission completion or secret locations; these are symbols of memories and support to our protagonist in her objective seeking.How many objects will you collect? Take a peek at your board from the commodity of your house to gaze at stickers and objects you’ve collected. Beautiful!   All donations will be extremely appreciated by the team, because of this, we’ve designed a set of rewards for every amount, we will even, for all donations higher or equal to $15, display their names inside the credits, thanking all these people.Everything is digital, we don’t count on physical rewards sadly, in order to not increase our budget and risk the project’s budget.  REWARD DESCRIPTION

Wallpaper: Pack of high-resolution illustrations of our game, ideal for your desktop PCs or/and mobile-phone wallpaper.

Name in the credits: inside the options menu there’s a credits section, where it’s listed and thanked each person that donated more than $15 to the game.

Closed beta access: Before launch there will be a closed beta in order to test the main functionality of the game and receive feedback through comments, doubts, bug reports, etc.

Digital Art book: a digital book which includes concept art (protagonist, T. Corporation, etc.), photo album including assets (vehicles, enemies, etc.) and an entertaining comic with adventures of our protagonist.

Manual/Digital guide: a digital book that includes tips to enjoy the game appropriately giving respect to character story, various strategies, curious facts, etc.

Collectable design: You’ll design a collectable; you’ll pick where and how will it be achieved.

Portrait/Illustration by Eto2D: Portrait/Illustration of the Backer by Eto2D.

City design: You’ll design a city as a playable area along with the development team. It must be a real city, not a fictitious one. This city will hold NPCs and diverse stories, aside from being a main spot for some levels.

NPC Design: Design a non-playable character (NPC) together with the development team. You can design the story and missions the NPC will deliver aside from the personality, physical appearance and dialogues.

Advertisement in all the game: Throughout the game, in cities and other locations, there’ll be advertisement posters to showcase the control the “T. Corporation” has over the current worldwide economy. Any backer who’s in the appropriate Tier will be able to advertise their ecological organization through these posters (Obviously in a positive manner only, not negative like the T. Corporation).
 Why Indiegogo? We are looking for help from the community to make Stella Save Us! Go beyond what we can achieve through self-funding.The funding goals allow us to hire more programmers and developers, paying extra-workers to fine-tune the game and/or participate in videogame fairs and shows in order to promote the game.If the campaign does not work well, we will unfortunately stop working on the project before it’s fully finished.In order to reduce costs, bugs and time for release date, we’re using the Unity game engine. Our team has been working in Unity, allowing us to focus on gameplay and design instead of developing/struggling with a custom game engine.Unity also allows us to potentially reach other platforms through future updates more efficiently in case we reach proper stretch goals and receive great reception. Micro-company dedicated to creation, development and self-publishing of videogames located in the Valparaíso region, Chile!We believe that videogames are powerful communication sources and a medium to explore new amazing worlds. We’re anxious to connect with people that feel the same for videogames and we have the intention to keep on sharing entertaining, imaginative and inspiring titles in the world.This is the beginning of our journey, this time in support of the environment, we’ll wait for you to follow us. Join us!TEAM- Gonzalo Romero: Programmer/Producer- Mauricio Espíndola Naranjo: Programmer- Jesús Alberto Pérez Valdez: Programmer- Héctor Alvarez: Sprite artist/ Animator- Marisol Arosa: Marketing- Alexis: Music composer and SFX designer. In today’s videogame industry, it’s a pretty big risk to develop something without fearing failure during development or even after the launch. An industry in which every day, new companies are created for videogame development, being their only objective to generate high amounts of money, only watching the result as an economical goal.We’re trying to change this, and with this new challenge, launching a game in which the benefit is not only economical, but to also deliver a message about something that’s currently happening; places in the world coming to an end, animals disappearing and weather that’s changing increasingly, everything a product of man.Ecological awareness using pixels, fun mechanics and an entertaining story, that’s our strategy to let the next generations know the problems that are currently going on in our world. Download our presskit here

story:
Catsino: The world's first casino for cats

As more of our feline friends are taking over human jobs, Paddy Power want to open a place where cats can unwind and alleviate the stresses of the daily grind.

The Catsino & Resort will be built for cat-guards like Millie, who needs to put her paws up after a long day protecting a toy warehouse from burglars. It will be there for hardworking cat actors like Austin Powers' Mr. Bigglesworth, who deserves an escape from the movie cameras for a quiet game of slots now and then.

But most of all, the Catsino will honour the everyday working cats who just need a well-earned break.

Our vision for the Catsino

The Paddy Power Catsino will include a variety of casino games for cats, as well as the 5-paw Motel Meow, The Old Scratching Post Gentleman’s Lounge, and the Purr Pamper Parlour. Designed especially for cats, the facilities will only be able to accommodate the feline variety. Some friendly neighbourhood cat actors helped us to stage the following images in a human casino, to share our vision of how the Catsino might look:

What we need from you

We need your help to make our Catsino a reality. There will be many purrrks available for those cats (and owners) who donate some of their hard-earned money to our cause.

Purrrks:

  • £1 = Exclusive updates
  • £10 = Exclusive updates + 1 Free non-alcoholic drink for your cat once the Catsino opens
  • £50 = The above + Premium cat food tokens for use in the Catsino restaurant
  • £75 = The above + your very own exclusive Catsino print mug
  • £85 = The above + we’ll donate £10 to a cat charity
  • £500 = The above + a bling-blow-tastic diamond collar

And if you can't stretch to make a donation, a simple share with a cat-loving pal could make all the difference to these hardworking cats. We thank you in advance on behalf of all cats for making our dream of the Catsino possible!

For pictures of the Catsino, and information on why we want to build this amazing feat of modern engineering, please visit our blog .

story:
Alpha test release coming soon!

I am testing for basic combat bugs / equipment stats and changes / enemy levels and stats  / and more.  If you would like to participate toss me a message (or a donation) to get a copy.  I estimate 5 days from now I should be releasing alpha 1.0 for testing.  I am adding basic ranged, and a character selection screen (which I may disable for this first test).  There are 2 bugs I am also working on now.  And finally I have some more substantial enemies I want to add as in room spawn in traps( IRSITs) :P

 

 

What is Where's the Bard?

 

Hello, I am super excited to get this up for everyone to finally see!  I recently designed a really great concept for mobile and I am already over half done with Where's the Bard.  I started it only a few weeks ago around the first of October. I am now in the beginning stages of adding monsters and skill effects / animations.  I have also recently talked to my new friend Eddy who is also excited to start producing the retro game play, boss , rest stop,  etc. -music!

 

The Game company that is currently made up of just myself is call Dark Squared, which accurately reflects the types of games we are interested in releasing.  Here's the awesome logo:

 

 

I have recently decided to go full time with Where's the Bard, and as such I will need help to finish it.  At this rate the coding will be done in a month, however a lot of time is required for me  to do the pixel art and animations.  There are also additional features I want to add that will extend the cost and time.  So the plan is to produce the original design, and attempt to get help purchasing new artwork for the game.  This is where you can help, below I layout some of the game details and goals and you can get a feel for what exactly we have and what I need. 

 

For example Where's the Bard will implement the ability to collect characters with unique classes that you rescue as you play through the game, these characters are added to your main inventory where you can choose to start with them instead of a base class when you begin a play through.  That said, I will release one of each rare characters to those that donate a few dollars!  I also had the idea to release a free version and a cheap ad-less version, of course everyone that donates will get the ad-less version as a thank you!

 

 

The Major Game Elements

[Done]Map generator

[Half Done]UI systems

[Done]Fog and Camera systems

[Half Done]Character systems

Inventory systems

[Half Done]Gear systems

[Half Done]Class systems

monster systems

Locks and lever systems

Skill systems

----------

Additional Goals

Once the original idea is completed I would like to add some extra content if I can reach additional goals.  Regardless though I will attempt to update the game to fulfill all additional content, it will just take longer.

Additional Gear

Additional Map Types

Additional Characters

Additional Monsters

Additional Skills

Additional Bosses

Shaders / lighting effects

Holiday Themes!!

 

 

More Game Details

I have about 20 unique monsters each with 3 skills and a base attack, their difficulties will scale with the dungeon levels.  Monsters will be scattered throughout the levels in a balanced manner. Some of these monster types include:

Blue Ooze, Red Ooze, Dark Ooze, Light Ooze

Minor Ghast, Raging Ghast

Zombie Civilian, Zombie Mage, Zombie Priest, Zombie Giant

Skeleton Warrior, Skeleton Priest, Skeleton Mage, Skeleton Knight

These as well as several simple monster types such as bats, spiders and flaming skulls, etc.. And of course elite mobs and boss mobs are in development now I will need an artist to further design new bosses!  A couple dozen wouldn't be a bad number to shoot for with them I think.  At least for the original game release.

The largest aspect of the game are the skills, there are 4 skills and a base attack for each character class, and there are over a dozen classes!  Skills such as various healing, lunging and stunning types, and much more!  There are over 50 skills not including the monster skills!

 

 

The game has been designed to fulfill a missing sub genre within the dungeon crawler sphere, that is the extremely replayable infinite dungeon crawler types we enjoy on mobile in various forms, with the idea to use a party system and tactics system (you start with 3 player chosen classes)  The dungeon is used for the combat space as well, this idea is almost completely realized it mainly just needs some beautiful pixel art to compliment it. 

 

 I have over 15 years of game programming experience and this my shot at releasing a really great game for everyone to own.  I honestly hate the idea of releasing a version with ads, so as it develops I would like to chat with the community to see if we can come up with a better idea!  Thanks for reading and I hope you check back often as I will be adding updates here constantly!

story:
Still interested in TIYO? Sign up to our mailing list on our web site at ThisIsYourOut.com


Maybe it was a bad date, a boring meeting, a really awkward conversation with the in-laws, or maybe you just said hi to a coworker and then they wouldn't stop talking to you for 30 minutes straight?

The TIYO (tee-yo) is a device that helps you escape these situations.  One press of the button and seconds later you get a phone call (a real phone call).  It's really that simple!

Why not just use an App?

When you turn the corner at the grocery store and run into a chatty co-worker that you really can't stand, you don't have time to prepare.  It would look quite rude if you were to pull out your phone in the middle of a one-on-one conversation and it would be pretty suspicious if your phone rang 30 seconds later.  With the TIYO, you can react to any situation, expected or unexpected without breaking eye contact with the other person.

We've designed a system that will provide you with the most convincing full-package white lie so as to minimize the chance of you offending or hurting the feelings of the person you meet.  Also, can you imagine using a fake ring app, putting the phone to your ear and then having someone actually call you? That would suck!

Why not just "grow a pair" and tell them you don't want to talk?

When's the last time you told off your boss, mother-in-law, co-worker, friend's spouse, neighbour, or the mom you see at the park every day?  There are some people you've just got be nice to because you have to see them again, possibly daily, for the foreseeable future.  Sometimes you just need a moment of relief or a way out before you explode and say something you'd regret.  

Are you very social? This probably isn't for you!

Not everyone has the personality type to gracefully exit all situations.  Those who are introverted, those with social anxiety, people who have disabilities, and people who fall more in line with the passive or "beta" personality set who have trouble saying no, are afraid of offending people and who would rather die than have anyone upset with them, this device is made for them.

Our mission is to get you out of the crap that ruins your now

People respect "The Important/Emergency Call" because it can happen to anyone at any time.  It's what many of us used to justify getting our first mobile phone, whether we did the buying or begging to our parents.  Take control of this gift with the TIYO.

When they won't stop talking, TIYO does the blocking

3D print of the TIYO next to a quarter

Getting a call at the right time is one thing, but being able to sell it as a realistic sounding call is another, especially when under panic or stress.

We let you customize the caller ID so you can easily point to your phone and say "oh look it's my boss, it must be important".

Since it's a real phone call, you're probably going to have to talk out loud and the other party will most likely be listening.  We made it easier for you by having someone speak on the other end of the line, telling you exactly what to say.  You just repeat what they said and to the outside observer it sounds like you are having a real conversation.  We've got a bunch of different scripts to pick from.

Here are some quick details on what you might need to know about compatibility, technical specs, the app, number of calls, etc.

Compatibility

The TIYO uses Bluetooth 2.1 + EDR, but practically every phone made after 2008 has that whether it's a smartphone or not, so worry not!

Setup and usage

If you've ever paired a headset or hands free device to your phone, then you know what to do!  Do this simple exercise once and you are good to go!  Get a new phone? Pair the device to the new phone instead, it still works!

The app

While you don't need an app to use the TIYO, one will be built that will run on every smartphone platform.  The app will provide a quicker and easier way to update the Caller ID that appears as well as the script that will play.  You'll be able to do this from our simple mobile website as well.

Number of calls and refilling

Every TIYO comes with at least 25 free calls.  When you run out you can simply buy another call pack in a pay-as-you-go fashion, there are no monthly subscriptions required to use the TIYO!  You can purchase an additional 25 calls for $5.  That's less than a quarter a call!

What else does it do?

The TIYO has one goal and that's to get you out of crap situations that you don't want to be in.  Right now that means it will call you and nothing else; this means super quick setup, simplicity, reliability, and a streamlined use case.

But wait, there's more!  We will be adding features down the line for it to do other things such as send a text message instead or maybe call a friend and play a message or even conference you in.

For the makers and developers out there we will also be releasing an API so you can build anything you'd like upon the receipt of a TIYO distress signal.  Maybe it'll open your garage, you dream it, you code it, you got it!

Hi I’m Ivan and I’m the inventor of the TIYO.  I decided to bring this cool idea into reality after hearing story after story from my wife Sarah about a colleague at work who just won’t stop talking.  He’s so bad that when he enters someone’s office other employees have to take notice and if he doesn't leave after 10 minutes then they must call the victim so they can carry on with their day!  When a one line email would suffice, this guy will talk to you for 30 minutes.

As an entrepreneur I do a lot of pitching and networking and I often find myself stuck in conversations with people that go nowhere, but have no clear exit. 

We realized that there are so many things a simple phone call can solve in both a business and personal setting that it was a no-brainer!  I started talking to people about the idea and they thought it was a blast!  A lot of people have their own strategies and protocols, but they don’t always work or they require extra people so we knew we were on the right path.

The fun thing is every time I talk to someone new I learn a new use case that I never would have thought of!  If you have any ideas, please share them in the comments :)

We had a great product in mind, now the only thing left to do was for this entrepreneur and computer scientist to start learning hardware!

Luckily for me, I know lots of founders and engineers of successful and up and coming hardware companies! I talked to folks at Pebble, Thalmic Labs, Bufferbox, Palette, Voltera and more!  The resources around me are great and I’ve been getting tons of support, answers, connections and ultimately the right direction.

Through trial, error and a lot of learning I was able to build a prototype from a dev kit, scouring the docs and Bluetooth specifications to know which advanced features were possible.

I realize that I’m no mechatronics grad and that to do this right I need to turn to the professionals for help to get me the rest of the way there.

This isn’t my first time running a company and I’ve learned to focus on your strengths and hire out passionate people for your weaknesses.  Enter Inertia Engineering, an awesome full service engineering firm out of Toronto that helped build electric cars, motion controlled Bluetooth headsets and F1 racers.

These guys know how to take a product from design all the way through to fulfillment and they helped walk me through the entire process complete with timelines, payment schedules for suppliers and things I never even thought of.

This is far from their first rodeo so having them on board to make sure what you get is done properly, professionally and on time is the best way I know to make this a reality.

I'm an entrepreneur and computer scientist from the University of Waterloo who previously ran an accelerator backed gaming startup which raised $336k from investors.  I'm an experienced solo founder whose recent feats include winning the Startup Smackdown judged by famous investor Brad Feld, turning down an acquisition offer, getting a YCombinator interview, being featured with a picture in the New York Times, and winning best pitch at the International Startup Festival 2013.

I love creating things and bringing value to people!  I love to talk and have done many pitch competitions and speaking engagements as well I do a lot of networking.  Because of this I end up in a lot of situations where the TIYO would be really helpful!

I'm also a huge gamer (if you didn't guess from me running a gaming startup) and I'm a huge metalhead.  I've been to over 180 concerts and just booked for my 5th metal cruise with 70000 Tons of Metal.

While you don't need an app to use the TIYO, one will be built that will run on every smartphone platform.  The app will provide a quicker and easier way to update the Caller ID that appears as well as the script that will play.  You'll be able to do this from our simple mobile website as well.
Number of calls and refilling 
Every TIYO comes with at least 25 free calls.  When you run out you can simply buy another call pack in a pay-as-you-go fashion, there are no monthly subscriptions required to use the TIYO!  You can purchase an additional 25 calls for $5.  That's less than a quarter a call!
What else does it do?
The TIYO has one goal and that's to get you out of crap situations that you don't want to be in.  Right now that means it will call you and nothing else; this means super quick setup, simplicity, reliability, and a streamlined use case.But wait, there's more!  We will be adding features down the line for it to do other things such as send a text message instead or maybe call a friend and play a message or even conference you in.For the makers and developers out there we will also be releasing an API so you can build anything you'd like upon the receipt of a TIYO distress signal.  Maybe it'll open your garage, you dream it, you code it, you got it!Hi I’m Ivan and I’m the inventor of the TIYO.  I decided to bring this cool idea into
reality after hearing story after story from my wife Sarah about a colleague at work who just won’t stop talking.  He’s so bad that when he enters someone’s office other employees have to take notice and if he doesn't leave after 10 minutes then they must call the victim so they
can carry on with their day!  When a one line email would suffice, this guy will talk to you for 30 minutes.As an entrepreneur I do a lot of pitching and networking and I often find myself stuck in conversations with people that go nowhere, but have no clear exit.  
We realized that there are so many things a simple phone
call can solve in both a business and personal setting that it was a no-brainer!  I started talking to people
about the idea and they thought it was a blast! 
A lot of people have their own strategies and protocols, but they don’t
always work or they require extra people so we knew we were on the right path.The fun thing is every time I talk to someone new I learn a new use case that I never would have thought of!  If you have any ideas, please share them in the comments :)

We had a great product in mind, now the only thing left to
do was for this entrepreneur and computer scientist to start learning hardware!
Luckily for me, I know lots of founders and engineers of
successful and up and coming hardware companies! I talked to folks at Pebble,
Thalmic Labs, Bufferbox, Palette, Voltera and more! 
The resources around me are great and I’ve been getting tons of support,
answers, connections and ultimately the right direction.
Through trial, error and a lot of learning I was able to
build a prototype from a dev kit, scouring the docs and Bluetooth
specifications to know which advanced features were possible.
I realize that I’m no mechatronics grad and that to do this
right I need to turn to the professionals for help to get me the rest of the
way there.

This isn’t my first time running a company and I’ve learned
to focus on your strengths and hire out passionate people for your
weaknesses.  Enter Inertia Engineering,
an awesome full service engineering firm out of Toronto that helped build
electric cars, motion controlled Bluetooth headsets and F1 racers.
These guys know how to take a product from design all the way through
to fulfillment and they helped walk me through the entire process complete with
timelines, payment schedules for suppliers and things I never even thought of.
This is far from their first rodeo so having
them on board to make sure what you get is done properly, professionally and on
time is the best way I know to make this a reality.
I'm an entrepreneur and computer scientist from the
University of Waterloo who previously ran an accelerator backed gaming
startup which raised $336k from investors. 
I'm an experienced solo founder whose recent feats include winning the Startup
Smackdown judged by famous investor Brad Feld, turning down an acquisition
offer, getting a YCombinator interview, being featured with a picture in the
New York Times, and winning best pitch at the International Startup Festival
2013.
I love creating things and bringing value to people!  I love to talk and have done many pitch
competitions and speaking engagements as well I do a lot of networking.  Because of this I
end up in a lot of situations where the TIYO would be really helpful!
I'm also a huge gamer (if you didn't guess from me running a
gaming startup) and I'm a huge metalhead. 
I've been to over 180 concerts and just booked for my 5th metal cruise
with 70000 Tons of Metal.

story:
During the last 50 years mankind's technology improved amazingly fast. In contrast, however, during the last 5000 years, the human mind didn't improve at all. Mankind is still faced with several wars, hunger, poverty, greed, racism and more...

Humanity's Silence is going to challenge your mind! Inspired by the game "Gods Will Be Watching" you and your crew will have to survive the aftermath of a crash on an unknown planet as long as possible and discover the terrifying truth behind the incident!

Humanity's Silence is a minimalistic, one screen, point and click adventure about hard decisions and moral dilemmas in order to survive. Although inspired by "Gods Will Be Watching", its gameplay will be slightly different as it aims at creating moral dilemmas without relying on mathematical problem solving that much.

Challenging Gameplay
 Your ability to think will be the most important tool to complete this game that is largely based on multiple choice dialogues. No hand holding: Listen, think and advance!

Parallax Scrolling
 Parallax Scrolling is a technique where images far away move slower than foreground images, creating an illusion of depth in 2D games and adding to the immersion.

Sombre Atmosphere
You will start to question your perception while the story unfolds, as the foundation of your believes will begin to crumble.


When the initiator of this campaign was studying Computational Visualistics in Magdeburg, Germany, he also worked for several companies or institutions with scientific main focuses, e.g. the VDTC of the Fraunhofer IFF or the Max Planck Institute. While working there he soon realised that even smart people can be dumb, i.e. he himself.

No knowledge acquired so far could help solving the common social problems that occured even there. In his opinion one of the major reasons for those problems is the employees' dependency on money, i.e. their income, resulting in a lack of resistance against wrong decisions made by their superiors.

These are two reasons why IndieGogo comes into play:

  1. He wants to broach the issue of those common social problems.
  2. With your support he can take a break from his ordinary work and focus on the development of this small but nice survival adventure, i.e. removing some of his own dependencies.


It is my plan to work entirely on this game for about two month, i.e. 1000€ per month. This is the time that I think I will need to finish the story and the gameplay mechanics. There are some additional tasks, too:

  • Administration. Paying taxes and paying legal advice.
  • Game Assets. Sound, graphics, animations, story and code.
  • Translations. There will be an English and a German version of the game.

If I exceed the minimal goal, I will be able to improve the game even further:

Possible Stretch Goals:

  • Additional Screens. Explore the city or escape to the mountains.
  • More Translations. I could pay translators for different languages. As of now only German and English translations will be created.
  • Better Sounds. A bigger budget enables the production of better sounds or the hiring of voice actors.
  • Linux & Mac support. Releasing Humanity's Silence on these platforms requires me to obtain the corresponding hardware and software and port the game to it. At the moment only Windows will be supported.

Here are the rewards I've prepared for the backers.

Special Thanks

Backers will receive thanks in heaps from me and an entry to the ‘SPECIAL THANKS’ listing on the credits page of the game. Please enter the name you would like to have listed into the Shipping Information details.

Smartphone Version

A copy of a limited Android or iPhone version of the completed game for 10€. Only 200 copies available.

Early Access

You will get early access to the game. This way you can give feedback and I might be able to improve things accordingly before it will be released.

Executive Producer

Your name will appear as an Executive Producer in the credits section of the game for helping me so much in making this game possible.

Custom Character

This is your chance to appear in a game! A special event will include an image of you. All I'll need is a picture of you.

story:
Fracture Fall has passed STEAM Greenlight -program and was well received.

 

Introducing the playable factions in the game.

 

              

 

The Project

Welcome to my passion project! I am the developer and designer of Fracture Fall. I've been working on the game for a few years now and it is time to see how far we can go with it.

 

Story. I have played pen-and-paper role-playing games most of my life. To me, a good story is about the choices made on the way. In Fracture Fall, the player choice reigns supreme. Your choices are not only about overcoming challenges, but you are in charge of your own storyline.

 

 

Emergence. "Every time you play the game, the story will be different." When I started my company Two Tales Games, I wanted to make games that always had another story to tell. My philosophy is that there should always be another way to go, an alternative solution to a problem. I thought a lot about the freedom of choice, and how it translates to interesting stories.
While a simulation or a strategy game offers the framework for a story when you look back at all the decisions you've made, it takes some storytelling to complete the experience.
Fracture Fall combines simulated world with well written story elements, so that a unique story emerges with every new game.

 

Strategy. I love board games and their design. In the world of Fracture Fall there are eight rivalling AI-controlled factions. Behind the scenes, they act like players of a board game. Factions make decisions for their own benefit, and their constant competition keeps the world dynamic and alive.
Decision-making, diplomacy and trade of the factions are simulated. The player is one of the pieces on the board, but with agency and momentum. The player's actions can affect the simulation, tilting the balance of power in favour of one faction or another. This lets the player be political or opportunistic in a world that has a momentum of its own.

 

Game Mechanics. I think about game mechanics a lot. To me, they define the boundaries of what is possible in a game world. Game Mechanics create direction and purpose to the player, and are the vehicle to player's motivations. Some would consider game mechanics to be the game, but they need to be in chorus with the spirit of the game world. I talk more about the summary game mechanics in a developer vlog.

 

Immersion. I have worked as a 3d artist for quite some time, and I am responsible for most of the graphics in the game. I am also a dabbling composer, and I swear by the audiovisual impact in a game: the mood created by graphics and music complements the story, and together they create the game experience.

 

 

One of the rewards is a miniature of a space station 3d -printed from a highly detailed model and delivered to you.

 

 

 

I believe that in science fiction you only need to change one thing from what we have now, and it will be keep you busy trying to realize the many ways it changes the world: what technology we have, how societies work, what we believe in and what are the aspirations of mankind. The Fracture changes all of it. Humanity is capable of such wonderful dreams, as well as terrible nightmares.
The Fracture is not just a dimension of space, but it is a psychic dimension that resonates within the human mind. It introduces an aspect of philosophical terror to the game. Interstellar travel may depend on it, but the cost may be the humanity in us. If it brings about a human paradigm shift, should the transhumanist agenda be embraced? Or is it a fight against extinction, as the holy Church teaches us after the calamities of the Old Earth?

 

Crowdfunding

If you've watched the gameplay trailer and are still reading this, maybe you get it. I feel like there is room for a game like this, and I am trying my hardest to make it into something special.

 

So far I've been funding the development out of my own pocket, but to make it into the game I want it to be, I am going to need your help. Support and share - it all helps!
 

You can probably imagine how a game like this can be expanded - how it screams for more features, an expansive universe with more intricate interactions and deeper storylines.

Depending on the success of this crowdfunding, I have plans to make it a better, more full experience for the player:

  • I have been prototyping a combat system, but it will need more work before it is fully realized. I am trying something with a submarine feel to it: limited information and the use of decoys to obfuscate your movements. That blip on the screen can be an enemy vessel, or just as well a remote-operated missile waiting to leap at your ship when it's revealed. You can strap a sensory pack to an asteroid with engines and send it ahead to find out. And
    I'd like to add a boarding party combat system as well. It would be a great incentive to get those heavy weapons for your crew, as well as securing a couple of terminator exos.
     
  • More and more events, more storylines to support a variety of play styles. I’d like to collaborate with a sci-fi writer. You want to try something exceptional, and find a hidden storyline waiting for you? I want to make that happen!
     
  • Illustrations. I’d like unique illustrations crafted for each event, or at least for the big ones. There are so many great artists available and I want to use them for this.
     

 

  • More intricate simulation modeling. The trade simulation is already finished and implemented, but I want factions to be more dynamic. There needs to be a point when the factions are ready for desperate measures. I want them to go for resources, exploit each other’s weaknesses and really try to spread their influence and ideologies.
    And when the player interferes with the plans of a faction, I want them to hunt the player for it.
     
  • Sound design. I've been toying with an idea of radio broadcasts coming from the planets you visit. It would be a great way of conveying the cultural variety encountered in the sector and add texture to the world.
     
  • More development time means more features for the game. It also means more content: local events, the fate of entire planets and worlds. Each colony has the potential to house unique cultures and societies, ambitions and calamities. It also means more options for the player in ships and combat tactics.
     
  • Multiple platforms: if there is enough interest and support, the game will also be released on LINUX and Mac.
     

Transport ship: All Fracture -traversing ships possess the spherical Fracture Core.

 

Perks:

 

  • Digital copy of the game: you will receive a digital copy of the game, typically in the form of a STEAM key. If there is enough demand for it, a DRM -free digital copy can be made available for download.


In case of an early access key, you will have access to the game pre-launch. This will most likely be a bad value proposition for you. The game will not be ready at this point and there will be bugs. You should only consider this step if you truly want to help with the final stages of development  by submitting feedback and hunting bugs. Or if you have another interests in the content before it is made public.

 

 

  • Miniature: there will be 3d -printed models of three different sizes available for the backers (I'm referring to them by the diameters of their cores). It’s a model of a full standard space station orbiting all the colonized planets or moons in the sector. It’s a very detailed 3d model, and the smallest details really show on larger miniatures. It makes a great prop for your miniature games, or a collector’s piece on your shelf. These miniatures are easy and a lot of fun to paint due to their level of detail. I will have limited amount of hand-painted models available for order.

3d -print of the 12cm top piece

 

 

Funding and Release Date

There will be stretch goals through this campaign. First things first though - let’s get this funded!

If the funding succeeds, it gives me a year’s time to work on the game and I see a release date coming at the end of 2017. But if the funding goes over the goal, it’ll probably mean that at the end of this year the game goes to an early access.
I will have more time to add features to the game and the release will get delayed for the next year.

Then again, if the game funding goes over any expectations, I’ll be able to hire people, which will expedite the development. I’ll also be able to collaborate with a writer, sound engineers and illustrators.
 

This is a fixed funding campaign, which means that
if the target goal isn't reached, all funds collected are
reimbursed to the backers.

Unfortunately, it also means that any promised backer rewards
aren’t delivered and my plans regarding development of
Fracture Fall will be subject to a revision.

 

You can use parts of the station
as props for your miniature games.

story:
About game

     Hi There! My name is Marat Ibatullin, and I created a new card game called: "Wonder cards".

     Here's how the game works:

     As shown on the video, you set deck of cards facedown. Each takes six cards and take turns pull the card from the player sitting on the right of you. After you pulled, he draws a card from the deck. And so it goes on until someone will gather a combination of cards of the same colour and winning card which is necessary for victory. 

     Cards of the same color at combination must be at minimum four pieces. Every colors in the deck by 8 pieces. (The game can play up to 10 players)

Back

And here is how it all began

Simple!

     But! Assemble combination, isn't enough to win. In the deck there is a bad cards, and if you have one, then you need to rid of them, otherwise you will not win.

     You can do this in several ways:
1. Wait until someone have pulled it.
2. Use the card - Change Card.
3. Change all the cards that you have ( Change Hand ) ( When you change hand. You take from the deck only six cards like at the beginning of the game ).

      

     To make gameplay more interesting, the deck has the action cards. They help you win and hinder opponents.

_____________________________________________

You can:

 See cards

(Throw before you pull a card from the player)

Change card to another or force the player to change card or change all cards that he has 

  

(Throw Change Card to the player from right or left of you, and pull the card which must be changed. The same for Change Hand. (You can get rid of your unwanted cards, throwing change card or change hand to yourself, when your turn to pull a card.)) 

You can say NO to any action, and on NO, you can say NO

(Here's all very simple. This is the coolest action card. It can undo any action. Let's say: on you thrown Change Card, See Cards, Skip Card. but you don't want to do that, then you can throw NO card and the action is canceled. "NO card" can be thrown at anytime and to any player aaaand to any action. You can throw No, when you want to hold your card, when another player pull your card . But! On NO, possible throw - NO, etc. )

 You can make the player do not pull your card, throw a skip card

(If you throw a skip card, the player will not take you card)

and much more.

     So it is a small part of what this game can do. She has a lot of opportunites and a minimum of 6 options how to play it. It all depends on your imagination.

_____________________________________________

In the original deck of 65 cards.
8 Violet cards
8 Blue cards
8 Red cards
8 Green cards
8 Black cards
4 Skip card
1 Skip 2x 
3 See cards
2 Change hand
7 NO
3 Bad cards
1 Card of winner

_____________________________________________

Cards background

 

Card of Winner

 

Bad Cards

 

 

Faces of cards

 

   

 

 

Pack

Cards of excellent quality. Thick paper and matt lamination.

_____________________________________________

 

THE PERKS

PERK 1:

1$ - Thank you very much!

PERK 2:

22$ The 1 deck of the 65 matte, colored cards( Early bird )

PERK 3:

25$ The 1 deck of the 65 matte, colored cards.

_____________________________________________

Stretch goals

---​ $4000 USD - Reach the goal! Unlock by 1 pieces in each deck

 "Death card":

This card give more drive and three options for the game:

1. "Dying only one player." When a player draws a card he is knocked out and the card is not returned to the deck.

2. "All die." You need to collect the win combination, before you pull the card of death. If someone pulled card, he out of the game, the card is returned to the deck.
3. "Salvation". It is possible to neutralize the card of death, if you sacrifice three of your cards. Players will choose which card you have to pay. All cards are sent to the deck.

--- $4500 USD - Unlock by 3 pieces in each deck 

"Two Cards Please":

(When thrown this card, it gives the right to pull from player 2 cards instead of one)

Risks & Challenges

     I have already made a prototype. I believe by keeping everything simple already reduces many risks. Under normal circumstances, your perks should be arrived by until April.

Other Ways You Can Help

     Please, support the project and share it with your friends.  Thanks you very much.  See ya :)
story_txt:
About game
     Hi There! My name is Marat Ibatullin, and I created a new card game called: "Wonder cards".
     Here's how the game works:
     As shown on the video, you set deck of cards facedown. Each takes six cards and take turns pull the card from the player sitting on the right of you. After you pulled, he draws a card from the deck. And so it goes on until someone will gather a combination of cards of the same colour and winning card which is necessary for victory. 
     Cards of the same color at combination must be at minimum four pieces. Every colors in the deck by 8 pieces. (The game can play up to 10 players)

Back

And here is how it all began
Simple!
     But! Assemble combination, isn't enough to win. In the deck there is a bad cards, and if you have one, then you need to rid of them, otherwise you will not win.
     You can do this in several ways:1. Wait until someone have pulled it.2. Use the card - Change Card.3. Change all the cards that you have ( Change Hand ) ( When you change hand. You take from the deck only six cards like at the beginning of the game ).
      
     To make gameplay more interesting, the deck has the action cards. They help you win and hinder opponents.
_____________________________________________
You can:
 See cards


(Throw before you pull a card from the player)
Change card to another or force the player to change card or change all cards that he has 
  
(Throw Change Card to the player from right or left of you, and pull the card which must be changed. The same for Change Hand. (You can get rid of your unwanted cards, throwing change card or change hand to yourself, when your turn to pull a card.)) 
You can say NO to any action, and on NO, you can say NO

(Here's all very simple. This is the coolest action card. It can undo any action. Let's say: on you thrown Change Card, See Cards, Skip Card. but you don't want to do that, then you can throw NO card and the action is canceled. "NO card" can be thrown at anytime and to any player aaaand to any action. You can throw No, when you want to hold your card, when another player pull your card . But! On NO, possible throw - NO, etc. )
 You can make the player do not pull your card, throw a skip card


(If you throw a skip card, the player will not take you card)
and much more.
     So it is a small part of what this game can do. She has a lot of opportunites and a minimum of 6 options how to play it. It all depends on your imagination.
_____________________________________________
In the original deck of 65 cards.8 Violet cards8 Blue cards8 Red cards8 Green cards8 Black cards4 Skip card1 Skip 2x 3 See cards2 Change hand7 NO3 Bad cards1 Card of winner
_____________________________________________
Cards background

 

Card of Winner

 
Bad Cards

 


 
Faces of cards
 
   
 
 
Pack

Cards of excellent quality. Thick paper and matt lamination.

_____________________________________________

story:
NOTE, because we keep getting this question:

Yes, if we do not reach the goal, everyone that has booked gets their money back from Indiegogo.

If we do not meet our goal, there will be no bus.

 

Love Essen, but hate having to get there?

Sick of having to stuff your suitcases with games, only to have them crushed by baggage handling?

Tired of leaving good deals and hot new games behind, because you have no more space?

Well, despair no more! Now you can join us in...

 

This year in October, BoardGameTravel.com will charter a bus to take us from Helsinki, Finland to Essen, Germany. Along the way we will go through in Turku, Stockholm, central Sweden and Denmark on our way to Essen.

This will be the first time this will happen, and we hope to make an annual tradition out of it. For the first time, to make sure that there are enough people that would like this to happen, we are using Indiegogo as a way to gather everyone. If it is proved that there is a market, we will keep doing it.

BoardGameTravel.com is a new company that is operated by board game geeks, and aims to provide fun boardgaming experiences in beautiful places. We are only happy with dice, cards and some wooden tokens in our hands, having fun with friends over some cardboard.

Our main line of business will be mini-cons where one can play board games with like-minded hobbyists and visit some interesting and pretty places at the same time. Essen by bus is something that the local board game community in Finland can benefit from, and since we are crossing Sweden & Denmark on the way to Germany, and we have the company anyway, we thought of professionally providing this service to all those along the route that want to come.

 

Essen Spiel 2013 is going to be held in October 24, 25, 26 and 27.

We will be driving in a big bus outfitted with a bathroom, TV and mini-fridge. With two drivers, we can make it there in the shortest amount of time possible, while not sacrificing safety.

Route to Essen:

Tuesday 22 October 2013
17:30 Helsinki – 20:00 Turku
20:55 Turku – 06:30 (23.10.2013) Stockholm by ferry

Wednesday 23 October 2013
07:00 Stockholm – 11:00 Jönköping
11:00 – 11:30: Break for changing drivers and refuelling
11:30 Jönköping – 14:00 Helsingborg
14:00 Helsingborg – 14:20 Helsingør by ferry
14:20 Helsingør – 16:15 Rødby
16:15 Rødby – 17:00 Puttgarden by ferry
17:00 Puttgarden – 18:30 Hamburg (change of driver and 15 minutes break)
18:45 Hamburg – 22:30 Essen

 

Route from Essen:

The bus will be available already on Sunday morning to collect those who wish to check out from their hotels and drop them at the Messe. That way, you save on hotel costs for that night. Then, after Spiel closes its doors, we will depart straight from the Messe. The departure may be delayed if there is need to load up the bus and pick up anyone not picked up in the morning.

Sunday 27 October 2013
19:00/19:30 Essen – 23:15 Hamburg (change of driver and 15 minutes break)
23:30 Hamburg – 01:00 (28.10.2013) Puttgarden

Monday 28 October 2013
01:15 Puttgarden – 02:00 Rødby by ferry
02:00 Rødby – 04:00 Helsingør
04:00 Helsingør – 04:20 Helsingborg by ferry
04:00 Helsingborg – 06:30 Jönköping
06:30 – 07:00 Break for changing drivers and refuelling
07:00 Jönköping – 11:00 Stockholm
11:00 – 20:00 Free day in Stockholm
20:00 Stockholm – 07:35 (29.10.2013) Turku by ferry

Tuesday 29 October 2013
07:35 Turku – 10:00 Helsinki

 

Pickup and dropoff points will be:

Helsinki: To be decided

Turku: ABC Koulukatu & Turku Port Viking Line terminal

Stockholm: Stadsgårdsterminalen, Viking Line

Norrköping, Linköping and Jönköping: To be decided

Any other pickup and dropoff points can be requested, and we will add them depending on demand. Norrköping, Linköping and Jönköping are all on our way, for example.

We can also arrange for pickups near the ports of Helsingborg, Helsingör, Rødby, and Puttgarden as well as Copenhagen, Hamburg and Bremen. For the large cities, we would only pick up passengers along the highway, at rest stops & gas stations along the way.

 

Terms of passage

Be prompt! The bus WILL NOT wait for more than 5 minutes after the stated pickup time. It is vital that we catch the ferries that we need to take to reach Essen in time, and especially on the way there, we need to keep to the schedule. We will duly record the time we were at each stop, and will give no refunds for anyone that misses the bus.

We also reserve the right to be late, as road conditions may cause unforseen delays. In short, we can be late, you can't. Unfair perhaps, but necessary.

It is a long trip, so we would like everyone to get along. Please limit your alcohol consumption, and make personal hygiene a priority. There will be opportunities to freshen up and stretch your legs along the way.

We might be late arriving in Essen. It is your responsibility to inform your hotel, and we take no responsibility for the effects of such a delay.

We reserve the right to make any changes to the schedule that are necessary order to ensure timeliness and safety.

If there is something that is not clear to you, do not assume, please ask.

 

The ticket from/to Finland (Helsinki & Turku) costs 225 EUR, and includes the ship ticket to/from Stockholm, in a four-person cabin.

The ticket from/to Stockholm costs 200 EUR.

The ticket from/to Norrköping, Linköping and Jönköping costs 175 EUR.

The first 5 passengers in each category above will get a 15 EUR "early bird" discount.

SLS and ESRSPY members get a 10 EUR discount for the Finland ticket, and their respective association also earns 10 EUR.

Cargo tickets are for companies that wish to take games & booth material to Spiel. They are sold in 400 EUR increments.

These prices are only available during the length of this campaign. They may increase, especially if we need to get a bigger bus to satisfy demand.

As noted above tickets from other locations along the route can become available. If you want to be picked up along the route, just ask.

All prices include any applicable VAT.

 

The tickets include round-trip transportation. On arrival, we will seek to drop you off as close to your hotel as possible, but we reserve the right to make just one central stop, at a big U-Bahn station, like the Essen main railway station. Depending on how late we arrive, we might be making a stop at the Messe to drop off cargo.

There is no real luggage limitation, within reason. Meaning, if you intend to use the bus to transport booth furniture or games for bulk resale, please pay for a cargo ticket. If in doubt, please ask.

 

No! We have partnered with companies in the board game industry to give you several offers. All passengers receive the following:

5 EUR off of any Artipia Games board game that you buy at Essen. This is per copy, so would get 5 EUR for each game and copy of a game that you purchase from them. The discount applies to any game that costs 25 EUR or more.

5 EUR off of SpielStorage, the storage solution during the fair at Essen, so that you may leave your games while you enjoy the event without carrying boxes around. This is equivalent to one day's free storage, or the credit can be applied towards a longer time.

5 EUR off of Spielbox magazine annual subscriptions, or an extention of an existing subscription.

5 EUR off of Gear & Piston, the new game by Jukka Höysniemi that is going to be released at Spiel 2013. This is dependent on the succesful publication of the game.

If it is looking like we are not going to reach the stretch goals outlined below, we will make sure to offer discounts for them also.

For each SLS or ESRSPY member that signs up, BoardGameTravel.com will donate 10 EUR to each association.

... and any more bonuses that we might be able to secure for you. For example, if we know that we are bringing a set number of people at Essen, then we might be able to get some good hotel accommodation deals for you (see FAQ).

The earlier we get bookings here, the better offers and bonuses we might be able to get.

If you are a board game publisher, retailer or service provider, let us know if you would like to offer some good deals to a very dedicated group of gamers.

 

If bookings reach 10500 EUR, everyone gets a copy of Inquisitio by Jani Rönkkönen, a fine specimen of Finnish game design.

If bookingsreach 12500 EUR, everyone gets a copy of the Going Cardboard DVD, the documentary by Lorien Green about the board game culture, which includes a copy of Reiner Knizia's Shoot-Out.

If bookings reach 14500 EUR, everyone gets their choice a copy of Drum Roll or Briefcase or Among the Stars, great games from the Artipia Games catalog.

 

Q: How can I contact you? Who are you?

A: Please send an email to contact /AT/ boardgametravel.com with as much information as we need to resolve your issue. Alternatively, you can also send a GeekMail to http://boardgamegeek.com/user/boardgametravel.

As to who is doing this, you can read all about it at http://www.boardgamegeek.com/user/kreikkaturkulainen.

 

Q: Why should I not fly instead?

A: Assuming that you find a good deal, keep in mind that you have to pay for the train from Düsseldorf, an extra piece of luggage, and potentially overweight baggage charges. Also, you are limited in what liquids you can take, fun you can have and games you can bring back undamaged. Friends don't let friends fly to Essen.

 

Q: Will I be bored during the trip?

A: Possibly. But, we will do our best to have fun along the way. We will try to have a bus with tables in it, if we can manage it. There will certainly be some games played on the way. Resistance, Dixit, Werewolf, Wits & Wagers and Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective are just a few of what is being planned. Probably no Eclipse, Bausack or Wings of Glory.

 

Q: Why is the goal set so high?

A: The money raised is needed to cover the costs, which include the bus, 2 drivers and their accommodation, fuel, road taxes, insurance, ferries and Indiegogo fees. A high goal also allows us to offer the lowest ticket price possible. The fixed costs that need to be covered mean that this only works if we have bookings totalling the goal amount.

 

Q: Can I just wait and see, and book after this campaign is over?

A: Probably not. We will only get as big of a bus as we need, and there is no guarantee of a spot after this campaign. Also, we can not guarantee that the prices will not increase.

 

Q: What about accommodation at Essen?

A: Once we have a better idea of how many people are coming with the bus, we can attempt to get some good offers from hotels. The sooner you book the bus, the better the offer could be. In general, if you book on your own, you can expect a cost of 75-100 EUR/night, but with proper research, sharing a double or triple room and perhaps a group deal, it can go down to 50 EUR/night. We will be in Essen for 4 nights.

 

Q: I have already booked airline tickets to Essen, but can't bear missing out on all the fun. What do I do?

A: Talk to your travel insurance provider. Contact the airline, and ask if you can cancel the tickets, change the names on them, or get credit for a future flight.

 

Q: I am bringing a lot of games to trade through the Essen Math Trade, do I have to carry them around?

A: No, we can take them to the Messe for you. If you decide to store them with SpielStorage, you can use your 5 EUR discount for this, and tell your recipients to come and pick them up from the Arctic Union booth.

 

Q: What if I fall ill and can't come to Essen, after I've booked?

A: In this case, you are in the same position as someone holding an airline ticket. We recommend that you have travel insurance, and use it to get your money back. We are actually a little better than an airline, and so we might give you a discount for next year's bus, and/or some of the bonuses and stretch goals mentioned above.

 

Q (FI): Why not take the ship to Stockholm from Helsinki instead of Turku?

A: Scheduling. It just doesn't work with the route we need to take.

 

Q (FI): Could we not leave Essen earlier, and catch the previous ship from Stockholm, on Monday during the day?

A: To do that, we would have to leave 5 hours earlier, which means noon on Sunday, before Spiel closes. This means that we would miss out on many last-day deals, and be on a big rush to Stockholm. By taking the ship on Monday night, we can go on our way safely, and even have some time to enjoy Stockholm. If our Swedish friends have any suggestions, we could even go and play all those new Essen games somewhere.

 

Q (SE): Is hockey an appropriate topic of conversation?

A: Nej.

 

It's ok, there's always next year! Maybe.

Tell others, get the word out and help us get there. If you do, and we have an extra Going Cardboard DVD or Inquisitio available, you might just get one, shipping included. Just post about this and let us know at contact /AT/ boardgametravel.com, so that we know you did.

Use the Indiegogo share tools, or post this address on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and whatever else is fashionable these days: http://igg.me/at/spielbybus

Thanks!

A: Scheduling. It just doesn't work with the route we need to take.
 
Q (FI): Could we not leave Essen earlier, and catch the previous ship from Stockholm, on Monday during the day?
A: To do that, we would have to leave 5 hours earlier, which means noon on Sunday, before Spiel closes. This means that we would miss out on many last-day deals, and be on a big rush to Stockholm. By taking the ship on Monday night, we can go on our way safely, and even have some time to enjoy Stockholm. If our Swedish friends have any suggestions, we could even go and play all those new Essen games somewhere.
 
Q (SE): Is hockey an appropriate topic of conversation?
A: Nej.
 

It's ok, there's always next year! Maybe.
Tell others, get the word out and help us get there. If you do, and we have an extra Going Cardboard DVD or Inquisitio available, you might just get one, shipping included. Just post about this and let us know at contact /AT/ boardgametravel.com, so that we know you did.
Use the Indiegogo share tools, or post this address on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and whatever else is fashionable these days: http://igg.me/at/spielbybus
Thanks!

story:
Gextra! Read All About It!


  • I’m Daniel Percy. I eat, sleep and breathe video games and top of the lot is the lovable lizard - Gex. I present my own gaming show, “The Gamezone” where I review the hottest console and PC releases. I also enjoy the Rugrats games.

  • I believe everyone has a purpose in life, a higher calling, a “Raison d'être” if you will. I am not here to end world hunger or cure ebola, but what I believe I can do is become a conduit for the return of someone very very important. He’s been gone for a very long time and it’s time he was resurrected. Jesus? No silly…. it’s Gex!

  • We're looking to continue the funniest franchise with a reptilian theme since Monty Python, by creating a brand new Gex game for current gen consoles, so that a new generation can enjoy one of the most massive mascots ever conceived.


What We Need & What You Get


  • We need $1 million or more. We're not doing this by halves and we know you wouldn't stand for anything less. We will employ a small army of dedicated Gexperts to crunch the ones and zeroes required to get our lizard buddy bouncing back on his tail once again.

  • Donors will be treated like royalty. Tell the world you’re a believer with the Gex Swag Bag - yours for a modest donation of $1000. If that’s not enough of a thrill donate $5000 or more to meet the green guy in person! Have a coffee, take him to a movie - just don’t stand on his tail!

  • We have to reach our goal. I don’t even want to think about what might happen if we don’t. I’m hanging by a thread here and I need your donations to stop me slipping into oblivion. Plus, who wouldn’t want a new Gex game? It’s a no brainer. We’ll make it. We have to make it.


    The Impact


    • Generation Gex is poised to tail bounce its way into the history books as the latest addition to the Gex franchise. But as if that wasn't important enough, this time round Gex isn't just regrowing his tail. He’s growing a conscience. With levels dealing with important, current social issues like #kony2012, Generation Gex has the Gex Factor that will make the world a better place.

    • Gex-lovers of all ages can enjoy the game with levels based on popular copyrighted movies like Shrek® as well as iconic revamps of classic levels for the old-school Gexers like “Mansion” and “Forest”.

    • Your money will be used to pay people! To make Gex! How wicked is that?

    • Daniel Percy is the internet’s foremost Gexpert and Rugrats game reviewer, what’s not to trust?

      Risks & Challenges


      • I live Gex. I breathe Gex. I dream Gex. Gex is in my blood and I can’t get enough of him. I am committed to making the best Gex game since Deep Cover Gecko. It's a tall order but there's no man better for the job.

      • Coming up with top quality banter for Gex isn’t as easy as just taking a quote from some form of pop culture and changing one of the words to be lizard related. But that won’t stop us. “Tail-ure” is not an option. We have a top team on standby ready to start cracking the (tail) whip and coming up with enough pop culture references to drown a newt. (Newts are amphibious.)

      Other Ways You Can Help


      • If you don’t have any money to give to the project, try to find some! You’d be surprised where it can show up!

      • Make some noise about Generation Gex. Public demonstrations, elaborate pranks, and paid advertising spots are all great ways to let the world know of the coming of Gex.

      • Get a part time job and give the money to Gex.

      • Borrow money off parents, friends, the bank, a pawn shop or an under the table money lender to contribute to the cause at any cost! I hope we have your “interest”!

      • If you really really can’t spare any money to help bring our lizard chum back from the brink, then f**k off. We don’t need your type here.

      • Don’t forget to like rate comment subscribe and share on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr, Blogger, Youtube, Google Plus, Tinder, Bebo, Yahoo Answers, Bing, Snapchat, Foursquare, Reddit, Imgur and LinkedIn.

      And that's all there is to it.

      Dan out.

Get a part time job and give the money to Gex.
Borrow money off parents, friends, the bank, a pawn shop or an under the table money lender to contribute to the cause at any cost! I hope we have your “interest”!

Don’t forget to like rate comment subscribe and share on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr, Blogger, Youtube, Google Plus, Tinder, Bebo, Yahoo Answers, Bing, Snapchat, Foursquare, Reddit, Imgur and LinkedIn.

And that's all there is to it.
Dan out.

story:
Guinevere's Games is raising money for the first production run of a Reproduction set of Historical Playing Cards

Hello everyone! 

I am a new and small company called Guinevere's Games. My campaign goal is to raise funds to professionally print a new set of historical playing cards.

Why?  

For over a year I have been dreaming of producing the Flemish Playing Cards. This is a special set of playing card; they are not your everyday playing cards. They are a specialty playing card. Anyone who loves the history of games or playing card history would probably love to own a set of these cards. I first saw those playing cards and knew that I wanted to share these cards with the historical re-enactors all over the world. I had a strong desire to make these cards so that people could play card games with these playing cards. I wanted them to be used like everyday playing cards.

The Flemish Hunting Deck  

What's next?  

I approached a printing company to get a quote. After receiving a quote from the printers I found that these cards are more expensive than I thought they were going to be to have professionally printed.

I am in the process of cleaning up the artwork to go to a professional printer. I have approached a printer and have a quote in place. My goal is to be able to make a high quality product to offer the public. 

I would love to make my dream of making these cards a come true. With your support my dream will be possible. 

All we need is you!

Information on the Playing Cards...

The playing cards that I am producing will be as close as I can be being historically accurate. What this means is that they will not be printed in modern day playing card stock. 

The specifications on the playing cards:

  • Height: 5 inches
  • Width: 2.5 inches
  • Paper Type: Cougar natural 130 Lb Double Thick Card Stock - smooth finish
  • Coating: none

The reason behind the uncoated card stock is because cards in the 1400's are not coated. Playing cards did not receive the coating that we are used to today until modern times. I am reproducing historical playing cards for the living history re-enactors to use at living history events.

I have tested this card stock with another set of playing cards I have previously produced called the Moorish Playing Cards. These are reproduction playing cards from 1414-1495. 

The Moorish Playing cards do not stick or bind when shuffling or dealing. 

What will this campaign do?  

It will raise money to buy materials and hire a professional printing company to print the first production run of the playing cards.


Where is the funding is going?

The majority of the money will be used to have the playing cards printed at a professional printer. Any funds left over, after fulfilling the campaign perks will be used for additional costs related to the campaign, equipment and additional materials for Guinevere's Games towards other projects for playing cards and design changes for the products we currently offer. 

Tell us more ...

                     I am at a fundraiser for the Missing Mutts Awareness Society


Guinevere's Games is a game company that specializes is historical board, dice and playing cards. My company has been around since April 2013. I am small company just starting to get my name out there. I love to research and recreate historical games. Each game is a work of art, and is decorated with celtic inspired knotwork.

I had a strong desire to share my love of history with the world. Guinevere’s Games started to produce hand crafted historical board games to offer to the public in April 2013.  There are so many wonderful historical board games out there that are so much fun! Some of the games that I offer are personal favorites of mine. 

I went and picked up the necessary supplies to make my first production run of board games. These games were crafted at my kitchen table. I spent many hours on the computer hunting down historical manuscripts to find the original rules to the games. That is when the magic happened for me, I found the Alfonso X Book of Games dating back to 1283 and I was hooked! I read that manuscript many times and found a world of amazing games. I dreamed of sharing these wonderful games with the world and started Guinevere’s Games. 

Over the past year I have discovered many wonderful board, card and dice games. And found a very rich history in the world of games that still continues to amaze me to this day! 

What is in it for me?

Besides the great feeling of  helping launch another Canadian manufacturing business.
We have a bunch of perks from PDF rule books for games to the playing cards that I am trying to produce.

PDF Rule Books

A smaller donation will get you a PDF of a single dice game up all the way to the complete book of games in PDF format so that you can try some of the historical dice games people played in 1283!  These rules come from a Spanish book called Libro de los Juegos  which was commissioned by Alfonso X of Castile, Galicia and León and completed in his scriptorium in Toledo in 1283. This manuscript was originally written in Castilian Spanish.

The image listed below is one of the PDF rule books that I offer on my company website.

I have rewritten all the rules into modern day english that are easy to understand.

You have your choice of PDF rule books that you want.

Playing Cards  

Medium sized donation will get you the Moorish Playing Cards from 1414 - 1495. 

The Moorish Playing cards was a deck of playing cards was was created in Spain in the 1400's. This deck was found by museum staff when they were repairing a manuscript in the Barcelona Museum. 

I re-drew the artwork on the sheets of playing cards that were found earlier this year. I took the playing cards to the printers. This is the swords suit from the deck.

These are not tarot cards, even though they appear to be. These cards were used to play everyday card games. This is a full deck of 52 playing cards. There were no Jokers in medieval playing cards. The suits in this deck are Swords, Cups, Coins and Battons (curved sticks). They can be used to play any modern day card game.

The single sword is the Ace for the suit. The king card is the seated figure with the crown on his head. The knight (the card with the horse on it) is the replacement for the queen as they did not have queens in Spanish playing cards at that time. The last face card is the knave(modern day jack).

A friend of mine said that these cards are a beautiful example of playing card history.

Moorish Playing Cards

Flemish Hunting Deck

Larger donations get you a 1 deck of the Flemish playing cards, or up to 3 decks of the Flemish playing cards. 

These cards will give you a feeling of playing cards like a king of queen! The Flemish playing cards in 1470 were considered a luxury deck of playing cards. The richest nobles or royalty would have owned a deck of these cards. The original cards were handpainted and gilded in gold and silver.  These cards were found in the Burgundian Region. These are the cards that I am producing. The suit system consists of Hunting Collars, Hunting Horns, Hunting Nooses for holding captured game, and Hunting Tethers. 

There is a full 52 playing cards in this deck. Similar to the Moorish playing cards, the car that has a 1 suit symbol is the Ace, there is a king, queen and knave (jack).

These cards will be printed on the same stock as the Moorish playing cards.

What will happen if my goal is exceeded?

If any additional money is raised, the money will go towards two options. The first option new equipment for my company for wood working. The second option is it will go towards producing more playing cards stock for my company.

I am planning on changing the design of my games so that they are a game box. They will have a storage drawer for the game pieces, or the lid will lift up to show a compartment where the game pieces are stored. 

What happens if my Goal is not reached?

I am planning on doing an all or nothing campaign. This means that if I do not reach my goal then all the money pledged will be returned to the backers of this campaign.

Risks & Challenges

The design of the playing cards are mostly done. I only have some touch ups left to do to the playing cards. The printer that I am using does excellent work, and I have used them in the past. They provide quick and efficient service.

Shipping will happen as scheduled providing that all shipping address information is accurate. 

If you have any questions at all, please feel free to contact me. I will happily answer any questions or concerns that you may have.


Cash is short. How else can I help?

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help: 

  • Use the tools at Indiegogo tools to share this campaign on social media. 
  • Share this campaign on facebook  
  • Tweet it
  • Tell everyone you know to tell everyone they know
  • Blog it
  • Shout it out

I want to thank you for your time. I appreciate that you came to check out my campaign and read my story.  


Cheers! 

Jeanette

(Lady Guinevere of Guinevere's Games)

story:
As a big shot executive you need to keep your network stacked with the best shows in Prime Time. A basic goal for any TV show is to "win" its time slot for the network by having the highest ratings, and thus the highest ad revenue. As you add talented actors, producers and writers to the show, you’ll have to decide how to arrange your TV Guide to win over the most viewers. Will you be putting your best shows early in the week? What will you leave for the Friday night death slot? Make your choices wisely so you can become the #1 network.

Global Game - English/German First Edition

The first edition of Prime Time will be published in English and German. 



How to Play Prime Time

Prime Time is played over six rounds, divided into two seasons of three rounds each. During each round, players will bid for and take their actions - buy shows, hire and fire talent, or play golf, among other things. 

Each round follows 4 phases:

  • Development phase – Players take 3 actions each. 
  • Broadcasting phase – Players set up their TV schedule and try to attract demographics. 
  • Award show phase (only in rounds 3 and 6) – Players score points. 
  • Income phase – Get paid, clear the board and set up for the new round.

At the end of the 6th round, each player counts their remaining cash and gains 1 VP for each full $3. The player with the most VP wins the game!

Rule Book*

* Please note that rules are not final and we may be making changes before the game is published.






Pre-orders benefits

Each pre-order will receive every SG we unlocked:



Risks & Challenges

NO RISKS!! - This is a pre-order system for an already funded Board game.

As soon as your payment is approved, we will ship your copy :)

Please follow this shipping table for estimated Shipping costs:




Thanks for your reading through our game page and considering ordering our new game,
Golden Egg Games, LLC.
