story:
Summary.

Derby Game Convention's aim is to be the best video game event in the Midlands. The event will be a celebration of the video game industry. DGC will feature the following and so much more:

  • Over 30 classic arcade machines and 60+ games consoles, old and new!
  • DGC will showcase the latest games coming out of Derby, such as Pneuma: Breath of Life by Deco Digital.
  • There will be various panels featuring numerous topics such as collecting, game developing and how to get into the business.
  • Stalls where you can buy gaming related merchandise to your hearts content!
  • Plenty of casual and competitive competitions with great prizes!
DGC will take place on Saturday 7th/Sunday 8th February 2015 at The Derby Conference Centre. Free car parking at the venue, with food and drink available to purchase throughout each day..

What We Need & What You Get.

We need to raise £4000 to make this event the best it can be. The money will go towards arcade machine/console hire, venue hire and advertising. If we exceed our goal, we will add more exciting gaming activities.

We have three different ticket options for you:

  1. If you want to get the full DGC experience, then choose the £17 'Two Day Ticket' which gives you access to both Saturday (+Late Play) and Sunday!
  2. Can't make both days, then choose a £10 ticket to either Saturday or Sunday.
  3. If you want to play till bedtime then go for our £5 Late Play ticket, giving you access to all the consoles and aracade machines from 7pm till 11pm.

Each person who buys a ticket will have the chance to win a PS4 or Xbox One (its your choice)! So what are you waiting for? Get those tickets fast!


      Other Ways You Can Help.

      If you can't fund our campaign, please spread the word and help make DGC a reality. If you would like to contribute in another way, please contact info@derbygameconvention.co.uk.
story_txt:
Summary. Derby Game Convention's aim is to be the best video game event in the Midlands. The 
event will be a celebration of the video game industry. DGC will feature the following and so much more: 
Over 30 classic arcade machines and 60+ games consoles, old and new! 
DGC will showcase the latest games coming out of Derby, such as Pneuma: Breath of Life by Deco Digital. 
There will be various panels featuring numerous topics such as collecting, game developing and how to get into the business.
Stalls where you can buy gaming related merchandise to your hearts content! 
Plenty of casual and competitive competitions with great prizes! 
DGC will take place
 on Saturday 7th/Sunday 8th February 2015 at The Derby Conference Centre. Free car parking at the venue, with food and drink available to purchase throughout each day..    What We Need & What You Get.We need to raise £4000 to make this event the best it can be. The money will go towards arcade machine/console hire, venue hire and advertising. If we exceed our goal, we will add more exciting gaming activities. We have three different ticket options for you: 
If you want to get the full DGC experience, then choose the £17 'Two Day Ticket' which gives you access to both Saturday (+Late Play) and Sunday!
Can't make both days, then choose a £10 ticket to either Saturday or Sunday.
If you want to play till bedtime then go for our £5 Late Play ticket, giving you access to all the consoles and aracade machines from 7pm till 11pm. 


Each person who buys a ticket will have the chance to win a PS4 or Xbox One (its your choice)! So what are you waiting for? Get those tickets fast!

  Other Ways You Can Help.If you can't fund our campaign, please spread the word and help make DGC a reality. If you would like to contribute in another way, please contact info@derbygameconvention.co.uk.

story:
Introduction

Hello! I'm an Indie developer from Korea and I need your help to finish my browser game!

'Three Kingdoms Battle' is a turn-based tactics and management game based on the popular Chinese history novel 'Romance of the Three Kingdoms'

Pick your side, rally generals, arm your troops and battle it out against other human opponents while relying on your logistic skills and cunningness to win!

My main focus with this title is to try and create the first pure browser game for E-sports in the world!

I do believe that, with your help, I can provide players with a satisfying game which they can play both casually and on a competitive level.

 

So what's the plan?

In its current state the game is running in open Beta and is accessible to everyone.

To get a general feel what it's about be sure to try playing it online at http://www.threekingdomsbattle.com/

Note: Be sure to turn your speakers on to hear the music!

 

If everything goes smoothly I'm hoping to do the following:

  • January 2013      – creating better graphics and portraits;
  • February 2013    – releasing official service;
  • March 2013        – activate various leagues;
  • Afterwards...       – game on!

 

What will the money be used for?

Because I'm more of a developer than a designer I can not provide high quality visual elements.

Fund raised here will, first of all, be spent on creating graphics to make for a better user experience.

 

Next come the in-game officer portraits.

During the Chinese “Three Kingdoms” period there were roughly at least 500 different generals!

I would like to, with your help, make sure each and every one of them gets a unique picture showing them in all their might.

So after the basic imagery is updated my next step is to commission artists who'll create these additional portraits.


Lastly: I do not have enough money to afford to pay for publishing.

In order for this game to reach it's full potential, all leftover cash will be spent on helping it go as far as possible!

You can achieve the perk by contribution.


Bear in mind that all of your contributions will be spent exclusively for development, graphics and publishing.

I'll be providing regular updates about the game to everyone who contribute whenever I make any progress.

 

 

What are the main features?

 

1) The whole game is HTML5 based!

  

 

This means that you can play the game on your device of choice.

No download necessary. Just open your browser, connect and play!

Your experience will be the same whether you play it on a Tablets or a PC.

I'm also preparing another interface for smart-phones, so stay tuned!

 

 

 

 

 

 

2) Say 'No' to pay2win!

'Three Kingdoms Battle' is aiming to be a game for E-sports.

Much like 'StarCraft' or 'League of Legends', in-balance is of the utmost importance!

This means there won't be any items or anything to always shift the fight in one players favor.

 

 

 

3) Dynamic battle system!

Be ready to perform all tactics used in the 'Three Kingdoms' novel!

Trick and ambush your opponents, or take advantage of your terrain to emerge victorious!

Rain, fog, day, night, landslides and floods! Be ready to adjust your play-style as necessary.

 

 

4) Hybrid control system.

Both players are good at realtime and players aren't good at realtime are ok.

This game have engagement for all.

 

 

 

 

5) Centralized server; find a game anytime, anywhere!

Because of the nature of the game, everyone in the world can play together on one server.

In other words: there are no ping issues! You don't have to choose the server such as US, Europe, Asia and so on...

So you will be able to meet and communicate with players from all around the globe! Also, thanks to that...

 

 

6) ...socialize! Invite your friend to help win huge battles!

 

 

1:N, N:1, 3:5, 4:8, 10:10 and so on...

All is possible !!

 

 

 

Rally huge armies with your companions and take on the enemies in large 20-officer frays!

Keep track of people you've worked with and call on them to help you rule the battlefield! Or...

 

 

 

7) Be a spectator! Broadcast exciting matches!

 

Perhaps you'd rather just watch other player's battle it out? Join in, watch and learn!

If that's not enough: you can also commentate as if you are a broadcaster!

 

 

 

 

What is the development currently at?

Currently there are only two historical maps available:

This is Guan Du. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guan_Du

  

This is red cliffs. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Red_Cliffs

 

Funding will, among the already mentioned, also be used to help make more maps!

Also there is already a good roster of prominent officers available:

This is Liu Bei. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liu_Bei

 

 

 

This is Guan Yu. Completed !  

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guan_Yu

 

 

 

 

This is Zhang Fei. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhang_Fei

 

 

 

This is Zhuge Liang. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhuge_Liang

 

 

 

 

 

This is Cao Cao. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cao_Cao

 

 

 

This is Sima Yi. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sima_Yi

 

 

 

This is Sun Quan. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun_Quan

 

 

 

This is Zhou Yu. Completed ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhou_Yu

 

 

 

 

 

This is (suppose to be) Lu bu.  Stopped ! 

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lu_Bu

 

Care to help me continue...?

Pick a perk that suits you best!

 

Thank you for you help!

story:
Short Summary

Read further to try the game RIGHT NOW!

Dwarf Tower is a turn-based tactics game of tower building and spellcasting. Each turn you develop your tower by placing blocks, constructing rooms, and play various spells. Your tower can have Libraries (store spells), Crystals (generate mana), Dwarf Dwellings (give you dwarves to repair the tower) and some other rooms. The crucial room is Archmage's Chamber. It's position is hidden from enemy and you must protect it at all costs, or you will lose. Room scheme is very important: the higher you place it, the more powerful it gets. Higher tower gets tremendous advantage over the lower one. But beware of Lightning strike! It can start a fire that will destroy the whole tower in several turns, so keep Dwarf Firefighters ready. Some rooms work much better underground, but there is a risk of flood! The overall goal of the game match is to destroy the enemy's Archmage's Chambers by crushing, burning or flooding it. It's not that simple however, because enemy will do his best to destroy your Archmage at the same time! 



The game features single player mode against the computer as well as multiplayer mode. You can challenge your friends right now (supported in beta).

Think of Sea Battle, mixed with some Worms fun, and Faster Than Light room management. Add beautiful pixel-art graphics, animation, and wonderful music from Kevin MacLeod. 

Sounds good? We encourage you to try Dwarf Tower beta right now:

 Desktop Windows                    Mac OS X  


Read the game rules here:     English      Russian 



Dwarf Tower Beta Screenshot


What We Need & What You Get

Check out the beta, see what we can do alone. And now see what we can do together with you.

IF WE REACH OUR BASIC GOAL OF 2000 USD:

  • iPhone & iPad version
  • Online tournaments between players on PC/Mac/iOS with ranks

IF WE REACH 3000 USD:

  • GameCenter and Facebook support (invite your friends)
  • Android version
  • More game modes: ability to generate random maps and customize rulesets (imagine underground battles)
IF WE REACH 4000 USD:

  • Ubuntu Linux version
  • Windows RT version

IF WE REACH 5000 USD:

  • Single Player Campaign with Interactive Fiction (Similar to Faster Than Light)
  • Support for more than 2 opponents (massive battles)


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Show us that you care - like our Facebook page
  • Support Dwarf Tower on Steam Greenlight!  
  • Help us translate the game into your language (contact us for details).
  • Share the project with your friends.


iosoftware is devoted to developing video games in the style and feel of the 90's. We have made Palm Kingdoms - a 'heroes' strategy for iOS, Mac & Windows. 

Palm Kingdoms 3

story:
COPS AND DRAGONS. 

Cops and Dragons is a company that specializes on making and designing games. The Core: Time Remains is our first big game, is a 2d action-puzzle platformer based on the history of Otto Brown, an anthropologist and his discovery of the ancient ruins of an unknown civilization. Guided by his ambition, the first level starts when Otto falls into a pit encountering the first enemy.

The gameplay is influenced by Metroid and Megaman primarily; one important aspect of the game is that you don’t gather points, what really matters is the time you take to finish each stage, the levels are made for speedruns. Otto will immerse himself into a quest discovering a forgotten world and old demigods living within the core of the planet.

Our mission is to gather enough money to finish the beta version and the first level of the game and all the debts we will engage. We are focusing only on the first level at this point because we need to make the tools to be able to make the whole game and basic expenses. So if we get enough to reach that goal, we can consolidate the initial structure of this project in order to make a serious and professional game.

  • Nine levels.

  • Decisions and different paths.

  • Three weapons, pickaxe, hookshot and slingshot.

  • Up to eight different powers from different artifacts.

  • Bosses and minibosses.

  • Two challenge modes, normal and hardcore.

  • Interesting enemies.

  • Fluid and fun gameplay.

  • Different endings.

  • Cross-Platform Windows and Mac.

In Cops and Dragons we are specialized on making and designing games. This company was found around a few core themes: Expression, Entertainment, Communication, Cohesion, Friendship and probably the most important, Fun, for without fun everything becomes routinary.


We love video games, we love them because they are challenging, they are fun, beautiful, exciting, a unique experience. We were raised playing them, it’s something that is hardwired inside of us, with that said we want to tell you, that we will be always working on behalf in passing that feeling, for the later and the future generations. We want to keep the joy and excitement of playing video games as long as we are able to exist, so be sure that we put our hearts on every video game we make. In order to success we need your help, we love doing this and we need your cooperation in order to achieve our dreams.

Who are the six members of Cops and Dragons, and what are we doing?

Axel Tamez: CEO and Producer.

Carolina Flores: UI, Head Programer.

Daniel Sanchez: Tool Programmer.

Raul Bustamante: Lead Designer and Animator.

Alan Coello: Creative Director and Level Designer.

Javier Cantu: Marketing.

If this campaign works, we’ll finish the first level and we are going to keep you up to date with our plans. Basically, if the game is successful, we’ll make the next nine levels which will be yours for free if you picked the 3rd perk or higher, so all our efforts will go towards finishing the game by the end of 2013. We are planning to release an open beta on April 6, so you will be able to test it.

 

 

The 6th perk named "Badge of justice" includes a wallpaper, three copies of the game, the soundtrack of the game up to April, your name appearing in special thanks and a special plushy knitted by hand with free shipment. The warrior ant plushy looks like this:

 

 

We also created a minigame for you to show you our capabilities and efforts towards this goal, we produce this game totally from scratch and put it on our website. this game was developed in 2 days and was made as an inner challenge, CLICK HERE TO PLAY THE MINIGAME. We hope you enjoy it!



Thank you!

 

Contact information

Official website

www.copsanddragons.com

Email, ask us anything you want to know!

info@copsanddragons.com

Facebook

http://www.facebook.com/CopsAndDragons

story:
“Forbidden knowledge”

 

 If you've ever played a role playing game, maybe you have had the opportunity to live an adventure in one of the best atmospheres of all times, the background created by H.P. Lovecr

aft with the Chtulhu Mythos.

 

Lovecraft was an author of horror, fantasy and science fiction, especially the subgenre known as weird fiction. Lovecraft's guiding aesthetic and philosophical principle was what he termed "cosmicism" or "cosmic horror" where the life is incomprehensible to human minds and that the universe is fundamentally inimical to the interests of humankind.

His stories, worthy of any noir novel, his beasts and creatures forged by the more alien and visceral terror to which humanity has had the misfortune to confront, are the highlight of what you can find in the role playing games that reflect his magnificient work.

From the legendary game of percentages to the versatile D20 system, different regulations have attempted to capture the terror that poured, time and time again, from the pen of Lovecraft and so many other artists who followed him.

 

After examining all the material published so far, we find expansions and modules, some of great quality as the 'Orient Express' or the mythical 'Masks of Nyarlathotep' among others. But we also find many pure filler material with little to none interest.

 

So we, as hardened players, want to help with our little bit to this wonderful world of horror literature.

 

"The Thing on the Doorstep"

 

What would happen if there were an organization, a society that took charge of investigating the Myths providing a headquarters and able members, experts in occult, history and with all the information that the narrator and the players need for involving directly new characters? The characters would be aware of the world in which they live and would have the confidence of the rest of the group, because they belong to the same society. The result would be a Player Character ready for action, that only has to be informed of what has happened so far.

 

What are the benefits of having a research society?. The game becomes more dynamic, entertaining, and avoids having to introduce new characters who may have died or lost their sanity prematurely. The Society itself is an inexhaustible source of literary devices that enrich the game, where the narrator can also provide elements and privileged information to the players right in the beginning or throughout the game, helping them even if they get stuck without knowing what to do at some point in the plot.  It also allows the narrator not only to use Non Player Characters that are relevant or have been members of society, but to also provide you, within the campaigns, of unique antagonists, occult societies, sectarian witches and all manner of creatures of the Mythos.

 

In summary, here we present a setting's tool for the Narrator. A paranormal investigation society with detailed information about their offices around the globe, as well as the relevant assets and the characters that you can use to further enrich your modules.

 

“A Strange Manuscript Found”

 

The book will be published in PDF format to download from the web, and the money we ask for is destined to meet the payment of the different artists who are collaborating in its creation. At any rate, if you wish it, you can have a physical copy for your own use via online publishers where you will pay only the cost of printing, handling and transportation.

 

Details of Project:

 

-        We will include a new Weird fiction tale as introduction, written by an award-winning writer  to reflect the atmosphere of the society in the universe of myths.

 

-        Full description of the different headquarters of the Society in different places around the world (Arkham, London, Cairo...).

 

-        Portrait and description of the main assets and characters of the Society. The leaders of the Society, its founders and leading members will be described as NPCs.

 

-        Chronology of the Society beginning in 1890 until the 20's. Description of its foundation, beginnings and subsequent expansion  throughout the globe.

 

-        A Campaign divided into modules that can be played separately or consecutively around the world.

 

-        Throughout the description, several ideas and tips will be given to help you create new scenarios.  We will also publish a quick method of games creation, for those times when you want to play, but you have not anything prepared in advance.

 

-        New monsters and criatures, new secret societies and sectarian antagonists.

 

The manual will be richly illustrated and edited, with an emphasis on the described characters, which are included in numerous short stories along the book.

 

In addition the manual will be published simultaneously in English and Spanish.

 

An essential tool for any group of researchers. A great book written with professionalism and quality, with no filler content, on which we are working conscientiously. There are great artists and a good editorial team behind the project that are looking forward to your help to just start the work.

 

“The Shadow over Innsmouth”

 

Due to development high costs, we have used IndieGoGo because we believe it is a fantastic platform to realize our dream and make our contribution to the world of RPG. IndieGoGo allows direct communication between people like us, developers of ideas, tireless workers that love what we do, that have the right people and the experience and you, the people who appreciate and demand a good work.

 

We need your valuable contribution to this project. Without your help, this project will end in a nonsense. Give us the opportunity to make grow that inherited feeling that every narrator can transmit in his stories coming from the essence of  Lovecraft's pen.

 

We need your valuable contribution to make this project possible and for a potential continuation of this work.

 

If you deposit your trust in us, we plan to make a second part. We want to extend the shadows of terror until the fall of the 20th century. We want to walk between years of war, spies and the birth of computers and digital comunications and what all of it supposed for the Myths. It all depends, obviously, on the success of this first part.

 

It is normal to have doubts about the project. You can contact us at vheissenberg@gmail.com and we will answer you to every questions. We look forward to any questions or comments you'd want to send us. We want a product that belong to everyone, that can contribute to its development in the shape that he would, providing any ideas or help to make this book a great reference.

 

There are some rewards for the fact help fund our product. Read this section on 'IndieGoGo' and send your contribution.

 

What would we do if we overcome the initial objectives of the project?

 

Well, our goal is to make our dream come true making an easy and comprehensive handbook to facilitate the work of making an adventure in the Lovecraft's worlds. It's just that. But if we get enough, we will extend the story by adding new elements to walk over the time and the shadows. We dont want to be left in the basic manual, we want to extend the history of the Society beyond the 20s. Our proposals are:

 

The aforementioned plus an extension of the manual describing the Heissenberg Society in World War II. The Nazis intended to use magic to control an unimaginable power. In their sheer folly, they recruited experts occultists of similar ideology with the intention not only to win the war, but to rule later with the help of the yoke of alien horror. New weapons, more monsters, antagonists and allies in a setting that mixes the classic horror background with an atmosphere of battles, politicians, spies, soldiers and dozens of hidden secrets to discover.

 

An additional adventure: Between 1914 and 1918 there were 5 planetary conjunctions, each of which leading to catastrophic consequences that caused the suffering of many but whose news were hidden thanks to contacts and money. They were just the preamble of the conjunction that now, in 1921, will happen, concluding the cycle and provoking the advent of  "The Expected". A sect with multiple branches, a leader, many individuals involved and a complex plot in which mankind faces a danger that can only be avoided solving an enigma of such complexity that it will need the most experienced researchers.

 

It is obvious that these extensions will only begin if we get enough funds. Making a book, even a small one, requires an enormous effort on the part of many professionals who dedicate their time, effort, knowledge and experience so that the objective is completed properly. We do not intend to do something simple, with the idea of an early completion. We want to create a good manual to be a reference and that would be made so that it looks like a good tool for roleplaying games themed in the worlds of Myths created by Lovecraft.
story_txt:
“Forbidden knowledge”
 
 If you've ever played a role playing game, maybe you have had the opportunity to live an adventure in one of the best atmospheres of all times, the background created by H.P. Lovecr
aft with the Chtulhu Mythos.
 
Lovecraft was an author of horror, fantasy and science fiction, especially the subgenre known as weird fiction. Lovecraft's guiding aesthetic and philosophical principle was what he termed "cosmicism" or "cosmic horror" where the life is incomprehensible to human minds and that the universe is fundamentally inimical to the interests of humankind.
His stories, worthy of any noir novel, his beasts and creatures forged by the more alien and visceral terror to which humanity has had the misfortune to confront, are the highlight of what you can find in the role playing games that reflect his magnificient work.
From the legendary game of percentages to the versatile D20 system, different regulations have attempted to capture the terror that poured, time and time again, from the pen of Lovecraft and so many other artists who followed him.
 
After examining all the material published so far, we find expansions and modules, some of great quality as the 'Orient Express' or the mythical 'Masks of Nyarlathotep' among others. But we also find many pure filler material with little to none interest.
 
So we, as hardened players, want to help with our little bit to this wonderful world of horror literature.
 
"The Thing on the Doorstep"
 
What would happen if there were an organization, a society that took charge of investigating the Myths providing a headquarters and able members, experts in occult, history and with all the information that the narrator and the players need for involving directly new characters? The characters would be aware of the world in which they live and would have the confidence of the rest of the group, because they belong to the same society. The result would be a Player Character ready for action, that only has to be informed of what has happened so far.
 
What are the benefits of having a research society?. The game becomes more dynamic, entertaining, and avoids having to introduce new characters who may have died or lost their sanity prematurely. The Society itself is an inexhaustible source of literary devices that enrich the game, where the narrator can also provide elements and privileged information to the players right in the beginning or throughout the game, helping them even if they get stuck without knowing what to do at some point in the plot.  It also allows the narrator not only to use Non Player Characters that are relevant or have been members of society, but to also provide you, within the campaigns, of unique antagonists, occult societies, sectarian witches and all manner of creatures of the Mythos.
 
In summary, here we present a setting's tool for the Narrator. A paranormal investigation society with detailed information about their offices around the globe, as well as the relevant assets and the characters that you can use to further enrich your modules.
 


“A Strange Manuscript Found”

 
The book will be published in PDF format to download from the web, and the money we ask for is destined to meet the payment of the different artists who are collaborating in its creation. At any rate, if you wish it, you can have a physical copy for your own use via online publishers where you will pay only the cost of printing, handling and transportation.
 
Details of Project:
 
-        We will include a new Weird fiction tale as introduction, written by an award-winning writer  to reflect the atmosphere of the society in the universe of myths.
 
-        Full description of the different headquarters of the Society in different places around the world (Arkham, London, Cairo...).
 
-        Portrait and description of the main assets and characters of the Society. The leaders of the Society, its founders and leading members will be described as NPCs.
 
-        Chronology of the Society beginning in 1890 until the 20's. Description of its foundation, beginnings and subsequent expansion  throughout the globe.
 
-        A Campaign divided into modules that can be played separately or consecutively around the world. 
 
-        Throughout the description, several ideas and tips will be given to help you create new scenarios.  We will also publish a quick method of games creation, for those times when you want to play, but you have not anything prepared in advance.
 
-        New monsters and criatures, new secret societies and sectarian antagonists. 
 
The manual will be richly illustrated and edited, with an emphasis on the described characters, which are included in numerous short stories along the book.
 
In addition the manual will be published simultaneously in English and Spanish.
 
An essential tool for any group of researchers. A great book written with professionalism and quality, with no filler content, on which we are working conscientiously. There are great artists and a good editorial team behind the project that are looking forward to your help to just start the work.

story:
The game has crafting, stealth, and puzzle elements.

Crafting is the most important part of the game. Because when we formed the idea for this game, we would like to show how amazing physics and chemistry are. We don’t want people to create something by just clicking the screen therefore we created a control system. This system is like Surgeon Simulator. You can hold the objects, carry them and rotate them.

The laboratory has various objects like beaker, heater, and scales. Heater and scales are the most important elements of crafting part because you need to scale the materials to calculate the mixing ratio and you need to heat these material in certain degree for some time if it is necessary. For example when you mix sugar and Kno3 (Potassium Nitrate) for rocket fuel, you need to maintain a certain ratio and heat it at certain temperature. If the temperature is above the limit, the reaction may not occur. We do not want random actions in the laboratory. We will leave many books in the game for you to discover and you will learn new reactions from these books.

In the crafting part, we want to show numerous physical and chemical reactions and we want you to use the products and the tools in the game.

 

You can mix objects in Lily’s lab and have homogenous and heterogenous mixtures. You can also use physical and chemical decomposition methods to decompose the mixtures.

We do not want a system where you will have ready-made products or where you can easily buy the products. You need to create the objects or materials on your own. For example, you need to use hydrogen, why don’t you try the electrolyze?

Does the rocket need a wing? Why don’t you use a 3D printer? We do not want the object to appear spontaneously, we want to show how each object and tool are created. Thus, we added a 3D printer in the game. You can print the pieces of tools in the game. For example, when Lily needs a drone, you can build it in your own lab rather than buying online. If 3D print has a limit, we think that this limit is your imagination and Lily has an extraordinary imagination.

 

Yes, the rocket fuel has sugar. The sugar that is in lollypops, ice-cream, and cakes. It is amazing that this material we consume everyday can also be rocket fuel. We want to show these to people. There are many other things we want to show. We want people to notice how beautiful and dazzling science is.

 

 

Weighing machine.

 

Lily's note. 

There are many places which Lily must enter in secret. Hospitals, schools, or the house of the neighbour. When she enters these places, nobody should notice her.

Hiding from security and cameras is not enough, she needs to clean her traces. When you entered the room was the drawer open or closed? We do not want the owners to suspect.

You need to be careful with your steps if there is someone behind you. All other characters are sensitive to sound. Therefore, you need to be silent when you are closing the doors or not to drop the objects you are investigating. If something falls and breaks, it is just a matter of time someone finds you.

You need to be careful about the cameras in the game since you don’t want to get caught. There are many cameras in the spaces and you need to be careful on how to move. You can dodge the cameras with a good timing and strategy.

Lily will have various problems throughout the adventure. These can be computer passwords, or locked doors. To overcome these problems Lily should investigate the surrounding, use the object she created in the lab, find the hidden objects, and manipulate the people. These can have a single solution as well as multiple solutions. The solution will be about the methods you use.

 The password may be the girl’s birthday?

Sometime brute force may be ineffective. Instead of breaking the iron, you may melt it with a thermite reaction. You can keep the objects from the lab in your bag and use them when necessary.

 Lily was born in 28 November 2003 in a car on its way to hospital. Lily had a regular childhood, she like to play with her toys and ride bike. Until she started to school, she spends most of her time with her grandfather because her mother and father was working. She was very happy because her grandfather was special for her. Lily would ask anything she is curious about and her grandfather will answer to her questions. “Grandfather why is the moon round?”

 “Grandfather why can’t we fly like the birds?”

 “Grandfather why can’t the trees talk?” 

“Grandfather why...”

 “Why...” 

The most important that shaped Lily’s character was this curiosity was supported by her parents. When her grandfather gave Lily a telescope, she became interested in space. When Lily started the school she still wants to spend time with her grandfather but her father was against it. Because her father thought that her grandfather is a crazy old man and was talking about nonsense. When Lily was 11, her grandfather became sick. After a short time her grandfather moved into Lily’s house. Lily was extremely happy about it because she can spend more time with her. Lily would read chemistry, physics, and astrophysics books to her grandfather. When she didn’t understand anything in the book, her grandfather would explain to her. This continued for another 8 months, then Lily found her grandfather dead in his bed. Lily withdrawn and stopped talking to people. She would spend all her days in her room. She was watching the space with telescope her grandfather gave to her. 

One night when Lily was looking at the sky, she saw something extraordinary. Now, Lily stepped into an adventure which she will never forget.

 Lily will have dialogues with other characters in the game. You need to carefully select your answers. Because these answers will be decisions and you will see these decisions later in the game. Lily may lie to her family, friends, teachers, and many other character. Lily must hide many things, and you need to form your answers accordingly. Because if the answers contradict and the other characters find out, you may get into trouble.

Because we need you.

  • Technical Equipment: Our computers are not good enough to develop this game. We need computers to develop a game and we do not have enough financial status.

  • Music- Sound: We are only two people and we are not experienced in sound. Music is an important element of a game and we want amazing music. The atmosphere and emotions that the music will give are important for us. Of course, there is free music online yet we want quality music from good artists.

  • Language: We are planning to launch this game in more than one language. It is impossible to adapt it to all languages on earth yet reaching to people is important for us.

We are doing everything we can to develop this idea yet we are having problems in some areas. The decreased interest to science is worrying thing. Especially, we are worried about the loss of interest in children between 6-18 years old. We need to pay more attention to science because science is the only salvation of humankind.

story:
Who Am I? What Is ConVoke?

  • My name is James Burton, known as Burtannia, I am passionate about gaming and eSports. My goal is to bring down the barrier between casual and competitive gaming by making an organisation that accepts both.
  • The name ConVoke means to assemble/summon which reflects our vision of bring gamers of all kinds together.
  • As the organisation grows we hope to build successful competitive teams in multiple games and also large casual gaming clans along with a user friendly website to enhance your gaming experience.

Where Your Money Goes:

eSports organisations and gaming communities only exist because of the support that you guys give, this organisation is no different! Without your financial support this project won't happen.
  • Countless hours have already been spent planning and designing.
  • I have carefully selected some of the best designers to do our branding and website but they come at a price.
  • Then there is the running and upkeep of the website.

What's Different About ConVoke Gaming?

The following are some of the goals that we hope will make us stand out, some of which we have yet to see done in gaming:

  • Competitive and Casual clans will bring in all types of gamers.
  • Even if you don't play for us you can still benefit by using our forums to find new team mates or look up tutorials.
  • Create a player ranking system that is dependent upon reviews from your previous team mates making it easier for you to find the level of player you want!

What Are The Risks?

Setting up this organisation comes with two major risks:
1) We don't raise sufficient funds. 2) People don't join us or use our website.

  • Hours and hours of planning have gone in to ensure that we will offer something to all sorts of gamers granting us a large target audience.
  • You guys helped create giants like OpTic Gaming just by supporting them whether by watching their videos or buying their merchandise. I have no doubt that with your support we can turn this into something big!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you don't want to help us with money you can still support us by doing any or all of the following:

  • Subscribe to our YouTube channel and watch our videos (will be uploading as soon as our graphics are done) - We now need 500 Subscribers to get a custom URL! http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHlHYRY9AcmZUzUlFF-9IFw
  • Follow us on TwitchTV and get ready to tune into our livestreams (again will be setup once we have graphics) - http://www.twitch.tv/convokegaming
  • Follow us on Twitter - http://www.twitter.com/ConVokeGaming
  • Give us a shoutout to your followers! - http://goo.gl/kyOPlG
  • Subscribe to our subreddit - http://www.reddit.com/r/ConVokeGaming

We hope you are as excited as we are for the launch of this organisation!

story:
Short Summary

Hi I'm Andy Barratt, the creator of My Agility Board which is a website that gives a free online agile board to put your sticky notes onto.  You can sign up to My Agility Board for free in seconds at www.myagilityboard.com

I created My Agility Board to help me keep organised during my honours project at Dundee University where I was studying Applied Computing.  I have since graduated and am now working as a junior developer in Edinburgh, Scotland.

My fiance and I are keen on keeping My Agility Board secure and reliable however, at the moment, that's not something we can do completely.  The website is hosted on something called virtual hosting which means that it's on a server along side potentially hundreds of other people's websites which can slow it down and sometimes cause it to go down for several minutes.

We're also wanting to buy an SSL certificate that will prove that we've been verified as something people can trust as well as make sure that your data is transmitted across the internet in a secure way so that it can't be caught by a man in the middle trying to hack your private data.

With your contributions, you will allow us to make the site secure and reliable for two years, during which time we're hoping to start making money on the site by offering "pro" accounts that will allow users to do more with their boards, for instance, add more boards and add extra information to notes, something that will be useful for professionals using it as well as those who just like to keep things organised.

We really hope you can help, in exchange for a contribution of more than $1, you will automatically make sure you will get any paid for features free of charge, for life.

What We Need & What You Get

  • A Verisign SSL Certificate for 2 years will cost $630.86
  • A Memset VM1000 Server for 2 years will cost $453.14
  • Each T-Shirt including postage will cost $24.03
    • There's a potential that we will need to send out around 40 shirts
  • IndieGoGo charges a 4% fee then $25 to wire it internationally

So in total we're needing to raise $2,155.42

To see an example board with these details on it go to www.myagilityboard.com/funding

In exchange we're planning to give T-Shirts for contributions of $50 or over.  These T-Shirts will have the phrase, "I used agility, it's super effective!" embroidered on them.  More details about perks can be found on this page.

We're going for the all or nothing funding method here so if we don't raise all the funds here, we'll not actually get any money and your pledge will be refunded.  We just feel it would be a bit dishonest to take your money if we can't actually carry out the project.

The Impact

By helping out, you'll be helping us actually do something wonderful with this site and make it so much more useful to users as it will be much more reliable so it's there when people need it, as they need it.  Some of our users have already told us that they put some secure/private data on their boards so your help will also make sure that no one can catch what they are sending to the site by sniffing their networks.

Other Ways You Can Help

It doesn't matter if you can't contribute but sharing this page and letting others know about My Agility Board will really help and of course, we'd love it if you sign up to My Agility Board and use it and tell me how you're using it.  People's feedback really helps us improve the site and it's free to use so the more people using it, the more feedback we can get.  So please, even if you can't help with money, just using the site and sharing it and sharing this campaign is actually contributing in a massive way and of course, we will love you forever :)

Andy Barratt and Heather Ellis
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi I'm Andy Barratt, the creator of My Agility Board which is a website that gives a free online agile board to put your sticky notes onto.  You can sign up to My Agility Board for free in seconds at www.myagilityboard.com
I created My Agility Board to help me keep organised during my honours project at Dundee University where I was studying Applied Computing.  I have since graduated and am now working as a junior developer in Edinburgh, Scotland.
My fiance and I are keen on keeping My Agility Board secure and reliable however, at the moment, that's not something we can do completely.  The website is hosted on something called virtual hosting which means that it's on a server along side potentially hundreds of other people's websites which can slow it down and sometimes cause it to go down for several minutes.
We're also wanting to buy an SSL certificate that will prove that we've been verified as something people can trust as well as make sure that your data is transmitted across the internet in a secure way so that it can't be caught by a man in the middle trying to hack your private data.
With your contributions, you will allow us to make the site secure and reliable for two years, during which time we're hoping to start making money on the site by offering "pro" accounts that will allow users to do more with their boards, for instance, add more boards and add extra information to notes, something that will be useful for professionals using it as well as those who just like to keep things organised.
We really hope you can help, in exchange for a contribution of more than $1, you will automatically make sure you will get any paid for features free of charge, for life.


What We Need & What You Get

A Verisign SSL Certificate for 2 years will cost $630.86
A Memset VM1000 Server for 2 years will cost $453.14
Each T-Shirt including postage will cost $24.03

There's a potential that we will need to send out around 40 shirts


IndieGoGo charges a 4% fee then $25 to wire it internationally

So in total we're needing to raise $2,155.42
To see an example board with these details on it go to www.myagilityboard.com/funding
In exchange we're planning to give T-Shirts for contributions of $50 or over.  These T-Shirts will have the phrase, "I used agility, it's super effective!" embroidered on them.  More details about perks can be found on this page.
We're going for the all or nothing funding method here so if we don't raise all the funds here, we'll not actually get any money and your pledge will be refunded.  We just feel it would be a bit dishonest to take your money if we can't actually carry out the project.


The Impact
By helping out, you'll be helping us actually do something wonderful with this site and make it so much more useful to users as it will be much more reliable so it's there when people need it, as they need it.  Some of our users have already told us that they put some secure/private data on their boards so your help will also make sure that no one can catch what they are sending to the site by sniffing their networks.


Other Ways You Can Help
It doesn't matter if you can't contribute but sharing this page and letting others know about My Agility Board will really help and of course, we'd love it if you sign up to My Agility Board and use it and tell me how you're using it.  People's feedback really helps us improve the site and it's free to use so the more people using it, the more feedback we can get.  So please, even if you can't help with money, just using the site and sharing it and sharing this campaign is actually contributing in a massive way and of course, we will love you forever :)
Andy Barratt and Heather Ellis

story:
SUPPORT US ON STEAM GREENLIGHT!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

During the golden era of Toonville, Fleish the Fox is the star of all the shorts recorded in this black and white cartoon world. His arch-nemesis, Mr Mintz, always tries to ruin his adventures by capturing his girlfriend Cherry, but despite his evil machinations, Fleish continuously manages to get his happy ending with her. But things are going to take an unexpected turn…

Fleish & Cherry in Crazy Hotel is a game set in the 30s, the sunset of the black and white era. The visual elements, the sound and especially the gameplay itself, will make the player feel like being another toon. But before we delve into “Crazy Hotel”, let us check in at the reception to explain the features of the game:

  • Hybrid between graphic adventure and action adventure in perfect balance with different environmental puzzles spread in the game’s 5 chapters.
  • Single-player adventure in black & white 2D visuals, adopting an isometric view.
  • A story with a fun and rich dialogue system, multiple characters and objects with which you'll have to interact to achieve your goals, and use incredible skills typical of cartoons.
  • Developed with the Unity engine for PC, Mac and Linux.
  • Initially, the game will be available in English and Spanish.

Several elements of known past games have inspired us in the development of “Fleish & Cherry in Crazy Hotel”.

This is the recipe followed by the chefs from “Crazy Hotel”:

Combining the isometric view of Little Big Adventure with the puzzle's style of Zelda .

We mix it with the humor, the dialogue selection system and the type of interaction with characters and objects of graphic adventures like Monkey Island, Day of the Tentacle and Grim Fandango.

Those dialogues are presented through a visual touch akin to Professor Layton and Phoenix Wright.

 

Being a toon is not as easy as people "paint it".

Throughout the story, the player will have to tie up the information obtained on the world, its objects and characters. He must find the right combination of items and abilities to use depending on the situations that arise. You won’t only be transported to this cartoon universe, but you will also have to act and think like a toon in order to progress in the game.

This is what the room service has prepared for your stay in our title:

  • Black and white game, with the characteristic style of the animated shorts of the 30's.
  • Ingenious environmental puzzles that you'll have to solve using different objects, skills of the cartoons and, above all, thinking like a cartoon.
  • A story with a plot that will absorb you from start to finish, filled with surprising and unexpected side stories.
  • Plot twist of "The Damsel in distress" to "Dude in Distress".
  • Different enemies that you will have to defeat by using your cunning and by solving the puzzles that will appear.
  • Even if the action occurs in a hotel, as it’s a cartoon building each one of the floors is a complete different world full of surprises.
  • Frame by frame animation of characters, objects, intro and the different cut scenes in the vein of classic animation style.
  • The game will be full of details and tributes to the history of animation and to the great artists of the time like Walt Disney, Ub Iwerks, Max Fleischer or Friz Freleng.
  • EXTRA! The player can find collectable posters to delve deeper in the game’s universe.

 

 

Ready, set... action!! Fleish begins his new short film walking around Toonville when he meets his lovely girlfriend Cherry. The romantic moment is interrupted when the villain Mr. Mintz enters the scene and, on the contrary to what we were accustomed, captures Fleish and takes him to the top of a hotel under construction. This time, it is Cherry’s turn to muster her courage and overcome the craziness awaiting her on the multiple floors of the building and rescue her beloved Fleish. Are you ready to accompany Cherry on her adventure?

Characters

A variety of animated characters with different stories that you will discover throughout the game are waiting in the Hotel Hyperion. Let's meet the main cast:

 

Cherry. Sweet, fun and positive, this is the way we could define Cherry, the protagonist of the game and the one the player will control. Our regular damsel in distress in all her past adventures with Fleish, will now have to rescue her love from the clutches of the evil Mr Mintz, and discover what is her true role in Toonville’s universe.

Fleish. This attentive and generous fox, always looking for a fun solution to help others, is the main star of the short films directed in Toonville. He will be kidnapped by his enemy Mr. Mintz and his only hope rests upon his love, Cherry.

Mr. Mintz. The villain of the game, and Fleish’s antagonist. His selfish and manipulative nature makes him the evil figure of Toonville. Tired and sick of Fleish’s fame, he decides to capture him to record his own short films in which he will be the only protagonist.

 

Ninette: She’s Cherry’s best friend and a journalist in the newspaper “Daily Looney”. She is a hard-worker but her impulsive and restless personality has caused her some problems. Her big addiction to work has made her negletct her relationship with Doc Goose. She moves to the Hyperion Hotel to write an article about Fleish and while she is doing research about it, she will discover a hidden mystery in Toonville.

Doc Goose: He was a promising scientist whose career was truncated because of the disastrous effects of his inventions. His extremely clumsiness and forgetfulness have earned him the reputation of “Nutty Scientist” in Toonville. He loves Ninette like in the first day and he protects her with his secret identity from the troubles in which she gets into. Because he’s not our hero. He’s a silent…and clumsy guardian, a watchful protector…

 

 

 

Behind Fleish & Cherry in Crazy Hotel is Red Little House Studios, a structure gathering a creative team of dedicated artists and developers, committed with their spirit and vision to make an original and entertaining game.

 

Collaborators:

Yoni Dayan: Senior Consultant

Veteran in new technology and gaming, graduated in international affairs and history, Yoni is a consultant, advising us on several subjects and helping us with crowdfunding, publishing on the web and with the French translations. He is a fan of 80s and 90s PC games and innovative software. He tries to be paid in Spanish delicacies.

There is nothing wrong with your monitor... Do not attempt to adjust the picture... Fleish & Cherry comes in full Black & White!

The visual aspect is one of the most important parts of the game, because everything has to be anchored to the 30s and respond to the laws of the cartoon’s world. We have traveled back in time and lived with Mickey Mouse, Oswald, the Looney Toones, Betty Boop and Popeye, among others, to inspire us and to get our own style.

 

 

 


Someone once said that since the advent of sound, music was an additional companion for the cartoons. That’s why the soundtrack of Hankins Studio is the best companion of the Fleish & Cherry adventures.

Alejandro Ribes Hankins and Carlos Vera Tamarit, members of this recording studio specializing in sound design and music production, will be responsible to liven up the party in the hotel. The type of music, from ragtime to Big Band, and the sound effects made in Toonville, will be very reminiscent of that period and every character and level of the game will have its own style. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If we reach our crowdfunding goal, here is the planned distribution of your backing:

  • 21% for the Spanish Tax.
  • 29% for the Rewards Production.
  • 7% for the Indiegogo fee.
  • Another 7% for the Music.
  • The 36% is aimed to cover the costs of:
    • Greenlight (100$)
    • Costs of electricity, water and internet for 1 year (1000€)
    • Food.
    • Administrative costs.
    • Buy the Unity license and others...

Making a video game is a complex process, therefore there is a possibility that it will be delayed by glitches, external circumstances or just because we need more time to refine it. Fortunately, behind this project there is a team of qualified people who will devote all the time and effort necessary to make “Fleish & Cherry in Crazy Hotel” a reality that all of you can enjoy as soon as possible.

We have prepared ourselves a lot by studying and analyzing the classics, as one of the biggest challenges that we had to face was to ensure that all the scenes, characters and objects are drawn, animated and defined with the style of the animated shorts of the 30's in the most faithful way possible.

With financial backing to improve our work resources, we would get a better game and shorten the production time. That's why we need your support! 

 

You can follow us and see the process of the development of the game through our website updates in:

www.redlittlehousestudios.com

 

Following us in our social networks:

                                        

 

AND REMEMBER TO SUPPORT US ON STEAM GREENLIGHT!

story:
This text is also available in German. Go to: www.gmcgame.com/crowdfunding?l=de

The old earth is doomed to extinction and the people start to colonize a new earth. In order to prevent repeated environmental disasters and overexploitation, the new world has been put under strict protection. The exploitation of natural resources is now done by robots in faraway systems. Former transport ships have been converted to cargo ships whose operations are monitored by only one human commander. The exploiting corporations go to any length to protect their domination and are not afraid to use battleships.

In Galactic Mining Corp you are responsible for the tactical management of your corporation and in real-time battles you are fighting against other players to protect your interests. You expand your resource production, extent your fleet, configure your ships, build mine exploitation stations or defense systems and you fight for natural resources.

Galactic Mining Corp (GMC) is a real-time strategy and simulation game that offers many gameplay options:

  • Different ways of playing as miner, merchant, protector or pirate
    (can be switched during the game)
  • Construct individual battleships
  • Attack and defense, alone or together as a team
  • Secure planets and exploitation stations
  • Raw material mining and trade
  • Research and expansion
  • Train your commanders
  • Diplomacy: form alliances or wage war

The universe consists of:

  • Galaxies
  • Systems
  • Side Systems
  • Planets
  • Asteroids
  • Anomalies
  • any many more explorable objects

Galaxy

Every galaxy consists of 10 to 20 systems.

The fleets can travel between galaxies by use of jump drive. But the jump drive is inaccurate causing the fleet to reappear in a random system entering another galaxy.

Systems

Every system contains 1 to 5 colonizable planets as well as raw material asteroids.

The systems of a galaxy are interconnected by hyperspace corridors which provide secure travel between target systems.

Side Systems

The side systems contain raw material asteroids, unexplored anomalies and missions.

They can only be accessed through a hyperspace corridor of the main system.

Planets

The colonizable planets of a system yield only few resources and are protected by an intergalactic agreement against overexploitation. Only resource storage and processing is possible on them.

Asteroids

Asteroids contain extractable raw materials which are required to build ships and structures as well as for further research.

The player owns a home planet; from there the player can explore systems, build ships and structures and advance technologies.

The own planet yields only small quantities of raw materials, therefore the player has to scout the surroundings and nearby systems with a scout vessel searching for available asteroids.

With mine ships, which have been manufactured only for this purpose, the player establishes exploitation stations on asteroids. After that, a free transporter starts to carry the raw materials back to the home world.

The acquired raw materials are used to upgrade the planet, the asteroids, the fleets or for further research.

The player combats rival fleets, loots transporters, asteroids or whole planets.

Alone or in player alliances huge battles can be conducted.

Every ship can be equipped according to your own requirements with weapons and protection systems. Therefore every ship has equippable module slots.

In total 15 different ships are available, providing endless combination possibilities with their individually equippable modules.

Module Types

There are 4 module types:

  • Attack Modules
    These slots are available for weapons.
  • Defense Modules
    Contain defense modules like shields or armor.
  • Support Modules
    Support attack/defense modules or provide further abilities like tractor beams.
  • User-defined Modules
    These modules have to be explored for each ship and can be defined as attack, defense or support module.

5 Ship Categories

Ships are divided up to different sizes:

  • Corvettes
  • Frigates
  • Destroyers
  • Cruisers
  • Battleships

The size determines the amount of available modules and the basic values for attack, defense or speed.

3 Ship Orientations

Every ship category provides 3 different module configurations:

  • Attack
  • Defense
  • Support

Ships with attack configuration offer for example more weapon modules but less protection.

Raw material mining, transport and supply are done with civilian ships.

  • Transporter
    Transports exploited raw materials back to the home world or to a merchant.
  • Mine Ship / Exploitation Station
    Establishes a base on asteroids and produces raw materials.
  • Settlement Ship
    Explores and colonizes new worlds.

Every ship (battleships and civilian ships) has its own commander who collects experience points completing tasks, missions and battles. These points can be invested in his skills.

The training and the commander’s development can be the crucial factor during space battles or for protecting your resources against pirate attacks.

The home world as well as its orbit and an asteroid’s orbit can be upgraded with structures:

  • defense systems
  • resource storing
  • shipyards
  • commercial center
  • surveillance satellites
  • jamming transmitters
  • jump distortion

  • Miner
    Expand your influence through raw material mining and explore new regions.
  • Merchant
    Be responsible for exchange and commerce of resources and gain supremacy through economic expertise.
  • Protector
    Protect miners and merchants from pirate attacks. You advance by using diplomacy and combat.
  • Pirate
    Life as a miner is not enough for you, or are you simply evil? Then you can cause fear and terror as a pirate.

The basic gameplay is the same for every disposition; small differences are in details like raw material mining or ship’s speed.

Major differences are for example in protection contracts (for protectors) or the looting of raw material transporters (for pirates).

The gameplay choice can be changed after some playtime, this way a miner can become a pirate and vice versa.

Galactic Insurance

In space battles a player may quickly lose his fleet; therefore a galactic insurance exists, so that the flow of playing is not disturbed and all the development has not been in vain.

This insurance automatically replaces all ships and structures after a certain amount of time, so the player does not lose his progress.

In order to accelerate the restoration of a player’s structures and fleets, exploited raw materials can be invested.

Why?

In every game you find hardcore players and casual players. The casual player would be frustrated rather quickly, if he or she lost all the acquired progress through big players.

Therefore the casual player is encouraged to form alliances or to seek security from protectors.

The fun factor is supposed to remain; big players are rewarded through obtained raw materials as well as experience points.

5 €
You like the idea and you are excited for the result.
In addition to the beta access you get the first month playing time of the final version for free.

10 €
In return for your support you get a bronze badge for early supporters in your gaming profile (every player can see the badges scanning your profile).
The first 3 month playing time of the final version are for free.

15 €
A commander in the game gets your name which is visible for everyone.
Additionally you receive the first 6 month playing time of the final version and of course all rewards mentioned before.

20 €
As faithful supporter you receive the silver badge for early supporters.
Additionally you receive the first 12 month playing time of the final version and of course all rewards mentioned before.

40 €
In return for your support you get a mug with "GMC - Miner" print.
Additionally you receive the first 24 month playing time of the final version and of course all rewards mentioned before.

80 €
For your love of the game you receive the gold badge for early supporters.
Unlimited in time access to the game and of course all rewards mentioned before.

200 € Commander-Edition
Your picture is immortalized within the game. A picture for a ship commander, especially adjusted for the game, will be visible for everyone.
Unlimited in time access to the game and of course all rewards mentioned before.

8.000 €

GMC will be a lot of development work for us and we hope for your support.

We are two web developers and we estimate a timescale between 4 - 6 month (including beta phase) for completion.

During this time the main game features will be realized:

  • building ships
  • combat
  • research
  • colonization
  • commerce
  • missions (also for multiple players)
  • ranking lists
  • multilingualism: German / English

Whaaaaat, crowdfunding and that for a browser game with subscription model?

No, we are not crazy ! ;-)

The game needs a certain pre-financing so that we can finish it competently within the estimated 4 - 6 month (including beta phase).

We deliberately decided to include a subscription model because we want to deliver a satisfying game without unfair advantages for a small group of paying players.

Further we want to guarantee a good server infrastructure in addition to reliable support for future game maintenance.

System Requirements

  • HTML5 browser (latest Chrome, Firefox, IE)
  • JavaScript
  • internet access (WLAN recommended)
  • 1024x768 or higher screen resolution

Your Feedback

Visit our website for more information, we would be glad to hear about your ideas or wishes on our massage board.

Background

We are two developers (34 and 35 years old) who have been realizing projects for various agencies and companies (web / applications / server) for more than 12 years.

We started programming as children on our Amiga and C64 and since then we managed many developments from assembler, BASIC, Pascal, COBOL, Delphi, Java, PHP to JavaScript and Node.js. Now we want to make a long-cherished dream come true: our own video game.

Why crowdfunding ?

For many great projects crowdfunding is a good financing opportunity. We do realize that a subscription and browser-based game is not the perfect candidate for this kind of method. But we hope that you like our concept and that we even now find players through crowdfunding who are interested in information about the project early on and even want to contribute. We are excited for your feedback!

Support us

If you don’t want to invest just yet, but want to help us to increase attention, we would be happy for you to share our website on Facebook, g+ or Twitter!
story_txt:
This text is also available in German. Go to: www.gmcgame.com/crowdfunding?l=de

The old earth is doomed to extinction and the people start to colonize a new earth. In order to prevent repeated environmental disasters and overexploitation, the new world has been put under strict protection. The exploitation of natural resources is now done by robots in faraway systems. Former transport ships have been converted to cargo ships whose operations are monitored by only one human commander. The exploiting corporations go to any length to protect their domination and are not afraid to use battleships.
In Galactic Mining Corp you are responsible for the tactical management of your corporation and in real-time battles you are fighting against other players to protect your interests. You expand your resource production, extent your fleet, configure your ships, build mine exploitation stations or defense systems and you fight for natural resources.

Galactic Mining Corp (GMC) is a real-time strategy and simulation game that offers many gameplay options:


Different ways of playing as miner, merchant, protector or pirate(can be switched during the game)
Construct individual battleships
Attack and defense, alone or together as a team
Secure planets and exploitation stations
Raw material mining and trade
Research and expansion
Train your commanders
Diplomacy: form alliances or wage war

The universe consists of:

Galaxies
Systems
Side Systems
Planets
Asteroids
Anomalies
any many more explorable objects

Galaxy
Every galaxy consists of 10 to 20 systems.
The fleets can travel between galaxies by use of jump drive. But the jump drive is inaccurate causing the fleet to reappear in a random system entering another galaxy.
Systems
Every system contains 1 to 5 colonizable planets as well as raw material asteroids.
The systems of a galaxy are interconnected by hyperspace corridors which provide secure travel between target systems.
Side Systems
The side systems contain raw material asteroids, unexplored anomalies and missions.
They can only be accessed through a hyperspace corridor of the main system.
Planets
The colonizable planets of a system yield only few resources and are protected by an intergalactic agreement against overexploitation. Only resource storage and processing is possible on them.
Asteroids
Asteroids contain extractable raw materials which are required to build ships and structures as well as for further research.

The player owns a home planet; from there the player can explore systems, build ships and structures and advance technologies.

The own planet yields only small quantities of raw materials, therefore the player has to scout the surroundings and nearby systems with a scout vessel searching for available asteroids.

With mine ships, which have been manufactured only for this purpose, the player establishes exploitation stations on asteroids. After that, a free transporter starts to carry the raw materials back to the home world.

The acquired raw materials are used to upgrade the planet, the asteroids, the fleets or for further research.

The player combats rival fleets, loots transporters, asteroids or whole planets.
Alone or in player alliances huge battles can be conducted.

Every ship can be equipped according to your own requirements with weapons and protection systems. Therefore every ship has equippable module slots.
In total 15 different ships are available, providing endless combination possibilities with their individually equippable modules.

Module Types
There are 4 module types:


Attack ModulesThese slots are available for weapons.

Defense ModulesContain defense modules like shields or armor.

Support ModulesSupport attack/defense modules or provide further abilities like tractor beams.

User-defined ModulesThese modules have to be explored for each ship and can be defined as attack, defense or support module.
5 Ship Categories
Ships are divided up to different sizes:

Corvettes
Frigates
Destroyers
Cruisers
Battleships
The size determines the amount of available modules and the basic values for attack, defense or speed.
3 Ship Orientations
Every ship category provides 3 different module configurations:

Attack
Defense
Support
Ships with attack configuration offer for example more weapon modules but less protection.

Raw material mining, transport and supply are done with civilian ships.


TransporterTransports exploited raw materials back to the home world or to a merchant.

Mine Ship / Exploitation StationEstablishes a base on asteroids and produces raw materials.

Settlement ShipExplores and colonizes new worlds.

Every ship (battleships and civilian ships) has its own commander who collects experience points completing tasks, missions and battles. These points can be invested in his skills.
The training and the commander’s development can be the crucial factor during space battles or for protecting your resources against pirate attacks.


The home world as well as its orbit and an asteroid’s orbit can be upgraded with structures:

defense systems
resource storing
shipyards
commercial center
surveillance satellites
jamming transmitters
jump distortion



MinerExpand your influence through raw material mining and explore new regions.

MerchantBe responsible for exchange and commerce of resources and gain supremacy through economic expertise.

ProtectorProtect miners and merchants from pirate attacks. You advance by using diplomacy and combat.

PirateLife as a miner is not enough for you, or are you simply evil? Then you can cause fear and terror as a pirate.
The basic gameplay is the same for every disposition; small differences are in details like raw material mining or ship’s speed.
Major differences are for example in protection contracts (for protectors) or the looting of raw material transporters (for pirates).
The gameplay choice can be changed after some playtime, this way a miner can become a pirate and vice versa.
Galactic Insurance
In space battles a player may quickly lose his fleet; therefore a galactic insurance exists, so that the flow of playing is not disturbed and all the development has not been in vain.
This insurance automatically replaces all ships and structures after a certain amount of time, so the player does not lose his progress.
In order to accelerate the restoration of a player’s structures and fleets, exploited raw materials can be invested.
Why?
In every game you find hardcore players and casual players. The casual player would be frustrated rather quickly, if he or she lost all the acquired progress through big players.
Therefore the casual player is encouraged to form alliances or to seek security from protectors.
The fun factor is supposed to remain; big players are rewarded through obtained raw materials as well as experience points.

5 € You like the idea and you are excited for the result. In addition to the beta access you get the first month playing time of the final version for free.
10 € In return for your support you get a bronze badge for early supporters in your gaming profile (every player can see the badges scanning your profile). The first 3 month playing time of the final version are for free.
15 € A commander in the game gets your name which is visible for everyone. Additionally you receive the first 6 month playing time of the final version and of course all rewards mentioned before.
20 € As faithful supporter you receive the silver badge for early supporters. Additionally you receive the first 12 month playing time of the final version and of course all rewards mentioned before.
40 € In return for your support you get a mug with "GMC - Miner" print. Additionally you receive the first 24 month playing time of the final version and of course all rewards mentioned before.
80 € For your love of the game you receive the gold badge for early supporters.Unlimited in time access to the game and of course all rewards mentioned before.
200 € Commander-EditionYour picture is immortalized within the game. A picture for a ship commander, especially adjusted for the game, will be visible for everyone.Unlimited in time access to the game and of course all rewards mentioned before.

8.000 €
GMC will be a lot of development work for us and we hope for your support.
We are two web developers and we estimate a timescale between 4 - 6 month (including beta phase) for completion.
During this time the main game features will be realized:

building ships
combat
research
colonization
commerce
missions (also for multiple players)
ranking lists
multilingualism: German / English

Whaaaaat, crowdfunding and that for a browser game with subscription model?
No, we are not crazy ! ;-)
The game needs a certain pre-financing so that we can finish it competently within the estimated 4 - 6 month (including beta phase).
We deliberately decided to include a subscription model because we want to deliver a satisfying game without unfair advantages for a small group of paying players.
Further we want to guarantee a good server infrastructure in addition to reliable support for future game maintenance.

System Requirements

HTML5 browser (latest Chrome, Firefox, IE)
JavaScript
internet access (WLAN recommended)
1024x768 or higher screen resolution
Your Feedback
Visit our website for more information, we would be glad to hear about your ideas or wishes on our massage board.
Background
We are two developers (34 and 35 years old) who have been realizing projects for various agencies and companies (web / applications / server) for more than 12 years.
We started programming as children on our Amiga and C64 and since then we managed many developments from assembler, BASIC, Pascal, COBOL, Delphi, Java, PHP to JavaScript and Node.js. Now we want to make a long-cherished dream come true: our own video game.
Why crowdfunding ?
For many great projects crowdfunding is a good financing opportunity. We do realize that a subscription and browser-based game is not the perfect candidate for this kind of method. But we hope that you like our concept and that we even now find players through crowdfunding who are interested in information about the project early on and even want to contribute. We are excited for your feedback!
Support us
If you don’t want to invest just yet, but want to help us to increase attention, we would be happy for you to share our website on Facebook, g+ or Twitter!
